 24030                                  ;	TITLE	DISK - Disk utility routines
 24031                                  ;	NAME	Disk
 24032                                  
 24033                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 24034                                  ;
 24035                                  ;	SWAPCON
 24036                                  ;	SWAPBACK
 24037                                  ;	DOS_READ
 24038                                  ;	DOS_WRITE
 24039                                  ;	get_io_sft
 24040                                  ;	DirRead
 24041                                  ;	FIRSTCLUSTER
 24042                                  ;	SET_BUF_AS_DIR
 24043                                  ;	FATSecRd
 24044                                  ;	DREAD
 24045                                  ;	CHECK_WRITE_LOCK
 24046                                  ;	CHECK_READ_LOCK
 24047                                  ;
 24048                                  ;	Revision history:
 24049                                  ;
 24050                                  ;		A000   version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 24051                                  ;
 24052                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24053                                  ;
 24054                                  ; M065 : B#5276. On raw read/write of a block of characters if a critical
 24055                                  ;		error happens, DOS retries the entire block assuming that
 24056                                  ;		zero characters were transferred. Modified the code to take
 24057                                  ;		into account the number of characters transfered before
 24058                                  ;		retrying the operation.
 24059                                  ;
 24060                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24061                                  ;
 24062                                  
 24063                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 24064                                  
 24065                                  ;Break	<SwapCon, Swap Back - Old-style I/O to files>
 24066                                  
 24067                                  ; **** Drivers for file input from devices ****
 24068                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24069                                  ;   Indicate that there is no more I/O occurring through another SFT outside
 24070                                  ;   of handles 0 and 1
 24071                                  ;
 24072                                  ;   Inputs:	DS is DOSDATA
 24073                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set to false.
 24074                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 24075                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24076                                  
 24077                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 3CF8h
 24078                                  
 24079                                  ; DOSCODE:71E3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24080                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24081                                  
 24082                                  ; DOSCODE:71CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24083                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24084                                  
 24085                                  SWAPBACK:
 24086 00003B62 C606[5703]00            	MOV	BYTE [CONSWAP],0	; signal no conswaps
 24087 00003B67 C3                      	retn
 24088                                  
 24089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24090                                  ;
 24091                                  ; Procedure Name : SWAPCON
 24092                                  ;
 24093                                  ;   Copy ThisSFT to CONSFT for use by the 1-12 primitives.
 24094                                  ;
 24095                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT as the sft of the desired file
 24096                                  ;		DS is DOSDATA
 24097                                  ;   Outputs:	CONSWAP is set.  CONSFT = ThisSFT.
 24098                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 24099                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24100                                  
 24101                                  SWAPCON:
 24102                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 24103                                  	;push	es
 24104                                  	;push	di
 24105                                  	;mov	byte [CONSWAP],1
 24106                                  	;les	di,[THISSFT]
 24107                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT],di
 24108                                  	;mov	word [CONSFT+2],es
 24109                                  	;pop	di
 24110                                  	;pop	es
 24111                                  	;retn
 24112                                  
 24113                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 24114 00003B68 C606[5703]01            	mov	byte [CONSWAP],1	; ConSwap = TRUE
 24115 00003B6D 50                      	push	ax
 24116 00003B6E A1[9E05]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT]
 24117 00003B71 A3[E605]                	mov	[CONSFT],ax
 24118 00003B74 A1[A005]                	mov	ax,[THISSFT+2]
 24119 00003B77 A3[E805]                	mov	[CONSFT+2],ax
 24120 00003B7A 58                      	pop	ax
 24121 00003B7B C3                      	retn
 24122                                  
 24123                                  ; DOSCODE:71FDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24124                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24125                                  
 24126                                  ;Break	<DOS_READ -- MAIN READ ROUTINE AND DEVICE IN ROUTINES>
 24127                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24128                                  ;
 24129                                  ; Inputs:
 24130                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24131                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24132                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to read
 24133                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 24134                                  ; Function:
 24135                                  ;	Perform read operation
 24136                                  ; Outputs:
 24137                                  ;    Carry clear
 24138                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24139                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes read
 24140                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24141                                  ;    Carry set
 24142                                  ;	AX is error code
 24143                                  ;	CX = 0
 24144                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24145                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24146                                  ;
 24147                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24148                                  
 24149                                  ;hkn; called from fcbio.asm, handle.asm and dev.asm. DS is be set up.
 24150                                  
 24151                                  ; DOSCODE:71E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24152                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24153                                  
 24154                                  ; 07/02/2024
 24155                                  ; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24156                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7B76h
 24157                                  
 24158                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:7997h)
 24159                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:71FDh)
 24160                                  
 24161                                  DOS_READ:
 24162 00003B7C C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24163                                  
 24164                                  ; Verify that the sft has been opened in a mode that allows reading.
 24165                                  
 24166                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+2]
 24167 00003B80 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24168                                  	;;and	al,0Fh	; (MSDOS 5.0 & 6.22)
 24169                                  	;AND	AL,access_mask
 24170                                  	; 06/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24171                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 & Win Me)
 24172 00003B84 2403                    	and	al,3	; open_mode_mask ?
 24173                                  
 24174                                  	;cmp	al,1
 24175 00003B86 3C01                    	CMP	AL,open_for_write
 24176 00003B88 7503                    	JNE	short READ_NO_MODE	; Is read or both
 24177 00003B8A E96406                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR
 24178                                  
 24179                                  READ_NO_MODE:
 24180 00003B8D E82405                  	call	SETUP
 24181 00003B90 E30B                    	JCXZ	NoIORet 		; no bytes to read - fast return
 24182 00003B92 E8ADDC                  	call	IsSFTNet
 24183 00003B95 7408                    	JZ	short LOCAL_READ
 24184                                  
 24185                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 24186                                  ;	transfer NET_READ
 24187                                  ;ELSE
 24188                                  	;mov	ax,1108h
 24189 00003B97 B80811                  	MOV	AX,(MultNET<<8)|8
 24190 00003B9A CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - READ FROM REMOTE FILE
 24191                                  			; ES:DI -> SFT
 24192                                  			; SFT DPB field -> DPB of drive containing file
 24193                                  			; CX = number of bytes, SS = DOS CS, SDA DTA field -> user buffer
 24194                                  			; Return: CF set on error, CX = bytes read
 24195 00003B9C C3                      	retn
 24196                                  ;ENDIF
 24197                                  
 24198                                  ; The user ended up requesting 0 bytes of input. We do nothing for this case
 24199                                  ; except return immediately.
 24200                                  
 24201                                  NoIORet:
 24202 00003B9D F8                      	CLC
 24203 00003B9E C3                      	retn
 24204                                  
 24205                                  LOCAL_READ:
 24206                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],80h
 24207                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device  ; Check for named device I/O
 24208 00003B9F 26F6450580              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device ; 02/06/2019
 24209 00003BA4 750E                    	JNZ	short READDEV
 24210

 24214 00003BAE E8F705                  	call	DISKREAD
 24215                                  
 24216                                  critexit:
 24217                                  	;call	LCritDisk
 24218                                  	;retn
 24219                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24220 00003BB1 E95BDD                  	jmp	LCritDisk
 24221                                  
 24222                                  ; We are reading from a device. Examine the status of the device to see if we
 24223                                  ; can short-circuit the I/O. If the device in the EOF state or if it is the
 24224                                  ; null device, we can safely indicate no transfer.
 24225                                  
 24226                                  READDEV:
 24227                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],4
 24228 00003BB4 C606[2303]04            	MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev
 24229                                  	;mov	bl,[es:di+5]
 24230 00003BB9 268A5D05                	MOV	BL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags]
 24231 00003BBD C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 24232                                  	;test	bl,40h
 24233 00003BC1 F6C340                  	test	BL,devid_device_EOF	; End of file?
 24234 00003BC4 7407                    	JZ	short ENDRDDEVJ3
 24235                                  	;test	bl,4
 24236 00003BC6 F6C304                  	test	BL,devid_device_null	; NUL device?
 24237 00003BC9 7405                    	JZ	short TESTRAW 		; NO
 24238 00003BCB 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; Indicate EOF by setting zero
 24239                                  ENDRDDEVJ3:
 24240                                  	; 17/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility!)
 24241                                  	;JMP	short ENDRDDEVJ2
 24242                                  	; 16/12/2022
 24243 00003BCD E93F01                  	jmp	ENDRDDEV ; 04/05/2019
 24244                                  
 24245                                  ; We need to hit the device. Figure out if we do a raw read or we do the
 24246                                  ; bizarre std_con_string_input.
 24247                                  
 24248                                  TESTRAW:
 24249                                  	;test	bl,20h
 24250 00003BD0 F6C320                  	test	BL,devid_device_raw	; Raw mode?
 24251 00003BD3 7508                    	JNZ	short DVRDRAW 		; Yes, let the device do all local editing
 24252                                  	;test	bl,1

 24350                                  ; We are going to do a cooked read on some character device. There is a
 24351                                  ; problem here, what does the data look like? Is it a terminal device, line
 24352                                  ; CR line CR line CR, or is it file data, line CR LF line CR LF? Does it have
 24353                                  ; a ^Z at the end which is data, or is the ^Z not data?  In any event we're
 24354                                  ; going to do this: Read in pieces up to CR (CRs included in data) or ^z (^z
 24355                                  ; included in data). this "simulates" the way con works in cooked mode
 24356                                  ; reading one line at a time. With file data, however, the lines will look

 24689                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 24690                                  
 24691                                  ;Break	<DOS_WRITE -- MAIN WRITE ROUTINE AND DEVICE OUT ROUTINES>
 24692                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24693                                  ;
 24694                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_WRITE
 24695                                  ;
 24696                                  ; Inputs:
 24697                                  ;	ThisSFT set to the SFT for the file being used
 24698                                  ;	[DMAADD] contains transfer address
 24699                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes to write
 24700                                  ; Function:
 24701                                  ;	Perform write operation
 24702                                  ;	NOTE: If CX = 0 on input, file is truncated or grown
 24703                                  ;		to current sf_position
 24704                                  ; Outputs:
 24705                                  ;    Carry clear
 24706                                  ;	SFT Position and cluster pointers updated
 24707                                  ;	CX = No. of bytes written
 24708                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24709                                  ;    Carry set
 24710                                  ;	AX is error code
 24711                                  ;	CX = 0
 24712                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 24713                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed
 24714                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24715                                  	
 24716                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24717                                  ; DOSCODE:742Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 24718                                  
 24719                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 24720                                  ; DOSCODE:7418h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 24721                                  
 24722                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 24723                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:7D8Fh
 24724                                  
 24725                                  DOS_WRITE:
 24726 00003D7D C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 24727                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 24728 00003D81 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 24729                                  	;;and	al,0Fh

 24743                                  ;	    of a read only file which can then be written to.
 24744                                  ;	This is OK because we are NOT ALLOWED to OPEN a RO file via handles
 24745                                  ;	    for writting, or RE-CREATE an EXISTING RO file via handles. Thus,
 24746                                  ;	    CREATing a NEW RO file, or RE-CREATing an existing file which
 24747                                  ;	    is NOT RO to be RO, via handles are the only times we can write
 24748                                  ;	    to a read-only file.

 25020                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25021                                  ;
 25022                                  ; Procedure Name : get_io_sft
 25023                                  ;
 25024                                  ;   Convert JFN number in BX to sf_entry in DS:SI We get the normal SFT if
 25025                                  ;   CONSWAP is FALSE or if the handle desired is 2 or more. Otherwise, we
 25026                                  ;   retrieve the sft from ConSFT which is set by SwapCon.
 25027                                  ;
 25028                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25029                                  
 25030                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25031                                  ; DOSCODE:7583h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25032                                  ; 17/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25033                                  ; DOSCODE:756Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25034                                  
 25035                                  GET_IO_SFT:
 25036                                  	;test	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0FFh
 25037 00003ECE 36803E[5703]00          	cmp	byte [SS:CONSWAP],0			;smr;SS Override
 25038 00003ED4 7512                    	JNZ	short GetRedir
 25039                                  GetNormal:
 25040 00003ED6 16                      	push	ss
 25041 00003ED7 1F                      	pop	ds
 25042 00003ED8 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25043 00003ED9 57                      	PUSH	DI
 25044 00003EDA E8FB37                  	call	SFFromHandle
 25045 00003EDD 7206                    	JC	short RET44P
 25046 00003EDF 8CC6                    	MOV	SI,ES
 25047 00003EE1 8EDE                    	MOV	DS,SI
 25048 00003EE3 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 25049                                  RET44P:
 25050 00003EE5 5F                      	POP	DI
 25051 00003EE6 07                      	POP	ES
 25052 00003EE7 C3                      	retn
 25053                                  GetRedir:
 25054 00003EE8 83FB01                  	CMP	BX,1
 25055 00003EEB 77E9                    	JA	short GetNormal
 25056 00003EED 36C536[E605]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CONSFT]
 25057 00003EF2 F8                      	CLC
 25058                                  get_io_sft_retn:
 25059 00003EF3 C3                      	retn

 25061                                  ;Break	<DIRREAD -- READ A DIRECTORY SECTOR>
 25062                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25063                                  ;
 25064                                  ; Procedure Name : DIRREAD
 25065                                  ;
 25066                                  ; Inputs:
 25067                                  ;	AX = Directory block number (relative to first block of directory)
 25068                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25069                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = First sector of first cluster of directory
 25070                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster
 25071                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 25072                                  ; Function:
 25073                                  ;	Read the directory block into [CURBUF].
 25074                                  ; Outputs:
 25075                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM] = Next cluster (after the one skipped to)
 25076                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] Set
 25077                                  ;	ES:BP unchanged
 25078                                  ;	[CURBUF] Points to Buffer with dir sector
 25079                                  ;	Carry set if error (user said FAIL to I 24)
 25080                                  ; DS preserved, all other registers destroyed.
 25081                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25082                                  
 25083                                  ;hkn; called from dir.asm. DS already set up to DOSDATA.
 25084                                  
 25085                                  ; 08/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 25086                                  
 25087                                  DIRREAD:
 25088                                  
 25089                                  ; Note that ClusFac is the sectors per cluster. This is NOT necessarily
 25090                                  ; the same as what is in the DPB! In the case of the root directory, we have
 25091                                  ; ClusFac = # sectors in the root directory. The root directory is detected
 25092                                  ; by DIRStart = 0.
 25093                                  
 25094 00003EF4 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 25095                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25096 00003EF6 3916[DC0A]              	cmp	[DIRSTART_HW],dx
 25097 00003EFA 7509                    	jnz	short SubDir
 25098                                  	;CMP	word [DIRSTART],0
 25099                                  	; 21/09/2023
 25100 00003EFC 3916[C205]              	cmp	[DIRSTART],dx ; 0
 25101 00003F00 7503                    	jnz	short SubDir
 25102 00003F02 92                      	XCHG	AX,DX
 25103 00003F03 EB0C                    	JMP	short DoRead
 25104                                  
 25105                                  ; Convert the sector number in AX into cluster and sector-within-cluster pair
 25106                                  
 25107                                  SubDir:
 25108 00003F05 88C2                    	MOV	DL,AL
 25109                                  	;and	dl,[es:bp+4]
 25110 00003F07 26225604                	AND	DL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 25111                                  
 25112                                  ;	(DX) = sector-in-cluster
 25113                                  
 25114                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 25115 00003F0B 268A4E05                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 25116 00003F0F D3E8                    	SHR	AX,CL
 25117                                  
 25118                                  ;	(DX) = position in cluster
 25119                                  ;	(AX) = number of clusters to skip
 25120                                  
 25121                                  DoRead:
 25122 00003F11 8816[7305]              	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],DL
 25123 00003F15 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 25124 00003F17 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 25125                                  
 25126                                  ;	(CX) = number of clusters to skip.
 25127                                  ;	(AH) = remainder
 25128                                  
 25129                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25130                                  
 25131                                  ; 08/02/2024
 25132                                  %if 0
 25133                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25134                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC+2]	     	  ;>32mb
 25135                                  	;MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	  ;>32mb
 25136                                  	;MOV	DX,[DIRSEC]
 25137                                  	;ADD	DL,AH
 25138                                  	;ADC	DH,0
 25139                                  	;ADC	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0	  ;>32mb
 25140                                  	; 21/09/2023
 25141                                  	xor	bx,bx ; 0
 25142                                  	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 25143                                  	add	dl,ah
 25144                                  	adc	dh,bl ; 0
 25145                                  	adc	bx,[DIRSEC+2]
 25146                                  	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],bx
 25147                                  
 25148                                  	MOV	BX,[CLUSNUM]
 25149                                  	MOV	[NXTCLUSNUM],BX
 25150                                  	JCXZ	FIRSTCLUSTER
 25151                                  %else
 25152                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25153 00003F19 8B1E[DE0A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM_HW]
 25154 00003F1D 891E[E00A]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM_HW],bx
 25155 00003F21 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 25156 00003F25 8B16[C005]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC+2]
 25157 00003F29 8916[0706]              	mov	[HIGH_SECTOR],dx
 25158 00003F2D 8B16[BE05]              	mov	dx,[DIRSEC]
 25159 00003F31 00E2                    	add	dl,ah
 25160 00003F33 80D600                  	adc	dh,0
 25161 00003F36 8316[0706]00            	adc	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0
 25162 00003F3B 8B1E[BC05]              	mov	bx,[CLUSNUM]
 25163 00003F3F 891E[DC05]              	mov	[NXTCLUSNUM],bx
 25164 00003F43 E339                    	jcxz	FIRSTCLUSTER
 25165                                  %endif
 25166                                  
 25167                                  SKPCLLP:
 25168 00003F45 E89E23                  	call	UNPACK
 25169 00003F48 72A9                    	jc	short get_io_sft_retn
 25170                                  	;;;
 25171                                  	; 08/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 25172 00003F4A FF36[E80A]              	push	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 25173 00003F4E 8F06[F20A]              	pop	word [CLUSTERS_HW]
 25174 00003F52 FF36[EC0A]              	push	word [CCONTENT_HW]
 25175 00003F56 8F06[E80A]              	pop	word [CLUSTNUM_HW]
 25176                                  	;;;

 25187                                  	;
 25188 00003F6F 8B1E[F20A]              	mov	bx,[CLUSTERS_HW]
 25189 00003F73 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 25190                                  	;;;
 25191 00003F77 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI
 25192 00003F79 88E3                    	MOV	BL,AH
 25193 00003F7B E81E1A                  	call	FIGREC
 25194

 25227                                  ;
 25228                                  ; Procedure Name : FATSECRD
 25229                                  ; Inputs:
 25230                                  ;	Same as DREAD
 25231                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25232                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25233                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number
 25234                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25235                                  ; Function:
 25236                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform FAT read.
 25237                                  ; Outputs:
 25238                                  ;	Same as DREAD

 25240

 25250 00003F96 89CF                    	MOV	DI,CX
 25251                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+8]
 25252 00003F98 268A4E08                	MOV	CL,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_COUNT]

 25260 00003FA0 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH
 25261                                  	;;;

 25265                                  	;test	byte [es:bp+23h],80h

 25269 00003FAD B101                    	mov	cl,1

 25327                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25328                                  ;
 25329                                  ; Procedure Name : DREAD
 25330                                  ;
 25331                                  ; Inputs:
 25332                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25333                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25334                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	      (LOW)
 25335                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25336                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25337                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case call to HARDERR needed
 25338                                  ; Function:
 25339                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk read. If BIOS reports
 25340                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25341                                  ; Outputs:
 25342                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILED to INT 24)
 25343                                  ; DS,ES:BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25344                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 25349 00003FF6 7497                    	jz	short dirread_retn	; Carry clear
 25350                                  ;hkn; SS override

 25352 00003FFE E89A00                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25353 00004001 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25354 00004003 74EE                    	JZ	short DREAD
 25355                                  
 25356                                  fail_ignore:	; 09/02/2024

 25383                                  ; Function:

 25397 00004013 26F6450408              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],attr_volume_id ;volume id
 25398                                  	;JZ	short write_cont			     ;no
 25399                                  	;;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25400                                  	;;retn
 25401                                  	;;jnz	SET_ACC_ERR_DS

 25403                                  	;jz	short write_cont
 25404                                  	;jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25405                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 25406 00004018 7403                    	JZ	short write_cont
 25407                                  	;call	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25408                                  	;retn
 25409                                  	; 16/12/2022
 25410 0000401A E9D201                  	jmp	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25411                                  
 25412                                  write_cont:				;
 25413 0000401D 51                      	PUSH	CX			;save reg
 25414 0000401E 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;
 25415 00004020 7501                    	JNZ	short Not_Truncate	;
 25416 00004022 49                      	dec	cx			;(cx) = -1; check for lock on whole file
 25417                                  Not_Truncate:				;
 25418 00004023 B080                    	MOV	AL,80H			;check write access
 25419 00004025 E8C143                  	call	LOCK_CHECK		;check lock
 25420 00004028 59                      	POP	CX			;restore reg
 25421 00004029 7305                    	JNC	short WRITE_OK		;lock ok
 25422 0000402B E87301                  	call	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION	;issue I24
 25423 0000402E 73ED                    	JNC	short write_cont	;retry
 25424                                  WRITE_OK:				;
 25425 00004030 C3                      	retn				;

 25471                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 25473                                  
 25474                                  ;	TITLE	DISK2 - Disk utility routines
 25475                                  ;	NAME	Disk2
 25476                                  
 25477                                  ;**	Low level Read and write routines for local SFT I/O on files and devs
 25478                                  ;
 25479                                  ;	DskRead
 25480                                  ;	DWRITE
 25481                                  ;	DSKWRITE
 25482                                  ;	HarderrRW
 25483                                  ;	SETUP
 25484                                  ;	BREAKDOWN
 25485                                  ;	READ_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25486                                  ;	WRITE_LOCK_VIOLATION
 25487                                  ;	DISKREAD
 25488                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 25489                                  ;	SET_ACC_ERR
 25490                                  ;	SETSFT
 25491                                  ;	SETCLUS
 25492                                  ;	AddRec
 25493                                  ;
 25494                                  ;	Revision history:
 25495                                  ;
 25496                                  ;		AN000 version 4.00 Jan. 1988
 25497                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk read/write optimization
 25498                                  
 25499                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25500                                  ; DOSCODE:7699h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 25501                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25502                                  ; DOSCODE:7685h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 25503                                  
 25504                                  ;Break	<DSKREAD -- PHYSICAL DISK READ>
 25505                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25506                                  ;
 25507                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKREAD
 25508                                  ;
 25509                                  ; Inputs:
 25510                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25511                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25512                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25513                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25514                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25515                                  ; Function:
 25516                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25517                                  ; Outputs:
 25518                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25519                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25520                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25521                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25522                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25523                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25524                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25525                                  
 25526                                  DSKREAD:
 25527 00004048 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25528                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 25529 00004049 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 25530                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 25531 0000404D 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 25532 00004051 53                      	PUSH	BX
 25533 00004052 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25534 00004053 E8C512                  	call	SETREAD
 25535 00004056 EB22                    	JMP	short DODSKOP
 25536                                  
 25537                                  ;Break	<DWRITE -- SEE ABOUT WRITING>
 25538                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25539                                  ;
 25540                                  ; Procedure Name : DWRITE
 25541                                  ;
 25542                                  ; Inputs:
 25543                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer address
 25544                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25545                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25546                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25547                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25548                                  ;	[ALLOWED] must be set in case HARDERR called
 25549                                  ; Function:
 25550                                  ;	Calls BIOS to perform disk write. If BIOS reports
 25551                                  ;	errors, will call HARDERRRW for further action.
 25552                                  ; Output:
 25553                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently, user FAILed to I 24)
 25554                                  ; BP preserved. All other registers destroyed.
 25555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25556                                  
 25557                                  	;entry	DWRITE
 25558                                  DWRITE:
 25559 00004058 E81100                  	CALL	DSKWRITE
 25560 0000405B 74EA                    	jz	short dw_ret_label	; Carry clear (retz)
 25561                                  
 25562                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25563 0000405D 36C606[7505]01          	MOV	BYTE [SS:READOP],1	; Write
 25564 00004063 E83500                  	call	HARDERRRW
 25565 00004066 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1			; Check for retry
 25566 00004068 74EE                    	JZ	short DWRITE
 25567                                  
 25568                                  ; 09/02/2024
 25569                                  %if 0
 25570                                  	CMP	AL,3			; Check for FAIL
 25571                                  	CLC
 25572                                  	JNZ	short NO_CAR2 		; Ignore
 25573                                  	STC
 25574                                  NO_CAR2:
 25575                                  dw_ret_label:
 25576                                  	retn
 25577                                  %else
 25578                                  	; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 25579 0000406A EB99                    	jmp	short fail_ignore
 25580                                  %endif
 25581                                  
 25582                                  ;Break	<DSKWRITE -- PHYSICAL DISK WRITE>
 25583                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25584                                  ;
 25585                                  ; Procedure Name : DSKWRITE
 25586                                  ;
 25587                                  ; Inputs:
 25588                                  ;	DS:BX = Transfer addr
 25589                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors
 25590                                  ;	DX = Absolute record number	       (LOW)
 25591                                  ;	[HIGH_SECTOR] = Absolute record number (HIGH)
 25592                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25593                                  ; Function:
 25594                                  ;	Call BIOS to perform disk read
 25595                                  ; Outputs:
 25596                                  ;	DI = CX on entry
 25597                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors unsuccessfully transfered
 25598                                  ;	AX = Status word as returned by BIOS (error code in AL if error)
 25599                                  ;	Zero set if OK (from BIOS) (carry clear)
 25600                                  ;	Zero clear if error (carry clear)
 25601                                  ; SI Destroyed, others preserved
 25602                                  ;
 25603                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25604                                  
 25605                                  	;entry	DSKWRITE
 25606                                  DSKWRITE:
 25607 0000406C 51                      	PUSH	CX
 25608                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; 04/05/2019
 25609 0000406D 268A6617                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 25610                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+1]
 25611 00004071 268A4601                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 25612 00004075 53                      	PUSH	BX
 25613 00004076 06                      	PUSH	ES
 25614 00004077 E8D412                  	call	SETWRITE
 25615                                  DODSKOP:
 25616 0000407A 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS		; Save DS
 25617 0000407C 1F                      	POP	DS		; DS:BP points to DPB
 25618 0000407D 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 25619                                  
 25620                                  	;lds	si,[ds:bp+13h] ; 04/05/2019
 25621 0000407E 3EC57613                	LDS	SI,[ds:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; 07/09/2018
 25622 00004082 E81512                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 25623                                  
 25624 00004085 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX		; Restore DS
 25625 00004087 07                      	POP	ES		; Restore ES
 25626 00004088 5B                      	POP	BX
 25627                                  
 25628                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25629 00004089 368B0E[6C03]            	MOV	CX,[SS:CALLSCNT] ; Number of sectors transferred
 25630 0000408E 5F                      	POP	DI
 25631 0000408F 29F9                    	SUB	CX,DI
 25632 00004091 F7D9                    	NEG	CX		; Number of sectors not transferred
 25633                                  
 25634                                  ;hkn; SS override
 25635 00004093 36A1[5D03]              	MOV	AX,[SS:DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 25636                                  	;test	ax,8000h
 25637                                  	; 17/12/2022
 25638                                  	;test	ah,80h
 25639 00004097 F6C480                  	test	ah,(STERR>>8)
 25640                                  	;test	AX,STERR
 25641 0000409A C3                      	retn
 25642                                  
 25643                                  ;Break	<HardErrRW - map extended errors and call harderr>
 25644                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25645                                  ;
 25646                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErrRW
 25647                                  ;
 25648                                  ; Inputs:
 25649                                  ;	AX is error code from read or write
 25650                                  ;	Other registers set as per HARDERR
 25651                                  ; Function:
 25652                                  ;	Checks the error code for special extended
 25653                                  ;	errors and maps them if needed. Then invokes
 25654                                  ;	Harderr
 25655                                  ; Outputs:
 25656                                  ;	Of HARDERR
 25657                                  ; AX may be modified prior to call to HARDERR.
 25658                                  ; No other registers altered.
 25659                                  ;
 25660                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25661                                  
 25662                                  	; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 25663                                  HARDERRRW:
 25664                                  	;cmp	al,0Fh
 25665 0000409B 3C0F                    	CMP	AL,error_I24_wrong_disk
 25666 0000409D 7512                    	JNZ	short DO_ERR			; Nothing to do
 25667                                  
 25668                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 25669                                  	;push	ds
 25670                                  	;push	si
 25671                                  	;lds	si,[ss:CALLVIDRW]
 25672                                  	;mov	[ss:EXTERRPT+2], ds
 25673                                  	;mov	[ss:EXTERRPT], si
 25674                                  	;pop	si
 25675                                  	;pop	ds
 25676                                  
 25677                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 25678 0000409F 50                      	push	ax
 25679 000040A0 36A1[7003]              	mov	ax,[SS:CALLVIDRW]		; get ptr lo  ;smr;SS Override
 25680 000040A4 36A3[2803]              	mov	[ss:EXTERRPT],ax		; set ext err ptr lo
 25681 000040A8 36A1[7203]              	mov	ax,[SS:CALLVIDRW+2]		; get ptr hi from dev
 25682 000040AC 36A3[2A03]              	mov	[ss:EXTERRPT+2],ax		; set ext err ptr hi
 25683 000040B0 58                      	pop	ax
 25684                                  DO_ERR:
 25685                                  	;;call	HARDERR
 25686                                  	;;retn
 25687                                  	; 16/12/2022
 25688                                  	; 10/06/2019
 25689 000040B1 E9A51F                  	jmp	HARDERR	
 25690                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 25691                                  	;call	HARDERR
 25692                                  	;retn
 25693                                  
 25694                                  ; 24/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 25695                                  
 25696                                  ;Break	<SETUP -- SETUP A DISK READ OR WRITE FROM USER>
 25697                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25698                                  ;
 25699                                  ; Procedure Name : SETUP
 25700                                  ;
 25701                                  ; Inputs:
 25702                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT (value also in THISSFT)
 25703                                  ;	DMAAdd contains transfer address
 25704                                  ;	CX = Byte count
 25705                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 25706                                  ;   WARNING Stack must be clean, two ret addrs on stack, 1st of caller,
 25707                                  ;		2nd of caller of caller.
 25708                                  ; Outputs:
 25709                                  ;	    CX = byte count
 25710                                  ;	    [THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters if file
 25711                                  ;		      = Pointer to device header if device or NET
 25712                                  ;	    ES:DI Points to SFT
 25713                                  ;	    [NEXTADD] = Displacement of disk transfer within segment
 25714                                  ;	    [TRANS] = 0 (No transfers yet)
 25715                                  ;	    BytPos = Byte position in file
 25716                                  ;
 25717                                  ;	The following fields are relevant to local files (not devices) only:
 25718                                  ;
 25719                                  ;	    SecPos = Position of first sector (local files only)
 25720                                  ;	    [BYTSECPOS] = Byte position in first sector (local files only)
 25721                                  ;	    [CLUSNUM] = First cluster (local files only)
 25722                                  ;	    [SECCLUSPOS] = Sector within first cluster (local files only)
 25723                                  ;	    [THISDRV] = Physical unit number (local files only)
 25724                                  ;
 25725                                  ;      RETURNS ONE LEVEL UP WITH:
 25726                                  ;	   CX = 0
 25727                                  ;	   CARRY = Clear
 25728                                  ;	IF AN ERROR IS DETECTED

 25877                                  ;Break	<BREAKDOWN -- CUT A USER READ OR WRITE INTO PIECES>
 25878                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25879                                  ;
 25880                                  ; Procedure Name : BREAKDOWN
 25881                                  ;
 25882                                  ; Inputs:
 25883                                  ;	CX = Length of disk transfer in bytes
 25884                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 25885                                  ;	[BYTSECPOS] = Byte position within first sector
 25886                                  ;	DS = DOSDATA
 25887                                  ; Outputs:
 25888                                  ;	[BYTCNT1] = Bytes to transfer in first sector
 25889                                  ;	[SECCNT] = No. of whole sectors to transfer
 25890                                  ;	[BYTCNT2] = Bytes to transfer in last sector
 25891                                  ; AX, BX, DX destroyed. No other registers affected.
 25892                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25893                                  
 25894                                  BREAKDOWN:

 25896 0000415A 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX
 25897 0000415C 09C0                    	OR	AX,AX
 25898 0000415E 740E                    	JZ	short SAVFIR	; Partial first sector?
 25899                                  	;sub	ax,[es:bp+2]
 25900 00004160 262B4602                	SUB	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 25901 00004164 F7D8                    	NEG	AX		; Max number of bytes left in first sector
 25902 00004166 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX		; Subtract from total length
 25903 00004168 7304                    	JAE	short SAVFIR
 25904 0000416A 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX		; Don't use all of the rest of the sector
 25905 0000416C 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX		; And no bytes are left
 25906                                  SAVFIR:

 25908 00004171 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 25909 00004173 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX
 25910                                  	;div	word [ES:BP+2]

 25913 0000417C 8916[D405]              	MOV	[BYTCNT2],DX	; Bytes remaining for last sector

 25921                                  	;MOV	[SECCNT],DX	; DX = 0
 25922                                  _RET45:

 26373                                  ; Procedure Name : SETSFT
 26374                                  ; Inputs:

 26379                                  ; Outputs:

 26456                                  ; 25/07/2018
 26457                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 26458                                  ;Break   <DskRdBufScan -- Disk Read Buffer Scan>
 26459                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26460                                  ;
 26461                                  ; Procedure Name : DskRdBufScan
 26462                                  ;
 26463                                  ; Inputs:
 26464                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
 26465                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 26466                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 26467                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
 26468                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 26469                                  ;
 26470                                  ; Function:
 26471                                  ;	The Buffer Queue is scanned: the contents of any dirty buffers are
 26472                                  ;	"read" into the transfer memory block, so that the transfer memory
 26473                                  ;	reflects the most recent data.
 26474                                  ;
 26475                                  ; Outputs:
 26476                                  ;       Transfer memory updated as required.
 26477                                  ;
 26478                                  ; Uses:
 26479                                  ;       DS,AX,BX,CX,SI,DI destroyed.
 26480                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 26481                                  ;
 26482                                  ; Notes:
 26483                                  ;       FIRST_BUFF_ADDR is set-up to contain the LAST buffer to check, rather
 26484                                  ;	than the FIRST.
 26485                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26486                                  ;M039: Created
 26487                                  
 26488                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26489                                  ; DOSCODE:78F0h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 26490                                  
 26491                                  ; 18/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26492                                  ; DOSCODE:78DCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 26493                                  
 26494                                  ; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26495                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8313h
 26496                                  
 26497                                  ;procedure DskRdBufScan,NEAR
 26498                                  ;
 26499                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 26500                                  
 26501                                  DskRdBufScan:
 26502 000042DA 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0 ; Any dirty buffers?
 26503 000042E0 743C                    	je	short bufx		     ; -no, skip all work.
 26504                                  
 26505 000042E2 368B1E[0706]            	mov     bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 26506 000042E7 89DE                    	mov     si,bx
 26507 000042E9 01D1                    	add     cx,dx
 26508 000042EB 83D600                  	adc     si,0
 26509                                  
 26510 000042EE E8CD25                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> 1st buf in queue.
 26511                                  	;mov	ax,[di+2]
 26512 000042F1 8B4502                  	mov     ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]
 26513 000042F4 36A3[7E11]              	mov     [ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],ax
 26514                                  		
 26515                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26516                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 26517                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 26518                                  	; 15/12/2022
 26519 000042F8 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 26520                                  
 26521                                  ;       BX:DX = Extent start.
 26522                                  ;       SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 26523                                  ;          AL = Drive #.
 26524                                  ;       DS:DI-> 1st buffer in queue.
 26525                                  ;[FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] = Address offset of last buffer in queue.
 26526                                  
 26527                                  bufq:	
 26528                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 26529 000042FC 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 26530 000042FF 7514                    	jne	short bufq1        	;  -no, jump.
 26531                                  
 26532                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26533                                  ;       ja	short bufq1		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 26534                                  
 26535                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 26536 00004301 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26537 00004304 7503                    	jne	short bufq01
 26538                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 26539 00004306 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26540                                  bufq01:
 26541 00004309 770A                    	ja	short bufq1
 26542                                  
 26543                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 26544                                  ;       ja	short bufq2		;Jump if Extent end >= buffer sector.
 26545                                  
 26546                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 26547 0000430B 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 26548 0000430E 7503                    	jne	short bufq02
 26549                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 26550 00004310 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26551                                  bufq02:
 26552 00004313 770A                    	ja	short bufq2
 26553                                  bufq1:	
 26554 00004315 363B3E[7E11]            	cmp     di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 26555 0000431A 8B3D                    	mov	di,[di]
 26556                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ; Set-up for next buffer.
 26557 0000431C 75DE                    	jne	short bufq		; -no, do next buffer
 26558                                  bufx:
 26559 0000431E C3                      	retn				;Exit.
 26560                                  
 26561                                  ;       Buffer's sector is in Extent: if it is dirty, copy its contents to
 26562                                  ;	transfer memory; otherwise, just re-position it in the buffer queue
 26563                                  ;       as MRU (Most Recently Used).
 26564                                  
 26565                                  bufq2:	
 26566 0000431F 50                      	push	ax
 26567                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 26568 00004320 F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 26569 00004324 7430                    	jz	short bufq3                    ; -no, jump.
 26570                                  
 26571                                  ;       SaveReg <cx,dx,si,di,es>
 26572 00004326 51                      	push	cx
 26573 00004327 52                      	push	dx
 26574 00004328 56                      	push	si
 26575 00004329 57                      	push	di
 26576 0000432A 06                      	push	es
 26577                                  
 26578 0000432B 89D0                    	mov     ax,dx
 26579                                  	;sub	ax,[di+6]
 26580 0000432D 2B4506                  	sub	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 26581 00004330 F7D8                    	neg	ax
 26582                                  
 26583                                  ;       AX = offset (in sectors) of buffer sector within Transfer memory
 26584                                  ;            block. (Note: the upper word of the sector # may be ignored
 26585                                  ;	     since no more than 64k bytes will ever be read. This 64k limit
 26586                                  ;            is imposed by the input parameters of the disk read operation.)
 26587                                  
 26588                                  	;lea	si,[di+20]
 26589 00004332 8D7518                  	lea	si,[di+BUFINSIZ]	;DS:SI -> buffer data.
 26590                                  	;mov	cx,[es:bp+2]
 26591 00004335 268B4E02                	mov     cx,[es:bp+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ;CX = sector size (in bytes).
 26592 00004339 F7E1                    	mul     cx			;AX = offset (in bytes) of buf. sector
 26593                                  	;mov	di,[ss:TEMP_VAR]
 26594                                  	; 09/02/2024
 26595 0000433B 36C43E[0C06]            	les	di,[ss:TEMP_VAR]
 26596 00004340 01C7                    	add	di,ax
 26597                                  	;mov	es,[ss:TEMP_VAR2]
 26598 00004342 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 26599                                  
 26600                                  ;	   CX = sector size (in WORDs) ; CF=1 if odd # of bytes.
 26601                                  ;       DS:SI-> Buffer sector data.
 26602                                  ;       ES:DI-> Destination within Transfer memory block.
 26603                                  
 26604                                  ; 09/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26605                                  %if 0
 26606                                  	rep	movsw			;Copy buffer sector to Transfer memory
 26607                                  	;; 04/05/2019
 26608                                  	;;adc	cx,0                    ;CX=1 if odd # of bytes, else CX=0.
 26609                                  	;;rep	movsb                   ;Copy last byte.
 26610                                  	;jnc	short bufq03
 26611                                  	;movsb
 26612                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 26613                                  	;adc	cx,0
 26614                                  	;rep	movsb
 26615                                  	; 22/09/2023
 26616                                  	jnc	short bufq03
 26617                                  	movsb
 26618                                  %else
 26619                                  	;;;
 26620                                  	; 09/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 26621 00004344 36803E[6A00]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DDMOVE],0
 26622                                  	;jz	short bufq03+1 ; rep movsw (skip 32bit prefix)
 26623                                  	; 06/04/2024 
 26624 0000434A 7403                    	jz	short bufq03
 26625 0000434C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 26626                                  ;bufq03:
 26627                                  	;rep	movsd
 26628                                  	; 06/04/2024
 26629 0000434E 66                      	db	66h	; 32bit prefix
 26630                                  bufq03:
 26631 0000434F F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 26632                                  	;;;
 26633                                  %endif
 26634                                  
 26635                                  ;bufq03:	; 09/02/2024
 26636                                  	;RestoreReg <es,di,si,dx,cx>
 26637 00004351 07                      	pop	es
 26638 00004352 5F                      	pop	di
 26639 00004353 5E                      	pop	si
 26640 00004354 5A                      	pop	dx
 26641 00004355 59                      	pop	cx
 26642                                  
 26643                                  ;       DS:DI -> current buffer.
 26644                                  bufq3:	
 26645 00004356 89F8                    	mov     ax,di			;DS:AX -> Current buffer.
 26646                                          ;invoke SCANPLACE
 26647 00004358 E87525                  	call	SCANPLACE
 26648 0000435B 363B06[7E11]            	cmp	ax,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR] ;Last buffer?
 26649 00004360 58                      	pop	ax
 26650                                  	;jne	short bufq		; -no, jump.
 26651                                  	;;jmp	short bufx		; -yes, exit.
 26652                                  	;; 12/06/2019
 26653                                  	;retn
 26654                                  	; 18/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compability)
 26655 00004361 7599                    	jne	short bufq
 26656                                  	;jmp	short bufx
 26657                                  	; 09/02/2024
 26658 00004363 C3                      	retn	; Exit
 26659                                  
 26660                                  ;EndProc DskRdBufScan
 26661

 26671                                  ; Procedure Name : DISKWRITE
 26672                                  ;
 26673                                  ; Inputs:
 26674                                  ;       Outputs of SETUP
 26675                                  ; Function:
 26676                                  ;       Perform disk write
 26677                                  ; Outputs:
 26678                                  ;    Carry clear
 26679                                  ;       CX = No. of bytes written
 26680                                  ;       ES:DI point to SFT

 26688                                  ; DOSCODE:797Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 26689                                  
 26690                                  ; 20/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 26691                                  ; DOSCODE:7966h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 27606                                  	;xchg	bx,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_fcluster]	; first cluster (32 bit) lw !?
 27607                                  	;;;
