 27659                                  ;Break   <DskWrtBufPurge -- Disk Write Buffer Purge>
 27660                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27661                                  ;
 27662                                  ; Procedure Name : DskWrtBufPurge
 27663                                  ;
 27664                                  ; Inputs:
 27665                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
 27666                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
 27667                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
 27668                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
 27669                                  ;
 27670                                  ; Function:
 27671                                  ;       Purge the Buffer Queue and the Secondary Cache of any buffers which
 27672                                  ;	are in Extent; they are being over-written.
 27673                                  ;
 27674                                  ; Outputs:
 27675                                  ;       (Same as Input.)
 27676                                  ; Uses:
 27677                                  ;       All registers except DS,AX,SI,DI preserved.
 27678                                  ;       SS override for all global variables.
 27679                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27680                                  ;M039: Created
 27681                                  
 27682                                  ;procedure   DskWrtBufPurge,NEAR
 27683                                  ;
 27684                                  ;ASSUME  DS:NOTHING
 27685                                  
 27686                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27687                                  ; DOSCODE:7C0Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27688                                  
 27689                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27690                                  ; DOSCODE:7BD4h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27691                                  
 27692                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27693                                  ; DOSCODE:8714h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27694                                  
 27695                                  ; NOTE: Secondary (Buffer) Cache is not used in PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27696                                  
 27697                                  ; (Win ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:BB93h)
 27698                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - DOSCODE:7C0Eh)
 27699                                  
 27700                                  DskWrtBufPurge:
 27701                                  	;SaveReg <bx,cx>
 27702 000046C3 53                      	push	bx
 27703 000046C4 51                      	push	cx
 27704                                  
 27705 000046C5 368B1E[0706]            	mov	bx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]	;BX:DX = Extent start (sector #).
 27706 000046CA 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 27707 000046CC 01D1                    	add	cx,dx
 27708 000046CE 83D600                  	adc	si,0                    ;SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27709                                  
 27710                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 27711                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+0]
 27712                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+DPB.DRIVE]
 27713                                  	; 15/12/2022
 27714 000046D1 268A4600                	mov	al,[es:bp]
 27715                                  
 27716                                  ; 10/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27717                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 27718                                  %if 0
 27719                                  
 27720                                  ;	BX:DX = Extent start.
 27721                                  ;	SI:CX = Extent end + 1.
 27722                                  ;	AL = Drive #
 27723                                  
 27724                                  	cmp	word [ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT],0 ;Secondary cache in-use?
 27725                                  	je	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27726                                  
 27727                                  ;	If any of the sectors to be written are in the secondary cache (SC),
 27728                                  ;	invalidate the entire SC. (This is an optimization; we really only
 27729                                  ;	need to invalidate those sectors which intersect, but that's slower.)
 27730                                  
 27731                                  	cmp	al,[ss:CurSC_DRIVE]	;Same drive?
 27732                                  	jne	short nosc		; -no, jump.
 27733                                  
 27734                                  	push    ax
 27735                                  	mov     ax,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR]
 27736                                  	mov     di,[ss:CurSC_SECTOR+2]	;DI:AX = SC start.
 27737                                  
 27738                                  	;Cmp32	si,cx,di,ax		;Extent end < SC start?
 27739                                  	;jbe	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27740                                  
 27741                                  	cmp	si,di
 27742                                  	jne	short sc01
 27743                                  	cmp	cx,ax
 27744                                  sc01: 
 27745                                  	jbe	short sc5
 27746                                  
 27747                                  	add	ax,[ss:SC_CACHE_COUNT]
 27748                                  	adc	di,0                    ;DI:AX = SC end + 1.
 27749                                  	
 27750                                  	;Cmp32	bx,dx,di,ax             ;Extent start > SC end?
 27751                                  	;jae	short sc5		; -yes, jump.
 27752                                  
 27753                                  	cmp	bx,di
 27754                                  	jne	short sc02
 27755                                  	cmp	dx,ax
 27756                                  sc02:
 27757                                  	jnb	short sc5
 27758                                  
 27759                                  	mov	word [ss:SC_STATUS],0	;Extent intersects SC: invalidate SC.
 27760                                  sc5:	
 27761                                  	pop     ax
 27762                                  
 27763                                  %endif
 27764                                  
 27765                                  ;	Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
 27766                                  ;	written.
 27767                                  
 27768                                  nosc:	
 27769 000046D5 E8E621                  	call	GETCURHEAD		;DS:DI -> first buffer in queue.
 27770                                  
 27771                                  _bufq:	
 27772                                  	;cmpo	al,[di+4]
 27773 000046D8 3A4504                  	cmp     al,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID] ;Same drive?
 27774 000046DB 7527                    	jne	short bufq5		; -no, jump.
 27775                                  
 27776                                  ;       Cmp32   bx,dx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27777                                  ;       ja	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent start > buffer sector.
 27778                                  
 27779                                  	;cmp	bx,[di+8]
 27780 000046DD 3B5D08                  	cmp	bx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27781 000046E0 7503                    	jne	short bufq04
 27782                                  	;cmp	dx,[di+6]
 27783 000046E2 3B5506                  	cmp	dx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27784                                  bufq04:
 27785 000046E5 771D                    	ja	short bufq5
 27786                                  
 27787                                  ;       Cmp32   si,cx,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector+2]>,<WORD PTR [di.buf_sector]>
 27788                                  ;       jbe	short bufq5		;Jump if Extent end < buffer sector.
 27789                                  
 27790                                  	;cmp	si,[di+8]
 27791 000046E7 3B7508                  	cmp	si,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector+2]
 27792 000046EA 7503                    	jne	short bufq05
 27793                                  	;cmp	cx,[di+6]
 27794 000046EC 3B4D06                  	cmp	cx,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_sector]
 27795                                  bufq05:
 27796 000046EF 7613                    	jbe	short bufq5
 27797                                  
 27798                                  ;	Buffer's sector is in Extent, so free it; it is being over-written.
 27799                                  
 27800                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 27801 000046F1 F6450540                	test	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty ;Buffer dirty?
 27802 000046F5 7403                    	jz	short bufq4		; -no, jump.
 27803 000046F7 E8DB24                  	call	DEC_DIRTY_COUNT		; -yes, decrement dirty count.
 27804                                  bufq4:
 27805                                  	;mov	word [di+4],20FFh
 27806 000046FA C74504FF20              	mov     word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],((buf_visit<<8)|0FFh)
 27807                                  
 27808 000046FF E8CE21                  	call	SCANPLACE
 27809 00004702 EB02                    	jmp     short bufq6
 27810                                  bufq5: 
 27811 00004704 8B3D                    	mov     di,[di]
 27812                                  	;mov	di,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 27813                                  bufq6: 
 27814 00004706 363B3E[7E11]            	cmp	di,[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR]	;Scanned entire buffer queue?
 27815 0000470B 75CB                    	jne	short _bufq		; --no, go do next buffer.
 27816                                  	
 27817                                  	;RestoreReg <cx,bx>
 27818 0000470D 59                      	pop	cx
 27819 0000470E 5B                      	pop	bx
 27820 0000470F C3                      	retn
 27821                                  
 27822                                  ;EndProc DskWrtBufPurge
 27823                                  
 27824                                  ;Break   <DIV32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT DIVIDE>
 27825                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27826                                  ;
 27827                                  ; Procedure Name : DIV32
 27828                                  ;
 27829                                  ; Inputs:
 27830                                  ;       DX:AX = 32 bit dividend   BX= divisor
 27831                                  ; Function:
 27832                                  ;       Perform 32 bit division:  DX:AX/BX = CX:AX + DX (rem.)
 27833                                  ; Outputs:
 27834                                  ;       CX:AX = quotient , DX= remainder
 27835                                  ; Uses:
 27836                                  ;       All registers except AX,CX,DX preserved.
 27837                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27838                                  ;M039: DIV32 optimized for divisor of 512 (common sector size).
 27839                                  
 27840                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27841                                  ; DOSCODE:7C94h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27842                                  
 27843                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27844                                  ; DOSCODE:7C5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27845                                  
 27846                                  DIV32:
 27847 00004710 81FB0002                	cmp	bx,512
 27848 00004714 7515                    	jne	short div5
 27849                                  
 27850 00004716 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 27851 00004718 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax           ; CX:AX = Dividend
 27852 0000471A 81E2FF01                	and	dx,(512-1)      ; DX = Remainder
 27853 0000471E 88E0                    	mov	al,ah
 27854 00004720 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 27855 00004722 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch
 27856 00004724 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 27857 00004726 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 27858 00004728 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 27859 0000472A C3                      	retn
 27860                                  div5:	
 27861 0000472B 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27862 0000472D 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 27863 0000472F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27864 00004731 F7F3                    	div	bx              ; 0:AX/BX
 27865 00004733 91                      	xchg	cx,ax
 27866 00004734 F7F3                    	div	bx              ; DX:AX/BX
 27867 00004736 C3                      	retn
 27868                                  
 27869                                  ;Break   <SHR32 -- PERFORM 32 BIT SHIFT RIGHT>
 27870                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27871                                  ;
 27872                                  ; Procedure Name : SHR32
 27873                                  ;
 27874                                  ; Inputs:
 27875                                  ;	DX:AX = 32 bit sector number
 27876                                  ; Function:
 27877                                  ;       Perform 32 bit shift right
 27878                                  ; Outputs:
 27879                                  ;	AX = cluster number
 27880                                  ;	ZF = 1 if no error
 27881                                  ;	   = 0 if error (cluster number > 64k)
 27882                                  ; Uses:
 27883                                  ;       DX,CX
 27884                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27885                                  ; M017	- SHR32 rewritten for better performance
 27886                                  ; M039	- Additional optimization
 27887                                  
 27888                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27889                                  ; DOSCODE:7CBBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27890                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27891                                  ; DOSCODE:7C81h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 27892                                  
 27893                                  SHR32:
 27894                                  	;mov	cl,[es:bp+5]
 27895 00004737 268A4E05                	mov	cl,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_SHIFT]
 27896 0000473B 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch	    ;ZF=1
 27897 0000473D E306                    	jcxz	norota
 27898                                  rotashft2:
 27899 0000473F D1EA                    	shr	dx,1	    ;ZF reflects state of DX.
 27900 00004741 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1	    ;ZF not affected.
 27901 00004743 E2FA                    	loop	rotashft2
 27902                                  norota:
 27903 00004745 C3                      	retn
 27904

 27906                                  ; DIR.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991

 27911                                  ;	TITLE	DIR - Directory and path cracking
 27912                                  ;	NAME	Dir
 27913                                  
 27914                                  ;Break	<FINDENTRY -- LOOK FOR AN ENTRY>
 27915                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27916                                  ;
 27917                                  ; Procedure Name : FINDENTRY,SEARCH
 27918                                  ;
 27919                                  ; Inputs:
 27920                                  ;	[THISDPB] set
 27921                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 27922                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Starting directory sector number
 27923                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Next cluster of directory
 27924                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors/Cluster
 27925                                  ;	[NAME1] = Name to look for
 27926                                  ; Function:
 27927                                  ;	Find file name in disk directory.
 27928                                  ;	"?" matches any character.
 27929                                  ; Outputs:
 27930                                  ;	Carry set if name not found
 27931                                  ;	ELSE
 27932                                  ;	Zero set if attributes match (always except when creating)
 27933                                  ;	AH = Device ID (bit 7 set if not disk)
 27934                                  ;	[THISDPB] = Base of drive parameters
 27935                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 27936                                  ;	ES = DOSGROUP
 27937                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer into directory buffer
 27938                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:SI = Pointer to First Cluster field in directory entry
 27939                                  ;	[CURBUF] has directory record with match
 27940                                  ;	[NAME1] has file name
 27941                                  ;	[LASTENT] is entry number of the entry
 27942                                  ; All other registers destroyed.
 27943                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27944                                  
 27945                                  ;hkn; called from rename.asm and dir2.asm. DS must be already set up at
 27946                                  ;hkn; this point.
 27947                                  
 27948                                  SEARCH:
 27949                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 27950                                  	; DOSCODE:7C90h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 27951                                  
 27952                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27953                                  	; DOSCODE:7CCAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 27954                                  
 27955                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 27956                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 45B3h
 27957                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 27958                                  
 27959                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27960                                  
 27961                                  	; 13/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27962                                  	; DOSCODE:8797h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 27963                                  
 27964                                  	;entry	FindEntry
 27965                                  FINDENTRY:
 27966 00004746 E86F06                  	call	STARTSRCH
 27967 00004749 A0[6B05]                	MOV	AL,[ATTRIB]
 27968                                  	;and	al,9Eh
 27969 0000474C 24DE                    	AND	AL,~attr_ignore		; Ignore useless bits
 27970                                  	;cmp	al,8
 27971 0000474E 3C08                    	CMP	AL,attr_volume_id	; Looking for vol ID only ?
 27972 00004750 7503                    	JNZ	short NOTVOLSRCH	; No
 27973 00004752 E83B02                  	CALL	SETROOTSRCH		; Yes force search of root
 27974                                  NOTVOLSRCH:
 27975 00004755 E84C01                  	CALL	GETENTRY
 27976                                  	;JNC	short SRCH
 27977                                  	;JMP	SETESRET
 27978                                  	; 24/01/2024
 27979 00004758 724F                    	jc	short SETESRET
 27980                                  
 27981                                  	;entry	Srch
 27982                                  SRCH:
 27983                                  	;;;
 27984                                  	; 13/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 27985 0000475A C706[A50A]0000          	mov     word [LNE_COUNT],0	; reset long name entry count
 27986                                  SRCH2:
 27987                                  	;;;
 27988                                  
 27989 00004760 1E                      	PUSH	DS

 27996 00004767 08E4                    	OR	AH,AH			; End of directory?
 27997 00004769 7461                    	JZ	short FREE
 27998                                  
 27999                                  	;;;
 28000                                  	; 13/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28001 0000476B 50                      	push	ax
 28002 0000476C 8A470B                  	mov	al,[bx+0Bh]		; [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr]
 28003 0000476F E8A103                  	call	check_longname
 28004 00004772 58                      	pop	ax
 28005 00004773 7447                    	jz	short NEXTENT2
 28006                                  	;;;

 28008                                  ;hkn; SS override
 28009 00004775 363A26[7F05]            	CMP	AH,[SS:DELALL]		; Free entry?
 28010 0000477A 7450                    	JZ	short FREE

 28012 0000477C F6470B08                	TEST	byte [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_volume_id

 28090 000047E1 890E[DA05]              	MOV	[ENTLAST],CX
 28091 000047E5 F9                      	STC
 28092 000047E6 EBC1                    	JMP	SHORT SETESRET
 28093                                  
 28094                                  FOUND:
 28095                                  ; We have a file with a matching name. We must now consider the attributes:
 28096                                  ; ATTRIB	Action
 28097                                  ; ------	------
 28098                                  ; Volume_ID	Is Volume_ID in test?
 28099                                  ; Otherwise	If no create then Is ATTRIB+extra superset of test?
 28100                                  ;		If create then Is ATTRIB equal to test?
 28101                                  
 28102 000047E8 8A2C                    	MOV	CH,[SI] 		; Attributes of file
 28103 000047EA 1F                      	POP	DS
 28104 000047EB 8A26[6B05]              	MOV	AH,[ATTRIB]		; Attributes of search
 28105                                  	;and	ah,9Eh
 28106 000047EF 80E4DE                  	AND	AH,~attr_ignore
 28107                                  	;lea	si,[si+15]
 28108 000047F2 8D740F                  	LEA	SI,[SI+dir_entry.dir_first-dir_entry.dir_attr]
 28109                                  					; point to first cluster field
 28110                                  	;test	ch,8
 28111 000047F5 F6C508                  	TEST	CH,attr_volume_id	; Volume ID file?
 28112 000047F8 7409                    	JZ	short check_one_volume_id ; Nope check other attributes
 28113                                  	;test	ah,8
 28114 000047FA F6C408                  	TEST	AH,attr_volume_id	; Can we find Volume ID?
 28115                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Nope, (not even $FCB_CREATE)
 28116                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28117 000047FD 74A1                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 28118                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28119                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 28120 000047FF 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Set zero flag for $FCB_CREATE
 28121 00004801 EB11                    	JMP	SHORT RETFF		; Found Volume ID
 28122                                  check_one_volume_id:
 28123                                  	;CMP	ah,8
 28124 00004803 80FC08                  	CMP	AH,attr_volume_id	; Looking only for Volume ID?
 28125                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ		; Yes, continue search
 28126                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28127 00004806 7498                    	je	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 28128                                  	;JZ	short NEXTENTJ
 28129 00004808 E8C105                  	CALL	MatchAttributes
 28130 0000480B 7407                    	JZ	SHORT RETFF
 28131 0000480D F606[7E05]FF            	TEST	BYTE [CREATING],-1	; Pass back mismatch if creating
 28132                                  	; 16/12/2022

 28134 00004812 748C                    	jz	short NEXTENT ; 19/05/2019
 28135                                  RETFF:

 28137                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 28146 0000481C EB8B                    	jmp	short SETESRET

 28148                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28149                                  ;
 28150                                  ; Procedure Name : MetaCompare
 28151                                  ;
 28152                                  ; Inputs:
 28153                                  ;	DS:SI -> 11 character FCB style name NO '?'
 28154                                  ;	    Typically this is a directory entry. It MUST be in upper case
 28155                                  ;	ES:DI -> 11 character FCB style name with possible '?'
 28156                                  ;	    Typically this is a FCB or SFT. It MUST be in upper case
 28157                                  ; Function:
 28158                                  ;	Compare FCB style names allowing for ? match to any char
 28159                                  ; Outputs:
 28160                                  ;	Zero if match else NZ
 28161                                  ; Destroys CX,SI,DI all others preserved
 28162                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28163                                  
 28164                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28165                                  	; DOSCODE:7D3Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 28166                                  
 28167                                  MetaCompare:
 28168 0000481E B90B00                  	MOV	CX,11
 28169                                  WILDCRD:
 28170 00004821 F3A6                    	REPE	CMPSB
 28171 00004823 7407                    	JZ	short MetaRet 		; most of the time we will fail.
 28172                                  CHECK_META:
 28173 00004825 26807DFF3F              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1],"?"
 28174 0000482A 74F5                    	JZ	short WILDCRD
 28175                                  MetaRet:
 28176 0000482C C3                       	retn				; Zero set, Match
 28177                                  
 28178                                  ;Break	<NEXTENTRY -- STEP THROUGH DIRECTORY>
 28179                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28180                                  ;
 28181                                  ; Procedure Name : NEXTENTRY
 28182                                  ;
 28183                                  ; Inputs:
 28184                                  ;	Same as outputs of GETENTRY, above
 28185                                  ; Function:
 28186                                  ;	Update BX, and [LASTENT] for next directory entry.
 28187                                  ;	Carry set if no more.
 28188                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28189                                  
 28190                                  NEXTENTRY:
 28191                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28192                                  	; DOSCODE:7D4Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) 
 28193                                  
 28194                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28195                                  	; DOSCODE:7D88h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 28196                                  
 28197                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28198                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 4671h 
 28199                                  	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 28200                                  
 28201                                  	; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28202                                  	; DOSCODE:8884h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 28203                                  
 28204 0000482D A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 28205 00004830 3B06[DA05]              	CMP	AX,[ENTLAST]
 28206 00004834 741C                    	JZ	short NONE

 28208                                  	;ADD	BX,32
 28209 00004837 8D5F20                  	LEA	BX,[BX+32]
 28210 0000483A 39D3                    	CMP	BX,DX
 28211                                  	; 21/11/2022 - MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS (DOSCODE:7D5Dh)
 28212                                  	;JB	short HAVIT ; MSDOS 6.0 src (dir.asm)
 28213                                  	; 16/12/2022

 28215                                  
 28216                                  	;;;
 28217                                  	; 14/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28218 0000483E 833E[C205]00            	cmp	word [DIRSTART],0
 28219 00004843 750F                    	jnz	short nextentry_cont
 28220 00004845 833E[DC0A]00            	cmp	word [DIRSTART_HW],0
 28221 0000484A 7508                    	jnz	short nextentry_cont
 28222                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:bp+9]
 28223 0000484C 263B4609                	cmp	ax,[es:bp+DPB.ROOT_ENTRIES] ; Number of root dir entries
 28224                                  	;jnb	short NONE
 28225                                  	;jmp	short GETENT
 28226 00004850 7255                    	jb	short GETENT
 28227                                  NONE:		; 14/02/2024
 28228 00004852 F9                      	stc
 28229 00004853 C3                      	retn
 28230                                  	
 28231                                  nextentry_cont:
 28232                                  	;;;
 28233                                  
 28234 00004854 8A1E[7305]              	MOV	BL,[SECCLUSPOS]
 28235 00004858 FEC3                    	INC	BL
 28236 0000485A 3A1E[7705]              	CMP	BL,[CLUSFAC]
 28237 0000485E 7223                    	JB	short SAMECLUS
 28238                                  	;;;
 28239                                  	; 14/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28240 00004860 8B1E[E00A]              	mov	bx,[NXTCLUSNUM_HW]
 28241 00004864 891E[E80A]              	mov	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx
 28242                                  	;;;

 28250                                  	;;;

 28261                                  ;NONE:
 28262                                  	;STC

 28321                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28322                                  ;
 28323                                  ; Procedure Name : GETENTRY
 28324                                  ;
 28325                                  ; Inputs:
 28326                                  ;	[LASTENT] has directory entry
 28327                                  ;	ES:BP points to drive parameters
 28328                                  ;	[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[ENTLAST] set for DIR involved
 28329                                  ; Function:
 28330                                  ;	Locates directory entry in preparation for search
 28331                                  ;	GETENT provides entry for passing desired entry in AX
 28332                                  ; Outputs:
 28333                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:BX = Pointer to next directory entry in CURBUF
 28334                                  ;	[CURBUF+2]:DX = Pointer to first byte after end of CURBUF
 28335                                  ;	[LASTENT] = New directory entry number
 28336                                  ;	[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS] set via DIRREAD
 28337                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28338                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28339                                  
 28340                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28341                                  GETENTRY:
 28342                                  	; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28343 000048A4 A1[4803]                	MOV	AX,[LASTENT]
 28344                                  
 28345                                  	;entry	GETENT
 28346                                  GETENT:
 28347 000048A7 A3[4803]                	MOV	[LASTENT],AX
 28348                                  ;
 28349                                  ; Convert the entry number in AX into a byte offset from the beginning of the
 28350                                  ; directory.
 28351                                  ;
 28352 000048AA B105                    	mov	cl,5			; shift left by 5 = mult by 32
 28353 000048AC D3C0                    	rol	ax,cl			; keep hight order bits
 28354 000048AE 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 28355                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28356                                  	;and	ax,0FFE0h
 28357                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28358                                  	;and	ax,~(32-1)		; mask off high order bits
 28359                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28360 000048B0 24E0                    	and	al,0E0h ; ~31
 28361 000048B2 83E21F                  	and	dx,1Fh
 28362                                  	;and	dx,32-1			; mask off low order bits
 28363                                  ;
 28364                                  ; DX:AX contain the byte offset of the required directory entry from the
 28365                                  ; beginning of the directory. Convert this to a sector number. Round the
 28366                                  ; sector size down to a multiple of 32.
 28367                                  ;
 28368                                  	;mov	bx,[es:bp+2]
 28369 000048B5 268B5E02                	MOV	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 28370 000048B9 80E3E0                  	and	bl,0E0h
 28371                                  	;AND	BL,255-31		; Must be multiple of 32
 28372 000048BC F7F3                    	DIV	BX
 28373                                  	; 14/02/2024
 28374                                  	;MOV	BX,DX			; Position within sector
 28375                                  				; NOTE: This BX value is not used in DIRREAD
 28376                                  				; Erdogan Tan - 14/02/2024
 28377                                  	;PUSH	BX
 28378 000048BE 52                      	push	dx
 28379                                  	;
 28380 000048BF E832F6                  	call	DIRREAD
 28381 000048C2 5B                      	POP	BX
 28382                                  	;retc
 28383 000048C3 72BD                    	jc	short nextentry_retn
 28384                                  SETENTRY:
 28385 000048C5 8B16[E205]              	MOV	DX,[CURBUF]
 28386                                  	;;;add	dx,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 28387                                  	;;add	dx,20 ; MSDOS 6.0 
 28388                                  	;add	dx,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 14/02/2024	
 28389 000048C9 83C218                  	ADD	DX,BUFINSIZ
 28390 000048CC 01D3                    	ADD	BX,DX
 28391                                  	;add	dx,[es:bp+2]
 28392 000048CE 26035602                	ADD	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]  ; Always clears carry
 28393                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28394                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS contains a 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:7E15h
 28395                                  	; 27/06/2024
 28396                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM contains 'CLC' here, at DOSCODE:8931h
 28397 000048D2 F8                      	clc
 28398 000048D3 C3                      	retn
 28399                                  
 28400                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28401                                  
 28402                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28403                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8933h
 28404                                  
 28405                                  sft_fcb_table:
 28406 000048D4 00<rep 14h>             	times 20 db 0
 28407                                  sftfcb.cluster:
 28408 000048E8 00000000                	dd	0
 28409                                  sftfcb.direntry:
 28410 000048EC 0000                    	dw	0
 28411                                  sftfcb_entry_size equ $ - sftfcb.cluster ; = 6

 28422                                  ;Break	<SETDIRSRCH SETROOTSRCH -- Set Search environments>
 28423                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28424                                  ;
 28425                                  ; Procedure Name : SETDIRSRCH,SETROOTSRCH
 28426                                  ;
 28427                                  ; Inputs:
 28428                                  ;	BX cluster number of start of directory
 28429                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28430                                  ;	DI next cluster number from fastopen extended info. DOS 3.3 only
 28431                                  ; Function:
 28432                                  ;	Set up a directory search
 28433                                  ; Outputs:
 28434                                  ;	[DIRSTART] = BX
 28435                                  ;	[CLUSFAC],[CLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC] set
 28436                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 28437                                  ; destroys AX,DX,BX
 28438                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28439                                  
 28440                                  ; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28441                                  %if 0
 28442                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28443                                  SETDIRSRCH:
 28444                                  	OR	BX,BX
 28445                                  	JZ	short SETROOTSRCH
 28446                                  	MOV	[DIRSTART],BX
 28447                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+4]
 28448                                  	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.CLUSTER_MASK]
 28449                                  	INC	AL
 28450                                  	MOV	[CLUSFAC],AL
 28451                                  
 28452                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 28453                                  	;SAVE	<SI>
 28454                                  	push	si
 28455                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 28456                                  	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 28457                                  	JNZ	short UNP_OK
 28458                                  
 28459                                  ; DOS 3.3 for FastOPen	F.C. 6/12/86
 28460                                  	;invoke	UNPACK
 28461                                  	call	UNPACK
 28462                                  	JNC	short UNP_OK
 28463                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 28464                                  	pop	si
 28465                                  	;return
 28466                                  	retn
 28467                                  
 28468                                  UNP_OK:
 28469                                  	MOV	[CLUSNUM],DI
 28470                                  	MOV	DX,BX
 28471                                  	XOR	BL,BL
 28472                                  	MOV	[SECCLUSPOS],BL
 28473                                  	;invoke	FIGREC
 28474                                  	call	FIGREC
 28475                                  	;RESTORE <SI>
 28476                                  	pop	si
 28477                                  	
 28478                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28479                                  
 28480                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 28481                                  	;PUSH	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 28482                                  	;MOV	DX,[HIGH_SECTOR]	   ;AN000; >32mb
 28483                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC+2],DX		   ;AN000; >32mb
 28484                                  	;POP	DX			   ;AN000; >32mb
 28485

 28487                                  	;push	dx
 28488                                  	;mov	dx,[HIGH_SECTOR]
 28489                                  	;mov	[DIRSEC+2],dx
 28490                                  	;pop	dx
 28491                                  	;MOV	[DIRSEC],dx
 28492                                  	; 16/12/2022

 28496                                  
 28497                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28498                                  	; cf=0 (at the return of FIGREC)
 28499                                  	;CLC
 28500                                  	retn
 28501                                  
 28502                                  	;entry	SETROOTSRCH

 28523                                  	CLC

 28525                                  %else
 28526                                  	;;;

 28759                                  find_sft_entry_number:
 28760 00004A6F 06                      	push	es		; es:di = SFT entry
 28761 00004A70 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx

 28763 00004A74 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]

 28767 00004A80 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; same SFT segment ?

 28769 00004A84 89F8                    	mov	ax,di

 28772 00004A88 83E806                  	sub	ax,SFT.SFTable
 28773                                  	;mov	bx,59

 28776 00004A90 F7F3                    	div	bx		; ax = SFT entry index in the table
 28777 00004A92 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; ax = SFT index number (for requested SFT entry)
 28778 00004A94 07                      	pop	es
 28779 00004A95 C3                      	retn
 28780                                  f_sfte_2:
 28781 00004A96 26034F04                	add	cx,[es:bx+4]	; SFT.SFCount ; number of entries in the table
 28782 00004A9A 26C41F                  	les	bx,[es:bx]	; SFT.SFLink
 28783 00004A9D 83FBFF                  	cmp	bx,0FFFFh ; -1	; the last SFT
 28784 00004AA0 75DC                    	jnz	short f_sfte_1
 28785 00004AA2 F9                      	stc			; (not found)
 28786 00004AA3 07                      	pop	es
 28787 00004AA4 C3                      	retn

 28795                                  int_2Fh_1230h:		; Windows95 - FIND SFT ENTRY IN INTERNAL FILE TABLES
 28796 00004AA5 E8C7FF                  	call	find_sft_entry_number
 28797 00004AA8 7242                    	jc	short find_sfte_i_error
 28798 00004AAA 06                      	push	es	; ax = SFT enty index number (of the requested SFT entry)
 28799 00004AAB 57                      	push	di
 28800 00004AAC 0E                      	push	cs
 28801 00004AAD 07                      	pop	es
 28802 00004AAE B91400                  	mov	cx,20		; statically allocated with 20 entries,
 28803                                  				; and used only for FCB calls
 28804 00004AB1 BF[D448]                	mov	di,sft_fcb_table ; new file system (internal) table
 28805                                  				;  only for fcb calls
 28806                                  scan_next_sftfcb:

 28808 00004AB6 F9                      	stc
 28809 00004AB7 7531                    	jnz	short sfte_i_notfound ; not found (cf=1)
 28810 00004AB9 8D5DFF                  	lea	bx,[di-1]	; offset of the entry in the table
 28811 00004ABC 81EB[D448]              	sub	bx,sft_fcb_table ; index into new file system table
 28812 00004AC0 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 28813 00004AC2 01DB                    	add	bx,bx		; 2*bx
 28814 00004AC4 01D3                    	add	bx,dx		; 3*bx
 28815 00004AC6 01DB                    	add	bx,bx		; bx = 6*bx  ; entry size = 6 bytes
 28816 00004AC8 268BB7[EA48]            	mov	si,[es:bx+sftfcb.cluster+2] ; dir start cluster number, hw

 28818 00004AD2 51                      	push	cx

 28820 00004AD8 09C9                    	or	cx,cx

 28822 00004ADC 09F6                    	or	si,si
 28823 00004ADE 7508                    	jnz	short sfte_i_found
 28824 00004AE0 59                      	pop	cx
 28825 00004AE1 09C9                    	or	cx,cx
 28826 00004AE3 75CF                    	jnz	short scan_next_sftfcb
 28827 00004AE5 F9                      	stc			; not found (cf=1)
 28828 00004AE6 EB02                    	jmp	short sfte_i_notfound
 28829

 28831 00004AE8 58                      	pop	ax		; clear stack
 28832 00004AE9 F8                      	clc			; found (cf=0)
 28833                                  sfte_i_notfound:
 28834 00004AEA 5F                      	pop	di
 28835 00004AEB 07                      	pop	es
 28836                                  find_sfte_i_error:

 28882                                  ;============================================================================
 28883                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28884                                  ;============================================================================
 28885                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28886                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28887                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28888                                  
 28889                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28890                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28891                                  
 28892                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28893                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28894                                  ;
 28895                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28896                                  ;
 28897                                  ; Inputs:
 28898                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28899                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28900                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28901                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28902                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28903                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28904                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28905                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28906                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28907                                  ; Function:
 28908                                  ;	Crack the path
 28909                                  ; Outputs:
 28910                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28911                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28912                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28913                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28914                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28915                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28916                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28917                                  ;	   Zero set
 28918                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28919                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28920                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28921                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28922                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28923                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28924                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28925                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28926                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28927                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28928                                  ;	ELSE
 28929                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28930                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28931                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28932                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28933                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28934                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28935                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28936                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28937                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28938                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28939                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28940                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28941                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28942                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28943                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28944                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28945                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28946                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28947                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28948                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28949                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28950                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28951                                  
 28952                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28953                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28954                                  
 28955                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28956                                  
 28957                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28958                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28959                                  
 28960                                  GETPATH:
 28961                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28962 00004B18 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28963                                  
 28964                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28965                                  
 28966                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28967                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28968                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28969                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28970                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28971 00004B1E E8C5C7                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28972                                  	;
 28973 00004B21 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28974                                  
 28975                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28976                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28977                                  
 28978 00004B27 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28979                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28980                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28981 00004B2B 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28982 00004B30 7435                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28983                                  
 28984                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28985                                  
 28986 00004B32 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28987                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28988                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28989                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28990                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28991                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 28992 00004B35 E8B200                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 28993 00004B38 722B                    	JC	short InternalError
 28994                                  
 28995                                  Build_devJ:
 28996 00004B3A A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28997 00004B3D A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28998                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28999                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 29000                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 29001                                  					; "finding" a char device
 29002                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 29003                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 29004                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 29005                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29006 00004B40 E89AC7                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk
 29007                                  
 29008                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 29009                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 29010                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 29011                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 29012                                  ;
 29013                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 29014                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 29015                                  
 29016                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29017 00004B43 16                      	push	ss
 29018 00004B44 07                      	pop	es
 29019                                  
 29020                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 29021 00004B45 BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 29022 00004B48 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 29023 00004B4C 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 29024 00004B4E B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 29025                                  MoveLoop:
 29026 00004B51 AC                      	lodsb
 29027 00004B52 AA                      	stosb
 29028 00004B53 3C20                    	cmp	al," "

 29034                                  
 29035                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 29036                                  ; at this point.
 29037                                  
 29038 00004B5B 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 29039                                  	;mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 29040                                  	; 15/02/2024

 29043 00004B62 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 29044 00004B64 C3                      	retn

 29050                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 29051

 29053                                  ; 15/02/2024
 29054                                  %if 0
 29055                                  	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 29056                                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?

 29063                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 29064 00004B6C C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 29065 00004B70 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 29066                                  	;;;
 29067                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 29070 00004B77 891E[EE0A]              	mov	[ROOTCLUST_HW],bx
 29071                                  	;;;

 29073 00004B7B 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 29074 00004B7F 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 29075                                  
 29076                                  ; AX = -1
 29077                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. This number is -1 if the media
 29078                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 29079                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 29080                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 29081

 29083 00004B85 7449                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 29084                                  	;;;

 29090

 29092 00004B8F 743F                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack from the root
 29093                                  
 29094                                  CrackIt2:	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 29095                                  
 29096                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1

 29122                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster

 29146 00004BCB 59                      	POP	CX
 29147 00004BCC 5F                      	POP	DI
 29148 00004BCD 07                      	POP	ES
 29149 00004BCE 730D                    	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 29150                                  
 29151                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 29152                                  ;
 29153                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 29154                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 29155                                  
 29156                                  NO_CURR_D:
 29157 00004BD0 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 29158                                  	;LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 29159                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29160 00004BD4 83C603                  	add	si,3
 29161 00004BD7 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 29162 00004BDB EB37                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 29163                                  
 29164                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 29165                                  ; of specified cluster.

 29167                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:

 29169 00004BE1 E880FD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 29170                                  	;JC	short SETFERR

 29174                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29175                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 29176                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 29177                                  SETFERR:

 29179 00004BE8 F9                      	STC
 29180 00004BE9 C3                      	retn
 29181                                  
 29182                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29183                                  ;
 29184                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 29185                                  ;
 29186                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 29187                                  ;   device.
 29188                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 29189                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29190                                  
 29191                                  CHKDEV:
 29192 00004BEA 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 29193                                  	;MOV	DI,SS
 29194                                  	;MOV	ES,DI

 29196 00004BEC 16                      	push	ss
 29197 00004BED 07                      	pop	es
 29198                                  
 29199 00004BEE BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29200 00004BF1 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 29201                                  TESTLOOP:
 29202 00004BF4 E8A411                  	call	GETLET
 29203                                  
 29204 00004BF7 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 29205 00004BF9 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 29206 00004BFB E8F111                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 29207 00004BFE 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 29208 00004C00 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29209 00004C02 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 29210

 29212 00004C05 E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 29213                                  NOTDEV:

 29215 00004C08 C3                      	retn
