 35114                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35115                                  ; DOSCODE:9011h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 35116                                  
 35117                                  ; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35118                                  ; DOSCODE:8FB5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 35119                                  
 35120                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35121                                  ;
 35122                                  ; Procedure Names : GetLet, UCase, GetLet3
 35123                                  ;
 35124                                  ; These routines take a character, convert it to upper case, and check
 35125                                  ; for delimiters.  Three different entry points:
 35126                                  ;	GetLet -  DS:[SI] = character to convert
 35127                                  ;	UCase  -  AL = character to convert
 35128                                  ;	GetLet3 - AL = character
 35129                                  ;		  [BX] = translation table to use
 35130                                  ;
 35131                                  ;	Exit (in all cases) : AL = upper case character
 35132                                  ;			      CY set if char is control char other than TAB
 35133                                  ;			      ZF set if char is a delimiter
 35134                                  ;	Uses : AX, flags
 35135                                  ;
 35136                                  ; NOTE: This routine exists in a fast table lookup version, and a slow
 35137                                  ; inline version.  Return with carry set is only possible in the inline
 35138                                  ; version. The table lookup version is the one in use.
 35139                                  ;
 35140                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35141                                  
 35142                                  ; This entry point has character at [SI]
 35143                                  
 35144                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5517h
 35145                                  GETLET:	
 35146 00005D9B AC                      	LODSB
 35147                                  
 35148                                  ; This entry point has character in AL
 35149                                  
 35150                                  	;entry	UCase
 35151                                  UCase:	
 35152                                  	; 09/08/2018
 35153                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5518h
 35154                                  _UCase:
 35155 00005D9C 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35156 00005D9D BB[7E0B]                	MOV	BX,FILE_UCASE_TAB+2
 35157                                  
 35158                                  ; Convert the character in AL to upper case
 35159                                  
 35160                                  gl_0:
 35161 00005DA0 3C61                    	CMP	AL,"a"
 35162 00005DA2 7214                    	JB	short gl_2	; Already upper case, go check type
 35163 00005DA4 3C7A                    	CMP	AL,"z"
 35164 00005DA6 7702                    	JA	short gl_1
 35165 00005DA8 2C20                    	SUB	AL,20H		; Convert to upper case
 35166                                  
 35167                                  ; Map European character to upper case
 35168                                  
 35169                                  gl_1:
 35170 00005DAA 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80H
 35171 00005DAC 720A                    	JB	short gl_2	; Not EuroChar, go check type
 35172 00005DAE 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80H		; translate to upper case with this index
 35173                                  
 35174                                  	; M048 - Start 
 35175                                  	; Lantastic call Ucase thru int 2f without setting SS to DOSDATA.
 35176                                  	; So we shall set up DS and to access FILE_UCASE_TAB in BX and also 
 35177                                  	; preserve it.
 35178                                  
 35179                                  	; 09/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 35180                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35181                                  	;;XLAT	BYTE [CS:BX]	; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 35182                                  	;CS	XLAT
 35183                                  
 35184                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35185                                  
 35186                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35187 00005DB0 1E                      	push	ds
 35188                                  	;getdseg <ds>
 35189 00005DB1 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35190 00005DB6 D7                      	XLAT			; ds as file_ucase_tab is in DOSDATA
 35191 00005DB7 1F                      	pop	ds
 35192                                  
 35193                                  	; M048 - End
 35194                                  
 35195                                  ; Now check the type
 35196                                  
 35197                                  ;If TableLook
 35198                                  gl_2:
 35199                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35200 00005DB8 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35201                                  
 35202                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35203                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35204                                  	;; 09/08/2018
 35205                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35206                                  	;cs	xlat	
 35207                                  	
 35208                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35209 00005DB9 E81800                  	CALL	GetCharType	; returns type flags in AL
 35210                                  	
 35211                                  	;test	al,1	
 35212 00005DBC A801                    	TEST	AL,FCHK 	; test for normal character
 35213 00005DBE 58                      	POP	AX
 35214                                  
 35215 00005DBF 5B                      	POP	BX
 35216 00005DC0 C3                      	RETN
 35217                                  
 35218                                  ; This entry has character in AL and lookup table in BX
 35219                                  
 35220                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35221                                  ;	;entry GetLet3
 35222                                  GETLET3: ; 10/08/2018
 35223 00005DC1 53                      	PUSH	BX
 35224 00005DC2 EBDC                    	JMP	short gl_0
 35225                                  ;ELSE
 35226                                  ;
 35227                                  ;gl_2:
 35228                                  ;	POP	BX
 35229                                  ;	CMP	AL,"."
 35230                                  ;	retz
 35231                                  ;	CMP	AL,'"'
 35232                                  ;	retz
 35233                                  ;	CALL	PATHCHRCMP
 35234                                  ;	retz
 35235                                  ;	CMP	AL,"["
 35236                                  ;	retz
 35237                                  ;	CMP	AL,"]"
 35238                                  ;	retz
 35239                                  ;ENDIF
 35240                                  
 35241                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35242                                  ;
 35243                                  ; DELIM - check if character is a delimiter
 35244                                  ;	Entry : AX = character to check
 35245                                  ;	Exit  : ZF set if character is not a delimiter
 35246                                  ;	Uses  : Flags
 35247                                  ;
 35248                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 35249                                  
 35250                                  	;entry	DELIM
 35251                                  DELIM:
 35252                                  ;IF TableLook
 35253                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35254 00005DC4 50                      	PUSH	AX
 35255                                  
 35256                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 35257                                  	;push	bx
 35258                                  	;mov	bx,CharType
 35259                                  	;;09/08/2018
 35260                                  	;;xlat	byte [cs:bx]
 35261                                  	;cs	xlat
 35262                                  	;pop	bx
 35263

 35265 00005DC5 E80C00                  	CALL	GetCharType
 35266

 35269 00005DCA 58                      	POP	AX

 35271                                  ;ELSE
 35272                                  ;	CMP	AL,":"
 35273                                  ;	retz

 35278                                  ;	retz
 35279                                  ;	CMP	AL,">"
 35280                                  ;	retz
 35281                                  ;

 35283                                  ;	retz

 35285                                  ;	retz

 35287                                  ;	retz
 35288                                  ;	CMP	AL,","
 35289                                  ;	retz

 35297                                  ;	Uses  : flags

 35299                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------

 35302                                  SPCHK:

 35305 00005DCC 50                      	PUSH	AX

 35320 00005DD2 58                      	POP	AX

 35322                                  ;ELSE

 35324                                  ;	retz

 35326                                  ;	CMP	AL," "

 35329                                  
 35330                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35331                                  ;
 35332                                  ;  GetCharType - return flag bits indicating character type
 35333                                  ;	Bits are defined in DOSSYM.INC. Uses lookup table
 35334                                  ;	defined above at label CharType.
 35335                                  ;
 35336                                  ;	Entry : AL = character to return type flags for
 35337                                  ;	Exit  : AL = type flags
 35338                                  ;	Uses  : AL, flags
 35339                                  ;
 35340                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35341                                  
 35342                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35343                                  
 35344                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 35345                                  
 35346                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35347                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35348                                  
 35349                                  GetCharType:
 35350                                  	;cmp	al,7Eh
 35351 00005DD4 3C7E                    	cmp	al,CharType_last 	; beyond end of table?
 35352 00005DD6 7314                    	jae	short gct_90		; return standard value
 35353                                  
 35354 00005DD8 53                      	push	bx
 35355 00005DD9 BB[5C5D]                	mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 35356 00005DDC D0E8                    	shr	al,1			; adjust for half-byte table entry size
 35357                                  	;xlat	cs:[bx] 		; get flags
 35358 00005DDE 2ED7                    	cs	xlat	
 35359 00005DE0 5B                      	pop	bx
 35360                                  
 35361                                  ; carry clear from previous shift means we want the low nibble.  Otherwise
 35362                                  ; we have to shift the flags down to the low nibble
 35363                                  
 35364 00005DE1 7306                    	jnc	short gct_80		; carry clear, no shift needed
 35365                                  
 35366                                  ; 29/02/2024
 35367                                  %if 0
 35368                                  	shr	al,1			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35369                                  	shr	al,1
 35370                                  	shr	al,1
 35371                                  	shr	al,1
 35372                                  %else
 35373                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35374                                  	;;;
 35375 00005DE3 51                      	push	cx
 35376 00005DE4 B104                    	mov	cl,4			; we want high nibble, shift it down
 35377 00005DE6 D2E8                    	shr	al,cl
 35378 00005DE8 59                      	pop	cx
 35379                                  	;;;
 35380                                  %endif
 35381                                  
 35382                                  gct_80:
 35383 00005DE9 240F                    	and	al,0Fh			; clear the unused nibble
 35384 00005DEB C3                      	retn
 35385                                  gct_90:
 35386 00005DEC B00F                    	mov	al,0Fh			; set all flags
 35387 00005DEE C3                      	retn

 35400                                  GotFor:
 35401 00005DF6 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 35402 00005DF8 C3                      	retn
 35403                                  PathRet:
 35404 00005DF9 74FB                    	JZ	short GotFor
 35405 00005DFB C3                      	retn

 35416                                  ;**	MSCTRLC.ASM - ^C and error handler for MSDOS
 35417                                  
 35418                                  ;	TITLE	Control C detection, Hard error and EXIT routines
 35419                                  ;	NAME	IBMCTRLC
 35420                                  
 35421                                  ;**	Low level routines for detecting special characters on CON input,
 35422                                  ;	the ^C exit/int code, the Hard error INT 24 code, the
 35423                                  ;	process termination code, and the INT 0 divide overflow handler.
 35424                                  ;
 35425                                  ;	FATAL
 35426                                  ;	FATAL1
 35427                                  ;	reset_environment
 35428                                  ;	DSKSTATCHK
 35429                                  ;	SPOOLINT
 35430                                  ;	STATCHK
 35431                                  ;	CNTCHAND
 35432                                  ;	DIVOV
 35433                                  ;	CHARHARD
 35434                                  ;	HardErr
 35435                                  ;
 35436                                  ;	Revision history:
 35437                                  ;
 35438                                  ;	    AN000	version 4.0   Jan 1988
 35439                                  ;	    A002	PTM    -- dir >lpt3 hangs
 35440                                  ;	    A003	PTM 3957- fake version for IBMCAHE.COM
 35441                                  ;
 35442                                  ; 	M011: NEC's 8086 clone chip uses Intel's undocumented bit number in
 35443                                  ;	      flags register. In order to return to user normally DOS used to
 35444                                  ;	      move F202 into flags, which sets bit number 1 in flags uncondit-
 35445                                  ;	      ionally. Now it is modified to maintain the state of bit 1.
 35446                                  ;
 35447                                  ; 	M024: suppressed fail and ignore options if not in the middle of int 
 35448                                  ;	      24 and if Ctrl P or ctrl printscrn is pressed in routine 
 35449                                  ;	      charhard.
 35450                                  
 35451                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35452                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 35453                                  ;		public	LowInt23Addr		
 35454                                  LowInt23Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 35455 00005DFC [F60F]0000              	DW	LowInt23, 0
 35456

 35458                                  LowInt24Addr: ;	LABEL	DWORD
 35459 00005E00 [0A10]0000              	DW	LowInt24, 0
 35460

 35463 00005E04 [1E10]0000              	DW	LowInt28, 0

 35756                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35757                                  ;
 35758                                  ; Procedure Name : CNTHAND ( CTRLC_C HANDLER )
 35759                                  ;
 35760                                  ; "^C" and CR/LF is printed. Then the user registers are restored and the
 35761                                  ; user CTRL-C handler is executed. At this point the top of the stack has 1)
 35762                                  ; the interrupt return address should the user CTRL-C handler wish to allow
 35763                                  ; processing to continue; 2) the original interrupt return address to the code
 35764                                  ; that performed the function call in the first place. If the user CTRL-C
 35765                                  ; handler wishes to continue, it must leave all registers unchanged and RET
 35766                                  ; (not IRET) with carry CLEAR. If carry is SET then an terminate system call
 35767                                  ; is simulated.
 35768                                  ;
 35769                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35770                                  
 35771                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 35772                                  
 35773                                  CNTCHAND:
 35774                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; SS override
 35775                                  					; AN002; from RAWOUT
 35776                                  	;TEST	word [SS:DOS34_FLAG],CTRL_BREAK_FLAG  
 35777                                  	;JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35778                                  
 35779                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35780                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:91C4h, 29/12/2022)
 35781 00005F44 36F606[1206]02          	TEST	byte [SS:DOS34_FLAG+1],(CTRL_BREAK_FLAG>>8)  ; 2 
 35782 00005F4A 7508                    	JNZ	short around_deadlock 	; AN002;
 35783                                  
 35784 00005F4C B003                            MOV     AL,3			; Display "^C"
 35785 00005F4E E874BD                          CALL	BUFOUT
 35786 00005F51 E809BC                          CALL	CRLF
 35787                                  around_deadlock:
 35788 00005F54 16                              PUSH    SS
 35789 00005F55 1F                              POP     DS
 35790 00005F56 803E[5703]00                    CMP     BYTE [CONSWAP],0
 35791 00005F5B 7403                            JZ      SHORT NOSWAP
 35792 00005F5D E802DC                          CALL	SWAPBACK
 35793                                  NOSWAP:
 35794 00005F60 FA                      	CLI				; Prepare to play with stack
 35795 00005F61 8E16[8605]              	MOV	SS,[USER_SS]		; User stack now restored
 35796 00005F65 8B26[8405]              	MOV	SP,[USER_SP]
 35797 00005F69 E8D5A4                          CALL	restore_world       ; User registers now restored
 35798                                  
 35799                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
 35800                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56ACh)
 35801                                          ; 14/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
 35802                                  	;MOV	BYTE [CS:INDOS],0	
 35803                                          ;MOV	BYTE [CS:ERRORMODE],0
 35804                                          ;MOV	[CS:ConC_Spsave],SP
 35805                                  	;clc	;30/07/2018
 35806                                          ;INT	int_ctrl_c ; 23h    ; Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35807                                  	;;int	23h	; DOS - CONTROL "C" EXIT ADDRESS
 35808                                  			; Return: return via RETF 2 with CF set
 35809                                  			; DOS will abort program with errorlevel 0
 35810                                  			; else
 35811                                  			; interrupted DOS call continues
 35812                                  
 35813                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35814                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS,91ECh) 
 35815                                  
 35816                                  	; CS was used to address these variables. We have to use DOSDATA
 35817                                  	
 35818 00005F6C 07                      	pop	es ; *	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:91ECh)
 35819                                  			; (pop es, after 'call restore_world')	
 35820 00005F6D 1E                      	push	ds
 35821                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 35822 00005F6E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 35823 00005F73 C606[2103]00            	mov	byte [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 35824                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 35825                                  	;;;
 35826 00005F78 C606[B812]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0	; 2nd 'in dos' flag (what for?)
 35827                                  	;;;
 35828 00005F7D C606[2003]00            	mov	byte [ERRORMODE],0
 35829 00005F82 8926[3203]              	mov	[ConC_Spsave],SP	; save his SP
 35830                                  	; User SP has changed because of push. Adjust for it
 35831 00005F86 8306[3203]02            	add	word [ConC_Spsave],2
 35832                                  
 35833 00005F8B 803E[660D]00            	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; Q: is dos running in HMA (M021)
 35834 00005F90 1F                       	pop	ds	; restore ds
 35835 00005F91 7505                    	jne	short do_low_int23	; Y: the int must be done from low mem
 35836 00005F93 F8                      	CLC				
 35837 00005F94 CD23                    	INT	int_ctrl_c  ; int 23h	; N: Execute user Ctrl-C handler
 35838 00005F96 EB06                    	jmp	short ctrlc_ret_addr
 35839                                  
 35840                                  	; 05/05/2019
 35841                                  do_low_int23:
 35842 00005F98 F8                      	clc
 35843 00005F99 2EFF1E[FC5D]            	call	far [cs:LowInt23Addr]
 35844                                  
 35845                                  	; 30/07/2018 
 35846                                  
 35847                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM - Offset 56C0h)
 35848                                  
 35849                                  ; The user has returned to us. The circumstances we allow are:
 35850                                  ;
 35851                                  ;   IRET	We retry the operation by redispatching the system call
 35852                                  ;   CLC/RETF	POP the stack and retry
 35853                                  ;   ... 	Exit the current process with ^C exit
 35854                                  ;
 35855                                  ; User's may RETURN to us and leave interrupts on. 
 35856                                  ; Turn 'em off just to be sure
 35857

 35883

 35893

 35903                                  COMMANDJ:
 35904 00005FBD E931A3                  	JMP	COMMAND
 35905                                  
 35906                                  ; The current SP is NOT the same as the input SP. Presume that he 
 35907                                  ; RETF'd leaving some flags on the stack and examine the input
 35908

 35912                                  	;

 35921

 36122                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36123                                  ;
 36124                                  ; Procedure Name : HardErr
 36125                                  ;
 36126                                  ; Hard disk error handler. Entry conditions:
 36127                                  ;	DS:BX = Original disk transfer address
 36128                                  ;	DX = Original logical sector number
 36129                                  ;	CX = Number of sectors to go (first one gave the error)
 36130                                  ;	AX = Hardware error code
 36131                                  ;	DI = Original sector transfer count	
 36132                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36133                                  ;	[READOP] = 0 for read, 1 for write
 36134                                  ;	Allowed Set with allowed responses to this error (other bits MUST BE 0)
 36135                                  ; Output:
 36136                                  ;	[FAILERR] will be set if user responded FAIL
 36137                                  ;
 36138                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36139                                  
 36140                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36141                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36142                                  HARDERR:
 36143                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36144                                  	; 30/07/2018
 36145                                  	; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36146 00006059 97                      	XCHG	AX,DI		  	; Error code in DI, count in AX
 36147                                  	;and	di,0FFh

 36149                                  	;CMP	DI,WRECODE		; Write Protect Error?
 36150                                  	;cmp	di,0
 36151 0000605E 83FF00                  	cmp	DI,error_I24_write_protect ; Write Protect Error?

 36153 00006063 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36154                                  	; 25/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 36155                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE]
 36156                                  	;;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+0]
 36157                                  	; 15/12/2022
 36158 00006064 268A4600                	mov	al,[ES:BP]
 36159                                  		; 15/03/2018

 36161 0000606C 58                      	POP	AX
 36162                                  NOSETWRPERR:
 36163 0000606D 29C8                    	SUB	AX,CX		  ; Number of sectors successfully transferred

 36177                                  	;;;

 36179                                  	;cmp	word [ss:HIGH_SECTOR],0

 36181 00006086 7506                    	jnz	short TESTDIR
 36182                                  	;;;
 36183                                  	;CMP	DX,[ES:BP+6] 		; In reserved area?
 36184 00006088 263B5606                	CMP	DX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36185 0000608C 7246                    	JB	SHORT ERRINT
 36186                                  
 36187                                  TESTDIR:	; 29/02/2024	
 36188 0000608E FEC4                    	INC	AH			; Flag for FAT
 36189                                  
 36190                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36191                                  	;;;

 36193 00006090 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0

 36195 00006097 52                      	push	dx
 36196 00006098 368B16[0706]            	mov	dx,[ss:HIGH_SECTOR]
 36197                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+2Bh]
 36198 0000609D 263B562B                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR+2]
 36199 000060A1 5A                      	pop	dx
 36200 000060A2 7504                    	jnz	short TESTDIR1	; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 36201                                  	;cmp	dx,[es:bp+29h]
 36202 000060A4 263B5629                	cmp	dx,[es:bp+DPB.FCLUS_FSECTOR]
 36203                                  TESTDIR1:
 36204 000060A8 730E                    	jnb	short TESTDIR2
 36205                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh ; -1

 36217                                  	;;;
 36218

 36278                                  					;  Only come via GetExtendedError

 36280                                  ;** ----------------------------------------------------------------
 36281                                  ;
 36282                                  ; Entry point used by REDIRector on Network I 24 errors.
 36283                                  ;
 36284                                  ;	ASSUME	DS:NOTHING,ES:NOTHING,SS:DOSDATA
 36285                                  ;
 36286                                  ; ALL I 24 regs set up. ALL Extended error info SET. ALLOWED Set.
 36287                                  ;	EXITHOLD set for restore of ES:BP.

 36289                                  	;entry	NET_I24_ENTRY
 36290                                  NET_I24_ENTRY:
 36291                                  GOT_RIGHT_CODE:
 36292 000060FF 36803E[2003]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE],0	; No INT 24s if already INT 24
 36293 00006105 7404                    	JZ	SHORT NoSetFail

 36295 00006109 EB74                    	JMP	short FailRet
 36296                                  NoSetFail:
 36297 0000610B 368926[8805]            	MOV	[SS:CONTSTK],SP		; SS override
 36298 00006110 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36299 00006111 07                      	POP	ES
 36300                                      
 36301                                  	; Wango!!! We may need to free some user state info... In 
 36302                                  	; particular, we may have locked down a JFN for a user and he may
 36303                                  	; NEVER return to us. Thus,we need to free it here and then
 36304                                  	; reallocate it when we come back.
 36305                                  
 36306 00006112 36833E[AA05]FF          	CMP	word [SS:SFN],-1 ; 0FFFFh
 36307 00006118 740C                    	JZ	short _NoFree

 36317                                  					; Prepare to play with stack
 36318 00006127 36FE06[2003]            	INC	BYTE [SS:ERRORMODE]	; Flag INT 24 in progress

 36320

 36329                                  					; AN000;IFS.I24 error disabled

 36332 0000613C 7404                    	JZ	short i24yes		; AN000;IFS.no
 36333                                  faili24:				; AN000;

 36335 00006140 EB27                    	JMP	short passi24 		; AN000;IFS.exit
 36336                                  i24yes: 				; AN000;

 36338                                  
 36339 00006142 368E16[8605]            	MOV	SS,[SS:USER_SS]
 36340 00006147 268B26[8405]            	MOV	SP,[ES:USER_SP]	; User stack pointer restored
 36341

 36343                                  	;IN	int_fatal_abort		; Fatal error interrupt vector,
 36344                                  					; must preserve ES

 36356                                  criterr_ret_addr:

 36367

 36369                                  	;;;

 36372

 36374 0000617E FB                      	STI
 36375                                  FailRet:
 36376 0000617F 36C42E[8005]            	LES	BP,[SS:EXITHOLD]
 36377                                  	
 36378                                  	; 08/07/2018
 36379                                  
 36380                                  	; Triage the user's reply.
 36381                                  
 36382 00006184 3C01                    	CMP	AL,1
 36383 00006186 723D                    	JB	short CheckIgnore	; 0 => ignore
 36384 00006188 7445                    	JZ	short CheckRetry	; 1 => retry
 36385 0000618A 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3			; 3 => fail
 36386 0000618C 7549                    	JNZ	short DoAbort 		; 2, invalid => abort
 36387                                  
 36388                                  	; The reply was fail. See if we are allowed to fail.
 36389                                  
 36390                                  					; SS override for ALLOWED, EXTOPEN_ON,
 36391                                  					; ALLOWED, FAILERR, WPERR, SFN, pJFN
 36392                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8

 36395                                  DoFail:
 36396 00006196 B003                    	MOV	AL,3			; just in case...
 36397                                  					; AN000;EO. I24 error disabled

 36401 0000619E 7505                    	jnz	short CleanUp 		; AN000;EO. no
 36402

 36404                                  CleanUp:
 36405 000061A5 36C606[2203]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:WPERR],-1

 36408                                  	;jnz	short CleanUp2

 36411 000061B1 7411                    	jz	short Cleanup_retn ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36412                                  CleanUp2:
 36413 000061B3 1E                      	push	ds
 36414 000061B4 56                      	push	si
 36415 000061B5 50                      	push	ax
 36416 000061B6 36A1[AA05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:SFN]
 36417 000061BA 36C536[AE05]            	LDS	SI,[ss:PJFN]
 36418 000061BF 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL
 36419 000061C1 58                      	pop	ax
 36420 000061C2 5E                      	pop	si
 36421 000061C3 1F                      	pop	ds
 36422                                  Cleanup_retn:
 36423 000061C4 C3                      	retn
 36424                                  
 36425                                  	; The reply was IGNORE. See if we are allowed to ignore.
 36426                                  
 36427                                  CheckIgnore:
 36428                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],20h
 36429 000061C5 36F606[4B03]20          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_IGNORE ; Can we?
 36430                                  CheckRI:	; 29/02/2024
 36431 000061CB 74C9                    	jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 36432 000061CD EBD6                    	jmp	short CleanUp
 36433                                  
 36434                                  	; The reply was RETRY. See if we are allowed to retry.
 36435                                  
 36436                                  CheckRetry:
 36437                                  	;test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],10h
 36438 000061CF 36F606[4B03]10          	test	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_RETRY	; Can we?
 36439                                  	;jz	short DoFail			; No, do fail
 36440                                  	;JMP	short CleanUp
 36441                                  	; 29/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36442 000061D5 EBF4                    	jmp	short CheckRI
 36443                                  	
 36444                                  	; The reply was ABORT.
 36445                                  DoAbort:
 36446 000061D7 16                      	push	ss
 36447 000061D8 1F                      	pop	ds
 36448                                  
 36449 000061D9 803E[5703]00            	CMP	byte [CONSWAP],0
 36450 000061DE 7403                    	JZ	short NOSWAP2
 36451 000061E0 E87FD9                  	call	SWAPBACK
 36452                                  NOSWAP2:
 36453                                  	; See if we are to truly abort. If we are in the process of aborting, 
 36454                                  	; turn this abort into a fail.
 36455                                  
 36456                                  	;test	[fAborting],0FFh
 36457                                  	;jnz	short DoFail
 36458                                  
 36459 000061E3 803E[5903]00            	cmp	byte [fAborting],0
 36460 000061E8 75AC                    	JNZ	short DoFail
 36461                                  
 36462                                  	; Set return code
 36463                                  
 36464 000061EA C606[7C05]02            	MOV	BYTE [EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_HARD_ERROR ; 2
 36465 000061EF 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 36466                                  
 36467                                  	; we are truly aborting the process. Go restore information from 
 36468                                  	; the PDB as necessary.
 36469                                  
 36470 000061F1 E97510                  	jmp	exit_inner
 36471                                  
 36472                                  ;** --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36473                                  ;
 36474                                  ; reset_environment checks the DS value against the CurrentPDB. If they are
 36475                                  ; different, then an old-style return is performed. If they are the same,
 36476                                  ; then we release jfns and restore to parent. We still use the PDB at DS:0 as
 36477                                  ; the source of the terminate addresses.
 36478                                  ;
 36479                                  ; Some subtlety: We are about to issue a bunch of calls that *may* generate
 36480                                  ; INT 24s. We *cannot* allow the user to restart the abort process; we may
 36481                                  ; end up aborting the wrong process or turn a terminate/stay/resident into a
 36482                                  ; normal abort and leave interrupt handlers around. What we do is to set a
 36483                                  ; flag that will indicate that if any abort code is seen, we just continue the
 36484                                  ; operation. In essence, we dis-allow the abort response.
 36485                                  ;
 36486                                  ; output:   none.
 36487                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36488                                  
 36489                                  	;entry	reset_environment
 36490                                  	
 36491                                  reset_environment:
 36492                                  	; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36493                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 588Ah 
 36494                                  
 36495                                  ;***	invoke	Reset_Version		; AN007 ;MS. reset version number
 36496                                  
 36497 000061F4 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save PDB of process
 36498                                  
 36499                                  	; There are no critical sections in force. Although we may enter
 36500                                  	; here with critical sections locked down, they are no longer 
 36501                                  	; relevant. We may safely free all allocated resources.
 36502                                  
 36503 000061F5 B482                    	MOV	AH,82h
 36504                                  		; Microsoft Networks - END DOS CRITICAL SECTIONS 0 THROUGH 7
 36505                                  	;int	2Ah 	
 36506 000061F7 CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM
 36507                                  
 36508                                  					; SS override
 36509 000061F9 36C606[5903]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:fAborting],-1	; signal abort in progress
 36510                                  
 36511                                  					; DOS 4.00 doesn't need it
 36512                                  	;CallInstall NetResetEnvironment, MultNET, 34  
 36513                                  					; Allow REDIR to clear some stuff
 36514                                  					; On process exit.
 36515 000061FF B82211                  	mov	ax, 1122h
 36516 00006202 CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - PROCESS TERMINATION HOOK
 36517                                  			; SS = DOS CS
 36518                                  	;mov	al,22h	
 36519 00006204 B022                    	MOV	AL,int_terminate
 36520 00006206 E860AD                  	call	_$GET_INTERRUPT_VECTOR	; and who to go to
 36521                                  
 36522 00006209 59                      	POP	CX			; get ThisPDB
 36523 0000620A 06                      	push	es
 36524 0000620B 53                      	push	bx			; save return address
 36525                                  
 36526 0000620C 368B1E[3003]            	MOV	BX,[SS:CurrentPDB] 	; get currentPDB
 36527 00006211 8EDB                    	MOV	DS,BX
 36528 00006213 A11600                  	MOV	AX,[PDB.PARENT_PID]	; get parentPDB
 36529                                  
 36530                                  	; AX = parentPDB, BX = CurrentPDB, CX = ThisPDB
 36531                                  	; Only free handles if AX <> BX and BX = CX and [exit_code].upper
 36532                                  	; is not Exit_keep_process
 36533                                  	
 36534 00006216 39D8                    	CMP	AX,BX
 36535 00006218 7418                    	JZ	short reset_return	; parentPDB = CurrentPDB
 36536 0000621A 39CB                    	CMP	BX,CX
 36537 0000621C 7514                    	JNZ	short reset_return	; CurrentPDB <> ThisPDB
 36538 0000621E 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save parent
 36539                                  
 36540                                  					; SS override
 36541                                  	;cmp	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 36542 0000621F 36803E[7C05]03          	CMP	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS ; 15/08/2018
 36543 00006225 7406                    	JZ	short reset_to_parent 	; keeping this process
 36544                                  
 36545                                  	; We are truly removing a process. Free all allocation blocks
 36546                                  	; belonging to this PDB
 36547                                  
 36548                                  	;invoke	arena_free_process
 36549 00006227 E87E10                  	call	arena_free_process
 36550                                  
 36551                                  	; Kill off remainder of this process. Close file handles and signal
 36552                                  	; to relevant network folks that this process is dead. Remember that
 36553                                  	; CurrentPDB is STILL the current process!
 36554                                  
 36555                                  	;invoke	DOS_ABORT
 36556 0000622A E883D4                  	call	DOS_ABORT
 36557                                  
 36558                                  reset_to_parent:
 36559                                  					; SS override
 36560 0000622D 368F06[3003]            	POP	word [SS:CurrentPDB]	; set up process as parent
 36561                                  
 36562                                  reset_return:				; come here for normal return
 36563                                  	;Context DS			; DS is used to refer to DOSDATA
 36564 00006232 16                      	push	ss
 36565 00006233 1F                      	pop	ds	
 36566                                  
 36567 00006234 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,-1
 36568                                  
 36569                                  	; make sure that everything is clean In this case ignore any errors,
 36570                                  	; we cannot "FAIL" the abort, the program being aborted is dead.
 36571                                  
 36572                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk
 36573 00006236 E8A9B6                  	call	ECritDisk
 36574                                  	;invoke	FLUSHBUF
 36575 00006239 E86108                  	call	FLUSHBUF
 36576                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk
 36577 0000623C E8D0B6                  	call	LCritDisk
 36578                                  
 36579                                  ; 29/02/2024 - Retrto DOS v5.0
 36580                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36581                                  %if 0
 36582                                  	; Decrement open ref. count if we had done a virtual open earlier.
 36583                                  
 36584                                  	call	CHECK_VIRT_OPEN
 36585                                  %endif
 36586                                  
 36587 0000623F FA                      	CLI
 36588 00006240 C606[2103]00            	MOV	BYTE [INDOS],0		; Go to known state
 36589                                  
 36590                                  	; 29/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36591                                  	;;;
 36592 00006245 C606[B812]00            	mov	byte [INDOS_FLAG],0
 36593                                  	;;;
 36594                                  
 36595 0000624A C606[2203]FF            	MOV	BYTE [WPERR],-1		; Forget about WP error
 36596 0000624F C606[5903]00            	MOV	byte [fAborting],0	; let aborts occur
 36597 00006254 8F06[8005]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD]
 36598 00006258 8F06[8205]              	POP	WORD [EXITHOLD+2]
 36599                                  
 36600                                  	; Snake into multitasking... Get stack from CurrentPDB person
 36601                                  
 36602 0000625C 8E1E[3003]              	MOV	DS,[CurrentPDB]
 36603 00006260 8E163000                	MOV	SS,[PDB.USER_STACK+2]
 36604 00006264 8B262E00                	MOV	SP,[PDB.USER_STACK]
 36605                                  
 36606 00006268 E8D6A1                  	call	restore_world
 36607                                  
 36608                                  	; 05/05/2019
 36609 0000626B 07                      	pop	es ; * ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:94A8h, MSDOS.SYS)
 36610                                  
 36611                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36612 0000626C 50                      	push	ax			; set up ds, but save ds in TEMPSEG
 36613 0000626D 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; and not on stack.
 36614                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 36615 0000626F 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg] 
 36616 00006274 A3[630D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax
 36617 00006277 58                      	pop	ax
 36618                                  					; set up ds to DOSDATA
 36619                                  	;MOV	[CS:USER_SP],AX ; MSDOS 3.3
 36620 00006278 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],ax
 36621                                  
 36622 0000627B 58                      	POP	AX			; suck off CS:IP of interrupt...
 36623 0000627C 58                      	POP	AX
 36624 0000627D 58                      	POP	AX
 36625                                  
 36626                                  ; M011 : BEGIN
 36627                                  
 36628                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36629                                  ;	MOV	AX,0F202h	; STI
 36630                                  
 36631                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36632 0000627E 9F                      	LAHF
 36633 0000627F 86E0                    	XCHG	AH,AL
 36634 00006281 2402                    	AND	AL,2
 36635 00006283 B4F2                    	MOV	AH,0F2h
 36636                                  
 36637                                  ; M011 : END
 36638                                  
 36639                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36640 00006285 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36641                                   
 36642                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD+2]
 36643                                  	;PUSH	word [CS:EXITHOLD]
 36644                                  	
 36645                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36646 00006286 FF36[8205]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD+2]
 36647 0000628A FF36[8005]              	PUSH	word [EXITHOLD]
 36648                                  
 36649                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_SP]
 36650                                  
 36651                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36652 0000628E A1[8405]                	MOV	AX,[USER_SP]
 36653 00006291 8E1E[630D]              	mov	ds,[TEMPSEG]	; restore ds
 36654                                  
 36655 00006295 CF                      	IRET			; Long return back to user terminate address
 36656                                  
 36657                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36658                                  ;
 36659                                  ; Procedure Name : SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR
 36660                                  ;
 36661                                  ; This routine handles extended error codes.
 36662                                  ; Input : DI = error code from device
 36663                                  ; Output: All EXTERR fields are set
 36664                                  ;
 36665                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36666                                  
 36667                                  SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR:
 36668 00006296 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36669                                  					; ErrMap24End is in DOSDATA
 36670 00006297 B8[BB0E]                	MOV	AX,ErrMap24End
 36671 0000629A 2D[AB0E]                	SUB	AX,ErrMap24
 36672                                  					; Change to dosdata to access
 36673                                  					; ErrMap24 and EXTERR -SR
 36674                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36675                                  	
 36676                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36677 0000629D 1E                      	push	ds
 36678                                  	;getdseg <ds>			; ds ->dosdata
 36679 0000629E 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 36680                                  
 36681                                  	; AX is the index of the first unavailable error. Do not translate
 36682                                  	; if greater or equal to AX.
 36683                                  
 36684 000062A3 39C7                    	CMP	DI,AX
 36685 000062A5 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI
 36686 000062A7 7306                    	JAE	short NoTrans
 36687                                  
 36688                                  	;MOV	AL,[CS:DI+ErrMap24]  ; MSDOS 3.3
 36689 000062A9 8A85[AB0E]              	mov	al,[ErrMap24+di] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36690 000062AD 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 36691                                  NoTrans:
 36692                                  	;MOV	[CS:EXTERR],AX
 36693 000062AF A3[2403]                	mov	[EXTERR],AX
 36694 000062B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 36695                                  	;assume	ds:nothing
 36696 000062B3 58                      	POP	AX
 36697                                  
 36698                                  	; Now Extended error is set correctly. Translate it to get correct
 36699                                  	; error locus class and recommended action.
 36700                                  
 36701 000062B4 56                      	PUSH	SI
 36702                                  					; ERR_TABLE_24 is in DOSCODE 
 36703 000062B5 BE[5B0E]                	MOV	SI,ERR_TABLE_24
 36704 000062B8 E8F6A3                  	call	CAL_LK			; Set other extended error fields
 36705 000062BB 5E                      	POP	SI
 36706 000062BC C3                      	retn
 36707                                  
 36708                                  ;============================================================================
 36709                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36710                                  ;============================================================================
 36711                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36712                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36713                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36714                                  
 36715                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36716                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36717                                  
 36718                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36719                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36720                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36721                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36722                                  ;
 36723                                  ;	IsEof
 36724                                  ;	UNPACK
 36725                                  ;	PACK
 36726                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36727                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36728                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36729                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36730                                  ;
 36731                                  ;	Revision history:
 36732                                  ;
 36733                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36734                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36735                                  ;
 36736                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36737                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36738                                  
 36739                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36740                                  
 36741                                  ; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36742                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A40Ch
 36743                                  
 36744                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36745                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36746                                  ;
 36747                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36748                                  ;
 36749                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36750                                  ;
 36751                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36752                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36753                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36754                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36755                                  ;
 36756                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36757                                  
 36758                                  IsEOF:
 36759                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36760                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36761                                  	;;;
 36762 000062BD E89801                  	call	IsFAT32			; is it FAT32 drive ?
 36763 000062C0 730D                    	jnc	short IsEOF_FAT		; no, it has 12 or 16 bit FAT
 36764                                  
 36765                                  	; FAT32 fs
 36766 000062C2 36813E[E80A]FF0F        	cmp	word [ss:CLUSTNUM_HW],0FFFh
 36767 000062C9 7503                    	jnz     short IsEOF_other1	; not EOF
 36768 000062CB 83FBF8                  	cmp     bx,0FFF8h		; 32 bit compare
 36769                                  IsEOF_other1:
 36770 000062CE C3                      	retn 				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36771                                  
 36772                                  IsEOF_FAT:
 36773                                  	;;;
 36774                                  
 36775                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36776 000062CF 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36777 000062D5 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36778                                  
 36779                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36780                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36781                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36782                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36783                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36784                                  
 36785 000062D7 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36786 000062DB 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36787                                  
 36788 000062DD 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36789                                  IsEOF_other:
 36790 000062E1 C3                      	retn
 36791                                  EOF16:
 36792 000062E2 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36793 000062E5 C3                      	retn				; cf=0 -> EOF, cf=1 -> not EOF
 36794                                  
 36795                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36796                                  
 36797                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36798                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36799                                  ;
 36800                                  ; Procedure Name : UNPACK
 36801                                  ;
 36802                                  ; Inputs:
 36803                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36804                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36805                                  ; Outputs:
 36806                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36807                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36808                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36809                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36810                                  ;
 36811                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36812                                  ;
 36813                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36814                                  
 36815                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36816                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A44Eh
 36817                                  	;
 36818                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS .SYS - DOSCODE:9511h)
 36819                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0C368h)
 36820                                  
 36821                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36822                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36823                                  
 36824                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36825                                  UNPACK:
 36826                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36827 000062E6 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36828 000062E8 7519                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36829                                  
 36830                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36831                                  %if 0
 36832                                  	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36833                                  	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36834                                  	retn				; done
 36835                                  %else
 36836                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:A435h
 36837                                  	;;;
 36838                                  up_1:
 36839 000062EA 391E[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],bx ; 0
 36840 000062EE 7513                    	jne	short up_cont
 36841 000062F0 8B3E[3B0F]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY_HW]
 36842 000062F4 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36843 000062F6 893E[EC0A]              	mov	[CCONTENT_HW],di
 36844 000062FA 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]
 36845 000062FE 7502                    	jnz	short unpack_retn
 36846 00006300 09FF                    	or	di,di
 36847                                  unpack_retn:
 36848 00006302 C3                      	retn	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36849                                  	;;;	
 36850                                  
 36851                                  %endif
 36852                                  
 36853                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 36854                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36855                                  	;;;
 36856                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 36857 00006303 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0
 36858 00006308 7510                    	jnz	short up_fat		; not FAT32
 36859                                  	; FAT32
 36860                                  	;mov	si,[es:bp+2Fh]
 36861 0000630A 268B762F                	mov	si,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER+2]
 36862 0000630E 3936[E80A]              	cmp	[CLUSTNUM_HW],si
 36863 00006312 750A                    	jne	short up_2
 36864                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+2Dh]
 36865 00006314 263B5E2D                	cmp	bx,[es:bp+DPB.LAST_CLUSTER]
 36866 00006318 EB04                    	jmp	short up_2
 36867                                  up_fat:
 36868                                  	;;;
 36869                                  
 36870                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 36871                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 36872 0000631A 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[es:bp+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 36873                                  up_2:		; 02/03/2024
 36874 0000631E 7748                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 36875 00006320 E84A01                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 36876 00006323 7240                    	jc	short _DoContext
 36877                                  
 36878                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36879                                  	;;;
 36880 00006325 FF7502                  	push	word [di+2]		; offset CLUSSAVE+2
 36881 00006328 368F06[EC0A]            	pop	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW]	; high word of cluster number
 36882                                  	;;;
 36883                                  
 36884 0000632D 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 36885 0000632F 7521                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 36886                                  
 36887                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36888                                  	;;;
 36889 00006331 E82401                  	call	IsFAT32
 36890 00006334 7211                    	jc	short up_fat32		; FAT32 volume (drive)
 36891 00006336 36C706[EC0A]0000        	mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],0
 36892                                  	;;;
 36893                                  
 36894 0000633D 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 36895 00006341 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10 ; 0FF6h
 36896 00006345 721A                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 36897                                  
 36898                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36899                                  %if 0
 36900                                  	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 36901                                  	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 36902                                  High12:
 36903                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36904                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36905                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36906                                  	SHR	DI,1
 36907                                  %else
 36908                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36909                                  	;;;
 36910                                  up_fat32:
 36911 00006347 09FF                    	or	di,di			; set zero condition code, clears carry
 36912                                  	;mov	si,ss
 36913                                  	;mov	ds,si
 36914 00006349 16                      	push	ss
 36915 0000634A 1F                      	pop	ds
 36916 0000634B 7504                    	jnz	short up_retn
 36917 0000634D 093E[EC0A]              	or	[CCONTENT_HW],di	; [CCONTENT_HW]:DI = 0 -> zf = 1
 36918                                  up_retn:
 36919 00006351 C3                      	retn
 36920                                  
 36921                                  High12:
 36922 00006352 36C706[EC0A]0000        	mov	word [ss:CCONTENT_HW],0
 36923 00006359 D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36924 0000635B D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36925 0000635D D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36926 0000635F D1EF                    	shr     di,1
 36927                                  	;;;
 36928                                  %endif
 36929                                  
 36930                                  Unpack12:
 36931 00006361 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 36932                                  _DoContext:
 36933 00006365 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36934 00006366 1F                      	POP	DS
 36935 00006367 C3                      	retn
 36936                                  
 36937                                  HURTFAT:
 36938                                  
 36939                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36940                                  %if 0
 36941                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 36942                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 36943                                  	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 36944                                  %else
 36945                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36946                                  	;;;
 36947 00006368 E84C02                  	call	chk_set_first_access
 36948                                  	;;;
 36949                                  %endif
 36950                                  
 36951 0000636B 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36952 0000636C B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 36953                                  
 36954                                  ; 02/03/2024
 36955                                  %if 0
 36956                                  
 36957                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36958                                  	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 36959                                  ;
 36960                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 36961                                  ;
 36962                                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 36963                                  	call	FATAL
 36964                                  %else
 36965                                  	; 02/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 36966                                  	;;;
 36967                                  	;mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],8
 36968 0000636E 36C606[4B03]08          	mov	byte [ss:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL
 36969                                  	;
 36970                                  	; 02/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36971 00006374 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 36972 00006376 4F                      	dec	di	; 0FFFFh
 36973 00006377 57                      	push	di
 36974                                  		; NOTE: DI would be 0FFFFh here (or 0FFFh as in MSDOS 6.?)
 36975                                  		; because, in SET_I24_EXTENDED_ERROR in FATAL,
 36976                                  		; DI is compared with error code
 36977                                  		; ;

 36980                                  		; push di

 36982                                  		; pop di

 36984                                  		; ;

 36986                                  	;

 36988 0000637D 53                      	push	bx	; (necessary!?)
