 40156                                  	; ==================================================================
 40157                                  	; validate function
 40158                                  	; ==================================================================
 40159                                  		      	
 40160                                  	; M068 - Start
 40161                                  	;
 40162                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a
 40163                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 40164                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep
 40165                                  	; the A20 off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 40166                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 40167                                  
 40168                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40169 00006BED 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 40170                                  
 40171                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack
 40172                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 40173                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExecReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 40174                                  
 40175 00006BF3 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 40176                                  	;jne	short @f
 40177 00006BF5 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 40178                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 40179 00006BF7 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 40180 00006BF8 B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 40181 00006BFB 51                      	push	cx
 40182                                  ;@@:
 40183                                  Exec_@f:
 40184                                  	; M068 - End
 40185                                  	
 40186                                  	;Enter
 40187                                  
 40188 00006BFC 55                      	push	bp
 40189 00006BFD 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 40190                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 40191                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 40192                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 6.22 & PCDOS 7.1 ; 07/03/2024
 40193                                  	; 17/12/2022
 40194                                  	; 20/05/2019
 40195 00006BFF 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0
 40196                                  
 40197                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40198 00006C02 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 40199                                  					; M030
 40200 00006C04 7611                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 40201                                  
 40202                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 40203                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 40204                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 40205                                  
 40206                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:
 40207                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; 1
 40208                                  					; Extended Error Locus	;smr;SS Override
 40209                                  	; 01/07/2024
 40210 00006C06 E8D4A6                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk
 40211                                  
 40212                                  	;mov	al,1
 40213 00006C09 B001                    	mov	al,error_invalid_function
 40214                                  
 40215                                  Exec_Ret_Err:
 40216                                  	;Leave
 40217 00006C0B 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 40218 00006C0D 5D                      	pop	bp
 40219                                  	;transfer SYS_RET_ERR
 40220 00006C0E E9679A                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 40221                                  
 40222                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 41197                                  ;device drivers are loaded as overlays and have no PSP. To handle them, we
 41198                                  ;use the Sysinit flag provided by the BIOS as part of a structure pointed at
 41199                                  ;by BiosDataPtr. If this flag is set, the overlay call has been issued from
 41200                                  ;Sysinit and therefore must be a device driver load. We then get the lie

 41202                                  ;issues the version check, it gets the lie version until the next overlay
 41203                                  ;call is issued.

 41757                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41758                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 41759                                  ;
 41760                                  ; Input:    DX is an offset from CurrentPDB at which to
 41761                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 41762                                  ;
 41763                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 41764                                  ;	    paragraphs long. An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 41765                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 41766                                  ;
 41767                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41768                                  
 41769                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41770                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)

 41778                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 41779 0000721A 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 41780                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 41781 0000721B 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 41782 00007221 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 41783 00007226 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 41784 00007229 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 41785                                  
 41786 0000722B BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 41787                                  
 41788                                  Keep_Shrink:

 41790 00007230 53                      	push	BX
 41791 00007231 06                      	push	ES
 41792 00007232 E82F02                  	call	_$SETBLOCK		; ignore return codes.
 41793 00007235 1F                      	pop	DS
 41794 00007236 5B                      	pop	BX
 41795 00007237 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 41796                                  
 41797 00007239 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 41798 0000723B 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 41799                                  	;mov	[2],ax
 41800 0000723D A30200                  	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],AX	;PBUGBUG
 41801                                  
 41802                                  Keep_Done:

 41804 00007241 EB26                    	jmp	SHORT exit_inner	; and let abort take care of the rest

 42096                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 42097                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42098                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 42099                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42100                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 42101                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 42102                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42103                                  
 42104                                  arena_next:
 42105 000072DA 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 42106 000072DC 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 42107 000072E0 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 42108                                  
 42109                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 42110                                  ;
 42111                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 42112                                  ;       RETN
 42113                                  
 42114                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 42115                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42116                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 42117                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42118                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 42119                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 42120                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 42121                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 42122                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42123                                  
 42124                                  check_signature:        
 42125                                  
 42126 000072E1 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 42127                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 42128 000072E3 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 42129                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 42130 000072E7 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42131                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42132 000072E9 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 42133                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 42134 000072ED 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 42135 000072EF F9                              STC                             ; set error
 42136                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 42137                                  ;AFP_RETN:	; 10/03/2024
 42138                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 42139                                  check_signature_ok:
 42140                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 42141 000072F0 C3                      	RETN
 42142                                  
 42143                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 42144                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42145                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 42146                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 42147                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 42148                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 42149                                  ;
 42150                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 42151                                  ;		(di) = 0
 42152                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42153                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 42154                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 42155                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 42156                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 42157                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42158                                          
 42159                                  Coalesce:
 42160                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 42161 000072F1 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 42162                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 42163                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 42164 000072F4 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 42165 000072F6 E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 42166                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 42167 000072F9 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 42168                                  
 42169                                  coalesce_check:
 42170                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 42171 000072FB 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 42172                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 42173 00007300 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 42174                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 42175 00007302 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 42176 00007307 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 42177                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 42178 00007308 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 42179 0000730C 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 42180 0000730F 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 42181 00007311 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 42182                                  
 42183                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42184                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 42185                                  
 42186                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 42187                                  
 42188                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42189                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42190                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 42191                                  ;
 42192                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 42193                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 42194                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 42195                                  ;
 42196                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 42197                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 42198                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 42199                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 42200                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 42201                                  ;
 42202                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 42203                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 42204                                  ;
 42205                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42206                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42207                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42208                                  ;           INT     21h
 42209                                  ;
 42210                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 42211                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 42212                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 42213                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 42214                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 42215                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 42216                                  ;
 42217                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 42218                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 42219                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 42220                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 42221                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 42222                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 42223                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 42224                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 42225                                  ;	USES	All
 42226                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42227                                  
 42228                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42229                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42230                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 42231                                  ;
 42232                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42233                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 42234                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 42235                                  ;           INT     21h
 42236                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 42237                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 42238                                  ;
 42239                                  ;   Description:
 42240                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 42241                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 42242                                  ;
 42243                                  ;   Error return:
 42244                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 42245                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42246                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42247                                  
 42248                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42249                                  
 42250                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 42585                                  
 42586                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42587                                  
 42588                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42589                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42590                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 42591                                  ;
 42592                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 42593                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 42594                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 42595                                  ;
 42596                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 42597                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 42598                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 42599                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 42600                                  ;
 42601                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 42602                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 42603                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 42604                                  ;		code.
 42605                                  ;
 42606                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 42607                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 42608                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 42609                                  ;
 42610                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42611                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42612                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 42613                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 42614                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 42615                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 42616                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 42617                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 42618                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42619                                  
 42620                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42621                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42622                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 42623                                  ;
 42624                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42625                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 42626                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 42627                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 42628                                  ;           INT     21h
 42629                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 42630                                  ;         size possible
 42631                                  ;   Error return:
 42632                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 42633                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 42634                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 42635                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 42636                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42637                                  
 42638                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 42639                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42640                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 42641 00007464 E87BA4                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 42642                                  
 42643 00007467 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE
 42644 0000746A 8CC0                            MOV     AX,ES
 42645 0000746C 48                              DEC     AX
 42646 0000746D E871FE                          CALL    check_signature
 42647 00007470 7303                            JNC     SHORT setblock_grab
 42648                                  
 42649                                  setblock_bad:
 42650 00007472 E905FF                          JMP     alloc_trashed
 42651                                  
 42652                                  setblock_grab:
 42653 00007475 8ED8                            MOV     DS,AX
 42654 00007477 E877FE                          CALL    Coalesce
 42655 0000747A 72F6                            JC      SHORT setblock_bad
 42656 0000747C 8B0E0300                        MOV     CX,[ARENA.SIZE]
 42657 00007480 51                              PUSH    CX
 42658 00007481 39CB                            CMP     BX,CX
 42659 00007483 76A5                            JBE     SHORT alloc_get_size
 42660 00007485 E91EFF                          JMP     alloc_fail

 42733                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42734                                  
 42735                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 42736                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42737                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 42738                                  ;
 42739                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42740                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42741                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42742                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42743                                  ;           INT     21h
 42744                                  ;
 42745                                  ;	ENTRY	
 42746                                  ;		(al) = 0
 42747                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 42748                                  ;
 42749                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 42750                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 42751                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 42752                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 42753                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 42754                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 42755                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 42756                                  ;
 42757                                  ;		(al) = 2
 42758                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 42759                                  ;
 42760                                  ;		(al) = 3
 42761                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 42762                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 42763                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 42764                                  ;
 42765                                  ;
 42766                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42767                                  ;
 42768                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 42769                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 42770                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 42771                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 42772                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 42773                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 42774                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 42775                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 42776                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 42777                                  ;
 42778                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42779                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 42780                                  ;
 42781                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 42782                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 42783                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 42784                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 42785                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 42786                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42787                                  
 42788                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 42789                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42790                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 42791                                  ;
 42792                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 42793                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 42794                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 42795                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 42796                                  ;           INT     21h
 42797                                  ;
 42798                                  ;   Error return:
 42799                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_function
 42800                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42801

 43020                                  
 43021                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 43022                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43023                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 43024                                  ;
 43025                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 43026                                  ;
 43027                                  ;
 43028                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 43029                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 43030                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 43031                                  ;		   else
 43032                                  ;			DS = last arena
 43033                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 43034                                  ;
 43035                                  ;		   CY if error
 43036                                  ;
 43037                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 43038                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43039                                  
 43040                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43041                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43042                                  
 43043                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43044                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 43045                                  
 43046                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43047                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B6D9h
 43048                                  
 43049                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A4D6h)
 43050                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:9F25h)
 43051                                  
 43052                                  GetLastArena:
 43053 0000752D 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 43054                                  
 43055 0000752E 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 43056 00007532 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 43057 00007534 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 43058                                  
 43059 00007536 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 43060                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 43061 0000753A 7416                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES
 43062                                  
 43063                                  GLA_next:
 43064 0000753C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 43065 0000753E E899FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 43066                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43067                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 43068                                  	; 17/12/2022

 43181                                  
 43182 0000756D [7175]                  SERVERTAB:	dw	SERVER_DISP
 43183 0000756F [C075]                  SERVERLEAVE:	dw	SERVERRETURN
 43184 00007571 0B                      SERVER_DISP:	db	(SERVER_DISP_END-SERVER_DISP-1)/2 ; = 11
 43185 00007572 [2676]                  		dw	SRV_CALL	; 0
 43186 00007574 [C175]                  		dw	COMMIT_ALL	; 1
 43187 00007576 [F775]                  		dw	CLOSE_NAME	; 2
 43188 00007578 [0076]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID	; 3
 43189 0000757A [0776]                  		dw	CLOSE_UID_PID	; 4
 43190 0000757C [0E76]                  		dw	GET_LIST	; 5

 43194 00007584 [8B76]                  		dw	SPOOL_OPER	; 9
 43195 00007586 [9776]                  		dw	_$SetExtendedError  ; 10

 43198                                  
 43199                                  ;SRVC001E label byte
 43200                                  
 43201                                  SRVC001E:
 43202                                  
 43203                                  ;hkn; TABLE	ENDS
 43204                                  
 43205                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43206                                  ;
 43207                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 43208                                  ;
 43209                                  ; Inputs:
 43210                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 43211                                  ; Function:
 43212                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 43213                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 43214                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 43215                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 43216                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 43217                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 43218                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 43219                                  ;			CX User Index
 43220                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 43221                                  ;			BX = UID
 43222                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 43223                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 43224                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 43225                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 43226                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 43227                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 43228                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 43229                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 43230                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 43231                                  ;
 43232                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43233                                  
 43234                                  	; 10/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43235                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B735h
 43236                                  
 43237                                  _$ServerCall:
 43238                                  	; 13/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43239                                  	; DOSCODE:A4D2h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)		
 43240                                  	; 10/06/2019
 43241                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43242                                  	; DOSCODE:A532h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
 43243                                  
 43244                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43245                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 657Bh
 43246 00007588 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7
 43247 0000758A 7204                    	JB	short SET_STUFF
 43248 0000758C 3C09                    	CMP	AL,9
 43249 0000758E 761A                    	JBE	short NO_SET_ID		; No DPL on calls 7,8,9
 43250                                  SET_STUFF:

 43270                                  NO_SET_ID:

 43560                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 43561                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43562                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 43563                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 43564                                  ;
 43565                                  ;	NOTE:
 43566                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43567                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43568                                  ;
 43569                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43570                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 43571                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 43572                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43573                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 43574                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 43575                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43576                                  
 43577                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43578                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43579                                  
 43580                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 43581                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43582                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43583 000076BB 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43584                                  	
 43585                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 43586 000076C0 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 43587                                  
 43588                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 43589 000076C5 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 43590 000076CA 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 43591                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43592                                  	;mov	al,6
 43593 000076CC B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43594                                  ReturnCarry:
 43595 000076CE F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 43596 000076CF C3                      	retn				; go back
 43597                                  pjfn10: 
 43598                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 43599 000076D0 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 43600 000076D5 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 43601                                  	;clc
 43602                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 43603 000076D7 C3                      	retn
 43604                                  
 43605                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 43606                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43607                                  ;
 43608                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 43609                                  ;
 43610                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 43611                                  ;
 43612                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 43613                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 43614                                  ;                   AX has error code
 43615                                  ;               Carry Reset
 43616                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 43617                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 43618                                  ; NOTE:
 43619                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 43620                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43621                                  ;
 43622                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43623                                  
 43624                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43625                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43626                                  
 43627                                  SFFromHandle:
 43628 000076D8 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 43629                                  	;retc				; return if error
 43630 000076DB 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 43631 000076DD 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 43632                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43633                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43634                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43635                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43636                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43637                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43638 000076E1 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 43639                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 43640                                  	;;mov	al,6
 43641                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 43642                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 43643                                  GetSF:
 43644 000076E3 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 43645 000076E4 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 43646 000076E7 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 43647 000076E9 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 43648 000076EC 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 43649 000076ED C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 43650                                  
 43651                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 43652                                  
 43653                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 43654                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43655                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 43656                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 43657                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 43658                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 43659                                  ;
 43660                                  ;   NOTE:
 43661                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 43662                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 43663                                  ;
 43664                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 43665                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43666                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 43667                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 43668                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 43669                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43670                                  
 43671                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43672                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43673                                  
 43674                                  SFFromSFN:
 43675                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43676                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 43677 000076EE 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 43678                                  
 43679                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 43680 000076F3 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 43681                                  sfsfn5:	
 43682                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 43683 000076F8 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 43684 000076FC 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 43685                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 43686 000076FE 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 43687 00007702 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 43688                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 43689 00007705 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 43690 00007708 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 43691 0000770A F9                      	STC
 43692 0000770B C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 43693                                  sfsfn7:
 43694 0000770C 50                      	push	ax
 43695                                  	;;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 43696                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 5.0 to PCDOS 7.1 (to Win ME) ; 11/03/2024
 43697                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 43698                                  	
 43699                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43700 0000770D B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 43701                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43702                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 43703                                  	
 43704 0000770F F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 43705 00007711 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 43706 00007713 58                      	pop	ax
 43707                                  	;add	di,6
 43708 00007714 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 43709 00007717 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 43710                                  
 43711                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 43712                                  
 43713                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 43714                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43715                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 43716                                  ;
 43717                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43718                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 43719                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 43720                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 43721                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43722                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43723                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 43724                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43725                                  
 43726                                  JFNFree:
 43727 00007718 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 43728                                  jfnf1:	
 43729 0000771A E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 43730 0000771D 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 43731 0000771F 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 43732 00007723 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 43733 00007725 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 43734 00007726 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 43735                                  
 43736                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 43737                                  jfnf5:	
 43738                                  	;mov	al,4
 43739 00007728 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 43740                                  jfnfx:	
 43741 0000772A C3                      	retn				; bye
 43742                                  
 43743                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 43744                                  
 43745                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 43746                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43747                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 43748                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43749                                  ;
 43750                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 43751                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 43752                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 43753                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 43754                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 43755                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 43756                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 43757                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 43758                                  ;
 43759                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 43760                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 43761                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 43762                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 43763                                  ;
 43764                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 43765                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 43766                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 43767                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43768                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 43769                                  ;		'C' set if error
 43770                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 43771                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 43772                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43773                                  
 43774                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43775                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43776                                  
 43777                                  	; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43778                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B8DEh
 43779                                  
 43780                                  SFNFree:
 43781                                  	; 12/08/2018
 43782                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43783                                  	;
 43784                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43785 0000772B 50                      	push	ax
 43786 0000772C 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 43787                                  sfnf5:	
 43788 0000772E 53                      	push	bx
 43789 0000772F E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 43790 00007732 5B                      	pop	bx
 43791 00007733 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 43792 00007735 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 43793                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 43794 00007739 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 43795                                  	
 43796                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 43797 0000773B 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43798                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43799 0000773F 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 43800                                  sfnf7:	
 43801 00007741 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 43802 00007742 EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 43803                                  
 43804                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 43805                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 43806                                  ;
 43807                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43808                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43809                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43810                                  
 43811                                  sfnf10:	
 43812 00007744 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43813                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43814 00007748 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43815 0000774C 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 43816 0000774E 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43817                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 43818 00007752 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43819 00007756 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 43820                                  
 43821                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 43822                                  ;
 43823                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 43824                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 43825                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 43826                                  
 43827                                  sfnf20:
 43828                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43829                                  
 43830                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 43831 00007758 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 43832                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 43833                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 43834                                  
 43835 0000775D 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 43836                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 43837 00007761 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 43838 00007765 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 43839                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 43840 00007769 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 43841                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 43842                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43843                                  	;pop	ax
 43844                                  	;;clc
 43845                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 43846                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43847 0000776D 58                      	pop	ax
 43848                                  	;clc
 43849 0000776E C3                      	retn
 43850                                  
 43851                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 43852                                  ;
 43853                                  ;	'C' set
 43854                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 43855                                  
 43856                                  sfnf95: 
 43857 0000776F 58                      	pop	ax
 43858                                  
 43859                                  ; 11/03/2024
 43860                                  %if 0
 43861                                  	;mov	al,4
 43862                                  	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 43863                                  	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 43864                                  %else
 43865                                  	; 11/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43866                                  	;;;
 43867 00007770 EBB6                    	jmp	short jfnf5
 43868                                  	;;;
 43869                                  %endif

 43871                                  ;============================================================================
 43872                                  ; HANDLE.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 43873                                  ;============================================================================
 43874                                  ; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43875                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43876                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 43877                                  
 43878                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 43879                                  
 43880                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 43881                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43882                                  ;
 43883                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 43884                                  ;
 43885                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 43886                                  ;		path
 43887                                  ;
 43888                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43889                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43890                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 43891                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43892                                  ;
 43893                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43894                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 43895                                  ;	USES	all
 43896                                  ;
 43897                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43898                                  
 43899                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43900                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43901                                  
 43902                                  ; 11/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 43903                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0B926h
 43904                                  
 43905                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A145h)
 43906                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A72Bh)
 43907                                  
 43908                                  _$CLOSE:
 43909                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43910                                  
 43911 00007772 E8F602                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43912 00007775 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 43913 00007777 16                      	push	ss
 43914 00007778 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 43915 00007779 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43916 0000777D 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43917                                  
 43918                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 43919                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 43920                                  ;
 43921                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 43922                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT; if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 43923                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 43924                                  
 43925                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 43926 00007781 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 43927 00007785 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 43928                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 43929 00007787 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 43930                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 43931 0000778B 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 43932                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 43933 0000778D 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 43934 0000778F 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 43935                                  
 43936                                  ; The JFN must be freed. Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 43937                                  ; -1.
 43938                                  
 43939                                  FreeJFN:
 43940 00007791 E827FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; d = pJFN (handle);
 43941 00007794 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 43942                                  PostFree:
 43943                                  
 43944                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 43945                                  
 43946 00007798 E88DBF                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 43947                                  
 43948                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 43949                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 43950                                  
 43951 0000779B 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 43952                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 43953 0000779D B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 43954                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43955                                  CloseOk:
 43956 0000779F E9CC8E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 43957                                  CloseError:
 43958                                  CommitError:	; 11/03/2024
 43959 000077A2 E9D38E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43960                                  
 43961                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 43962                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43963                                  ;
 43964                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 43965                                  ;
 43966                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 43967                                  ;	flushed out. BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 43968                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 43969                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 43970                                  ;
 43971                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 43972                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 43973                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 43974                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 43975                                  ;
 43976                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 43977                                  ;	EXIT	none
 43978                                  ;	USES	all
 43979                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43980                                  
 43981                                  _$COMMIT:
 43982                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 43983                                  
 43984 000077A5 E8C302                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 43985                                  	;JC	short CommitError	; error return
 43986                                  	; 11/03/2024
 43987 000077A8 72F8                    	jc	short CommitError
 43988                                  
 43989 000077AA 16                      	push	ss
 43990 000077AB 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT
 43991 000077AC 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 43992 000077B0 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 43993                                  
 43994                                  ;	ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_COMMIT
 43995                                  ;
 43996                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 43997                                  
 43998 000077B4 E820C1                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 43999 000077B7 72E9                    	JC	short CommitError
 44000                                  	; 07/12/2022
 44001                                  	;jc	short CloseError
 44002                                  	;mov	ah,68h
 44003 000077B9 B468                    	MOV	AH,COMMIT
 44004                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44005                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 44006                                  CommitOk:
 44007 000077BB EBE2                    	jmp	short CloseOk
 44008                                  
 44009                                  ; 11/03/2024
 44010                                  ;CommitError:
 44011                                  ;	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44012                                  ;	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 44013                                  ;	jmp	short CloseError
 44014                                  
 44015                                  ;	BREAK <$ExtHandle - extend handle count>
 44016                                  
 44017                                  ;**	$ExtHandle - Extend Handle Count
 44018                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44019                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 44020                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Number of Opens Allowed (MAX=65534;66535 is
 44021                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 6700H			 reserved to mark SFT
 44022                                  ;	    INT     int_command 		 busy )
 44023                                  ;
 44024                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = new number of handles
 44025                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 44026                                  ;		'C' set iff err
 44027                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 44028                                  ;			 AX = error_not_enough_memory
 44029                                  ;			      error_too_many_open_files
 44030                                  ;	USES	all

 44595                                  ;BREAK <$DUP - duplicate a jfn>
 44596                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44597                                  ;
 44598                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44599                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44600                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup
 44601                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44602                                  ;	  AX has the returned handle
 44603                                  ;   Errors:
 44604                                  ;	    AX = dup_invalid_handle
 44605                                  ;	       = dup_too_many_open_files
 44606                                  ;
 44607                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44608                                  
 44609                                  	; 12/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 44610                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BBEBh
 44611                                  
 44612                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0A95Bh)
 44613                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A3EFh)
 44614                                  
 44615                                  _$DUP:
 44616 0000793F 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; save away old handle in AX
 44617 00007941 E8D4FD                  	call	JFNFree 		; free handle? into ES:DI, new in BX
 44618                                  DupErrorCheck:
 44619 00007944 72F6                    	JC	short DupErr		; nope, bye
 44620 00007946 06                      	push	es
 44621 00007947 57                      	push	di			; save away SFT
 44622 00007948 5E                      	pop	si			; into convenient place DS:SI
 44623 00007949 1F                      	pop	ds
 44624 0000794A 93                      	XCHG	AX,BX			; get back old handle
 44625 0000794B E81D01                  	call	CheckOwner		; get sft in ES:DI
 44626 0000794E 72EC                    	JC	short DupErr		; errors go home
 44627 00007950 E86BB7                  	call	DOS_Dup_Direct
 44628 00007953 E865FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 44629 00007956 268A1D                  	MOV	BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFT number
 44630 00007959 881C                    	MOV	[SI],BL			; stuff in new SFT
 44631                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44632                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; and go home
 44633 0000795B EB5A                    	jmp	short ok_ret
 44634                                  
 44635                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44636                                  ;DupErr:

 44638                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 44639                                  	;jmp	short ft_error

 44641                                  ;BREAK <$DUP2 - force a dup on a particular jfn>
 44642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44643                                  ;
 44644                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44645                                  ;	    MOV     BX, fh
 44646                                  ;	    MOV     CX, newfh
 44647                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Dup2
 44648                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 44649                                  ;   Error returns:
 44650                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 44651                                  ;
 44652                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44653                                  
 44654                                  _$DUP2:
 44655 0000795D 53                      	push	bx
 44656 0000795E 51                      	push	cx			; save source
 44657 0000795F 89CB                    	MOV	BX,CX			; get one to close
 44658 00007961 E80EFE                  	call	_$CLOSE			; close destination handle
 44659 00007964 5B                      	pop	bx
 44660 00007965 58                      	pop	ax			; old in AX, new in BX
 44661 00007966 E852FD                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		; get pointer
 44662 00007969 EBD9                    	JMP	short DupErrorCheck	; check error and do dup

 44664                                  ;BREAK <FileTimes - modify write times on a handle>
 44665                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44666                                  ;
 44667                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44668                                  ;	    MOV AH, FileTimes (57H)
 44669                                  ;	    MOV AL, func
 44670                                  ;	    MOV BX, handle
 44671                                  ;	; if AL = 1 then then next two are mandatory
 44672                                  ;	    MOV CX, time
 44673                                  ;	    MOV DX, date
 44674                                  ;	    INT 21h
 44675                                  ;	; if AL = 0 then CX/DX has the last write time/date
 44676                                  ;	; for the handle.
 44677                                  ;
 44678                                  ;	AL=02		 get extended attributes
 44679                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44680                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44681                                  ;	   DS:SI query list (si=-1, selects all EA)
 44682                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold EA list
 44683                                  ;
 44684                                  ;	AL=03		 get EA name list
 44685                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44686                                  ;	   CX=size of buffer (0, return max size )
 44687                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer to hold name list
 44688                                  ;
 44689                                  ;	AL=04		 set extended attributes
 44690                                  ;	   BX=handle
 44691                                  ;	   ES:DI buffer of EA list
 44692                                  ;
 44693                                  ;
 44694                                  ;   Error returns:
 44695                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 44696                                  ;	       = error_invalid_handle
 44697                                  ;
 44698                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 45011                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 45012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45013                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 45014                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 45015                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 45016                                  ;   that it does not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 45017                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 45018                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 45019                                  ;
 45020                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 45021                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 45022                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 45023                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 45024                                  ;	USES	none
 45025                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45026                                  
 45027                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45028                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45029                                  CheckOwner:
 45030                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45031                                  
 45032 00007A6B E86AFC                  	call	SFFromHandle
 45033 00007A6E 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 45034                                  
 45035 00007A70 50                      	push	ax
 45036

 45044 00007A79 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			;set the zero flag

 45046

 45049                                  	;cmp	ax,[es:di+47]
 45050 00007A81 263B452F                	cmp	ax,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID]
 45051

 45053 00007A85 58                      	pop	ax
