 45075                                  
 45076                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 45077                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 45078                                  
 45079                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 45080                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 45081                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 45082                                  
 45083                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 45084                                  ;
 45085                                  ;	$AssignOper
 45086                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 45087                                  ;	InitCDS
 45088                                  ;	$UserOper
 45089                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 45090                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 45091                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 45092                                  ;
 45093                                  ;   Revision history:
 45094                                  ;
 45095                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 45096                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 45097                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 45098                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 45099                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 45100                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 45101                                  ;				    aliasing.
 45102                                  ;
 45103                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 45104                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 45105                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 45106                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 45107                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 45108                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 45109                                  ;
 45110                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 45111                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 45112                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 45113                                  ;
 45114                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 45115                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 45116                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 45117                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 45118                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 45119                                  ;
 45120                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 45121                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 45122                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 45123                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 45124                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 45125                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 45126                                  ;
 45127                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 45128                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 45129                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 45130                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 45131                                  ;   number.
 45132                                  ;
 45133                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 45134                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 45135                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 45136                                  ;   TransPath.
 45137                                  ;
 45138                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 45139                                  
 45140                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 45141                                  
 45142                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 45143                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 45144                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 45145                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 45146                                  ;					; current drive)
 45147                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 45148                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 45149                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 45150                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 45151                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 45152                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 45153                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 45154                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 45155                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error

 45157                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 45158                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45159                                  ; Inputs:
 45160                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 45161                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 45162                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 45163                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 45164                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 45165                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 45166                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 45167                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 45168                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 45169                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 45170                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45171                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 45172                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 45173                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 45174                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 45175                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 45176                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 45177                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 45178                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 45179                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 45180                                  ; Function:
 45181                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 45182                                  ; Returns:
 45183                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 45184                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45185                                  
 45186                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 45357                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 45358                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45359                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 45360                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 45361                                  ;
 45362                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 45363                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 45364                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 45365                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 45366                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 45367                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 45368                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 45369                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 45370                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 45371                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 45372                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 45373                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45374                                  
 45375                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45376                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45377                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45378                                  _$UserOper:
 45379                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45380                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 45381                                  	;PUSH	AX
 45382                                  	;SUB	AL,1			; quick dispatch on 0,1
 45383                                  	;POP	AX
 45384                                  	; 01/07/2024
 45385 00007B27 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 45386 00007B29 720E                    	JB	short UserGet 		; return to user the string
 45387 00007B2B 742B                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user
 45388 00007B2D 3C05                    	CMP	AL,5			; test for 2,3,4 or 5
 45389 00007B2F 763A                    	JBE	short UserPrint		; yep
 45390                                  
 45391                                  ; 13/03/2024
 45392                                  %if 0
 45393                                  	;mov	byte [ss:EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 45394                                  	MOV	byte [SS:EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ;smr;SS Override 
 45395                                  					; Extended Error Locus
 45396                                  %else
 45397                                  	; 13/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 45669                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 45670                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45671                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 45672                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 45673                                  ;
 45674                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 45675                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 45676                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 45677                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 45678                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 45679                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 45680                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45681                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45682                                  
 45683                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45684                                  TransFCB:
 45685                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45686                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 45687                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 45688                                  	;ENTER
 45689 00007C01 55                      	push	bp
 45690 00007C02 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 45691                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 45692 00007C04 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 45693 00007C07 16                      	push	ss
 45694 00007C08 07                      	pop	es
 45695 00007C09 06                      	push	es
 45696 00007C0A 57                      	push	di
 45697                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 45698                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 45699 00007C0B 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 45700 00007C0E 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 45701 00007C14 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45702 00007C1A E82DA6                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 45703                                  	; 06/12/2022
 45704 00007C1D 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 45705 00007C1F 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 45706 00007C22 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 45707 00007C26 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 45708                                  GetDrive:

 45763                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 45764                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45765                                  ;
 45766                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 45767                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 45768                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 45769                                  ;       exactly.
 45770                                  ;
 45771                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 45772                                  ;       matches splice.
 45773                                  ;
 45774                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 45775                                  ;
 45776                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 45777                                  ;
 45778                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 45779                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 45780                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 45781                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 45782                                  ;
 45783                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 45784                                  ;
 45785                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 45786                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 45787                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 45788                                  ;
 45789                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 45790                                  ;
 45791                                  ;       if fSharing then
 45792                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45793                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45794                                  ;           splice
 45795                                  ;           fatRead
 45796                                  ;           return
 45797                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 45798                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 45799                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45800                                  ;           return
 45801                                  ;       if device then
 45802                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 45803                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 45804                                  ;           return
 45805                                  ;       if file then
 45806                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 45807                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 45808                                  ;           Copy current dir
 45809                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 45810                                  ;           splice
 45811                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 45812                                  ;           if local then
 45813                                  ;               fatread
 45814                                  ;           return
 45815                                  ;
 45816                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 45817                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 45818                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 45819                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 45820                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 45821                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 45822                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 45823                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 45824                                  ;
 45825                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 45826                                  
 45827                                  ; 22/05/2019
 45828                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 45829                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 45830                                  
 45831                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 45832                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 45833                                  
 45834                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 45835                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0BE1Dh
 45836                                  
 45837                                  TransPath:
 45838 00007C63 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 45839 00007C65 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 45840                                  TransPathSet:
 45841 00007C67 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45842                                  SetSplice:
 45843 00007C69 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	; NoSetDir = !fExact;	;smr;SS Override
 45844 00007C6D B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 45845                                  TransPathNoSet:
 45846 00007C6F 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		; fSplice = TRUE;	;smr;SS Override
 45847 00007C73 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 45848 00007C79 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 45849 00007C7E 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 45850 00007C85 16                      	push	ss
 45851 00007C86 07                      	pop	es
 45852                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]

 45963                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 45964                                  %if 0
 45965                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45966                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 45967                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 45968                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 45969                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 45970                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 45971                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 45972                                  ;;;
 45973                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 45974                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 45975                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 45976                                  ;;;
 45977                                  ;;;More info:
 45978                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 45979                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 45980                                  ;;;

 45982                                  start5Dhack:
 45983                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 45984                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 45985                                  
 45986                                  %endif

 46000                                  %endif

 46090

 46094 00007D60 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL

 46102 00007D68 5E                      	pop	si
 46103 00007D69 1F                      	pop	ds
 46104                                  
 46105                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 46106                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 46107                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading

 46119                                  SkipPath:

 46126                                  
 46127                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 46128                                  ; for yucks.

 46132 00007D82 AA                      	STOSB

 46135                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 46136                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..

 46140                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 46141 00007D86 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 46142

 46198                                  ; 13/07/2018
 46199                                  
 46200                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 46201                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46202                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 46203                                  ;
 46204                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 46205                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 46206                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 46207                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 46208                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 46209                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 46210                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 46211                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 46212                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 46213                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 46214                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46215                                  
 46216                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46217                                  
 46218                                  	; 13/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46219                                  
 46220                                  Canonicalize:
 46221                                  
 46222                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 46223                                  
 46224 00007DD8 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 46225 00007DD9 E813E0                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 46226 00007DDC 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 46227 00007DDE 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 46228 00007DE0 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 46229 00007DE2 AA                      	STOSB
 46230 00007DE3 EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 46231                                  CanonDec:
 46232 00007DE5 4E                      	DEC     SI
 46233                                  
 46234                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 46235                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 46236                                  ; buffer.
 46237                                  
 46238                                  CanonLoop:
 46239                                  
 46240                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 46241                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 46242                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 46243                                  
 46244 00007DE6 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 46245 00007DE8 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {
 46246 00007DEA 751A                    	JNZ	short DoComponent
 46247 00007DEC 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 46248 00007DF1 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate
 46249 00007DF3 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'                  ;               *d++ = '\';
 46250 00007DF5 AA                      	STOSB
 46251 00007DF6 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH
 46252                                  DoTerminate:
 46253 00007DF8 AA                      	STOSB                           ;           *d++ = 0;
 46254 00007DF9 F8                      	CLC                             ;           return (0);
 46255 00007DFA C3                      	retn
 46256                                  
 46257                                  CanonBad:
 46258 00007DFB E8C701                  	CALL	ScanPathChar            ; check for path chars in rest of string
 46259                                  	;mov	al,3
 46260 00007DFE B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for bad path error
 46261 00007E00 7402                    	JZ	short PathEnc		; path character encountered in string
 46262                                  	;mov	al,2
 46263 00007E02 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; Set bad file error
 46264                                  PathEnc:
 46265 00007E04 F9                      	STC
 46266                                  CanonBad_retn:
 46267 00007E05 C3                      	retn
 46268                                  
 46269                                  ; We have a textual component that we must copy. We uppercase it and truncate
 46270                                  ; it to 8.3
 46271                                  
 46272                                  DoComponent:                            ;           }
 46273 00007E06 E84C00                  	CALL    CopyComponent		;       if (!CopyComponent (s, d))
 46274 00007E09 72FA                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn	;           return (-1);
 46275                                  
 46276                                  ; We special case the . and .. cases. These will be backed up.
 46277                                  
 46278                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'.' + (0 SHL 8)
 46279 00007E0B 26833D2E                	CMP	WORD [ES:DI],002Eh
 46280 00007E0F 7408                    	JZ	short Skip1
 46281                                  	;CMP	WORD PTR ES:[DI],'..'
 46282 00007E11 26813D2E2E              	CMP     WORD [ES:DI],2E2Eh
 46283 00007E16 7508                    	JNZ	short CanonNormal
 46284 00007E18 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ;           d--;
 46285                                  Skip1:  
 46286 00007E19 E82800                  	CALL    SkipBack                ;           SkipBack ();
 46287                                  	;;mov	al,3
 46288                                  	; 07/07/2024 (*)
 46289                                  	;MOV    AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 46290 00007E1C 72E7                    	jc	short CanonBad_retn ; AL=3 (*)
 46291 00007E1E EB02                    	JMP     short CanonPath         ;           }
 46292                                  
 46293                                  ; We have a normal path. Advance destination pointer over it.
 46294                                  
 46295                                  CanonNormal:                            ;       else
 46296 00007E20 01CF                    	ADD     DI,CX                   ;           d += ct;
 46297                                  
 46298                                  ; We have successfully copied a component. We are now pointing at a path
 46299                                  ; sep char or are pointing at a nul or are pointing at something else.
 46300                                  ; If we point at something else, then we have an error.
 46301

 46494                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 46495                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46496                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 46497                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 46498                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 46499                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 46500                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 46501                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB

 46503                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 46504                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 46505                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise

 46507                                  ;                   left alone

 46594                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 46595                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 46596                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.

 46761                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 46762                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 46763                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46764                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 46765                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 46766                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 46767                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 46768                                  ;           INT     int_command
 46769                                  ;
 46770                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 46771                                  ;       ------          --------
 46772                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 46773                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 46774                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 46775                                  ;
 46776                                  ;   Error returns:
 46777                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 46778                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 46779                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 46780                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 46781                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46782                                  
 46783                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 46784                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 46785                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46786                                  ;
 46787                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 46788                                  ;
 46789                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 46790                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 46791                                  ;
 46792                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 46793                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 46794                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 46795                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 46796                                  ;		'C' set if error
 46797                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 46798                                  ;	USES	all
 46799                                  ;
 46800                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 46801                                  
 46802                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 46803                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 46804                                  
 46805                                  ; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46806                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C194h
 46807                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AF10h)
 46808                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0A9A7h)
 46809                                  
 46810                                  _$OPEN:       
 46811 00007FCE 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 46812                                  _$Open2:
 46813                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 46814 00007FD0 B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 46815 00007FD2 E88C02                  	call	SetAttrib

 46817                                  
 46818                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 46819                                  
 46820 00007FD8 50                      	push	ax
 46821                                  
 46822                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 46823                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 46824                                  ;
 46825                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 46826                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 46827                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 46828                                  ;
 46829                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 46830                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 46831                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 46832                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 46833                                  
 46834                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 46835                                  
 46836                                  AccessFile:
 46837 00007FD9 E80699                  	call	ECritSFT
 46838 00007FDC E84CF7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 46839 00007FDF E82D99                  	call	LCritSFT
 46840                                  	;jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 46841                                  	; 14/03/2024
 46842 00007FE2 7248                    	jc	short OpenFail
 46843                                  
 46844 00007FE4 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 46845 00007FE9 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 46846 00007FEE 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 46847                                  
 46848                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 46849                                  
 46850 00007FF3 E822F7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 46851                                  	;jnc	short SaveJFN
 46852                                  	; 14/03/2024
 46853 00007FF6 7234                    	jc	short OpenFail
 46854                                  	;
 46855                                  ;OpenFailJ:
 46856                                  	;JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 46857                                  
 46858                                  SaveJFN:
 46859 00007FF8 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 46860 00007FFD 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 46861 00008002 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 46862                                  
 46863                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 46864                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 46865                                  
 46866 00008007 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 46867 0000800C 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 46868 0000800F 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 46869 00008011 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 46870 00008014 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 46871 00008015 E84BFC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 46872 00008018 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 46873                                  
 46874 00008019 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 46875                                  	;JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 46876                                  	; 14/03/2024
 46877 0000801E 7260                    	jc	short OpenClean
 46878                                  
 46879 00008020 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 46880 00008026 7408                    	JZ	short SetSearch
 46881                                  	;mov	al,2
 46882 00008028 B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found ; no meta chars allowed
 46883                                  OpenCleanJ:
 46884 0000802A EB54                    	JMP	short OpenClean
 46885                                  
 46886                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 46887                                  	;;;
 46888                                  OpenFail:
 46889 0000802C FB                      	STI
 46890 0000802D 59                      	pop	cx			; Clean stack
 46891                                  	;
 46892 0000802E EB5D                    	jmp	short OpenCritLeave
 46893                                  	;;;
 46894                                  
 46895                                  SetSearch:
 46896 00008030 58                      	pop	ax			; Mode (Open), Attributes (Create)
 46897                                  
 46898                                  ;	We need to get the new inheritance bits.
 46899                                  
 46900 00008031 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 46901                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46902                                  	;mov	[si+2],cx ; 0
 46903 00008033 894C02                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],cx ; initialize mode field to 0
 46904                                  	;mov    [si+51],cx ; 0
 46905 00008036 894C33                  	MOV	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],cx	 ; clean out sharing info
 46906                                  	;
 46907 00008039 81FB[FB31]              	CMP	BX,DOS_OPEN
 46908 0000803D 7509                    	JNZ	short _DoOper
 46909                                  	;test   al,80h
 46910 0000803F A880                    	test	AL,SHARING_NO_INHERIT	; look for no inher
 46911 00008041 7405                    	JZ	short _DoOper ; 10/08/2018
 46912 00008043 247F                    	AND	AL,7Fh			; mask off inherit bit
 46913                                  	;mov	cx,1000h
 46914 00008045 B90010                  	MOV	CX,sf_no_inherit
 46915                                  _DoOper:
 46916                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3
 46917                                  	;;mov	word [si+2], 0
 46918                                  	;;mov	word [si+33h], 0
 46919                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode],0
 46920                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],0
 46921                                  
 46922                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46923                                  ;**	Check if this is an extended open. If so you must set the
 46924                                  ;	modes in sf_mode. Call Set_EXT_mode to do all this. See
 46925                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm
 46926                                  
 46927                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 46928                                  	;SAVE	<di, es>                ;M022 conditional removed here
 46929 00008048 57                      	push	di
 46930 00008049 06                      	push	es
 46931 0000804A 1E                      	push	ds
 46932 0000804B 07                      	pop	es
 46933 0000804C 56                      	push	si
 46934 0000804D 5F                      	pop	di			; (es:di) = SFT address
 46935 0000804E E896B1                  	call	Set_EXT_mode
 46936                                  	;RESTORE <es, di>
 46937 00008051 07                      	pop	es
 46938 00008052 5F                      	pop	di
 46939                                  
 46940                                  	;Context DS
 46941 00008053 16                      	push	ss
 46942 00008054 1F                      	pop	ds	
 46943                                  
 46944 00008055 51                      	push	cx
 46945 00008056 FFD3                    	CALL	BX			; blam!
 46946 00008058 59                      	pop	cx
 46947 00008059 C536[9E05]              	LDS	SI,[THISSFT]
 46948 0000805D 7240                    	JC	short OpenE2		;AN000;FT. chek extended open hooks first
 46949                                  	;jc	short OpenE ; MSDOS 3.3
 46950                                  
 46951                                  ;	The SFT was successfully opened. Remove busy mark.
 46952                                  
 46953                                  OpenOK:
 46954                                  	;MOV	word [SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 46955 0000805F C7040100                	mov	word [SI],1
 46956                                  	;or	[SI+5],cx
 46957 00008063 094C05                  	OR	[SI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],CX ; set no inherit bit if necessary
 46958                                  
 46959                                  ; If the open mode is 70, we scan the system for other SFT's with the same
 46960                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 46961                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 46962                                  ;
 46963                                  ; Since this is only relevant on sharer systems, we stick this code into the
 46964                                  ; sharer.
 46965                                  
 46966                                  	; 01/07/2024
 46967                                  	;;;
 46968 00008066 1E                      	push	ds
 46969 00008067 07                      	pop	es
 46970 00008068 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 46971 0000806A E8B0C9                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry	; set SFT-FCB entry
 46972                                  				 	; in the internal (SFT_FCB) table
 46973                                  				 	; (used for FCB calls only!)
 46974                                  	;;;
 46975                                  	
 46976 0000806D 36A1[AC05]              	MOV	AX,[ss:JFN]				;smr;SS Override
 46977 00008071 36FF1E[C000]            	Call	far [ss:JShare+(12*4)]	; 12 = ShCol	;smr;SS Override
 46978                                  
 46979 00008076 36C706[AA05]FFFF        	MOV	word [ss:SFN],-1	; clear out sfn pointer	;smr;SS Override
 46980                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 46981                                  OpenOkj:
 46982 0000807D E9EE85                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; bye with no errors
 46983                                  
 46984                                  ;	Extended Open hooks check
 46985                                  ;
 46986                                  ;	AL has error code. Stack has argument to dos_open/dos_create.
 46987

 46990                                  OpenE:

 47048                                  ;
 47049                                  ;**	$Creat - Create a File
 47050                                  ;
 47051                                  ;	$Creat creates the directory entry specified in DS:DX and gives it the
 47052                                  ;	initial attributes contained in CX

 47075                                  ;	BREAK <$CHMOD - change file attributes>
 47076                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47077                                  ;
 47078                                  ;**	$CHMOD - Change File Attributes
 47079                                  ;
 47080                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47081                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 47082                                  ;	    MOV     CX, attributes
 47083                                  ;	    MOV     AL,func (0=get, 1=set)
 47084                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47085                                  ;   Error returns:
 47086                                  ;	    AX = error_path_not_found
 47087                                  ;	    AX = error_access_denied
 47088                                  ;
 47089                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47090                                  
 47091                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47092                                  
 47093                                  	; 14/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47094                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C27Ch
 47095                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0AFF4h)
 47096                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0AAB2h)
 47097                                  
 47098                                  _$CHMOD:
 47099                                  	; 14/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47100                                  	;;;
 47101 000080B3 3CFF                    	cmp	al,0FFh		; MS-DOS 7.20 (Win98) - EXTENDED-LENGTH FILENAME OPERATIONS
 47102                                  				; AX = 43FFh
 47103                                  				; BP = 5053h ('PS')
 47104                                  				; CL = function
 47105                                  				; 39h "mkdir" create directory
 47106                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ pathname
 47107                                  				; 56h rename file
 47108                                  				; DS:DX -> ASCIZ filename of existing file (no wildcards)
 47109                                  				; ES:DI -> ASCIZ new filename (no wildcards)
 47110                                  				;
 47111                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
 47112 000080B5 7520                    	jnz	short std_chmod
 47113 000080B7 81FD5350                	cmp	bp,5053h
 47114 000080BB 7515                    	jnz	short chmod_x_2
 47115 000080BD 88CC                    	mov	ah,cl
 47116                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128
 47117 000080BF 36C606[5411]80          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],128 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 47118 000080C5 80F939                  	cmp	cl,39h
 47119 000080C8 7503                    	jne	short chmod_x_1
 47120 000080CA E955A7                  	jmp	mkdir_x
 47121                                  chmod_x_1:
 47122 000080CD 80F956                  	cmp	cl,56h
 47123 000080D0 7472                    	je	short rename_x
 47124                                  chmod_x_2:
 47125 000080D2 B001                    	mov	al,1
 47126                                  	;jmp	short NORERR
 47127                                  	; 15/03/2024
 47128                                  NORERR: 
 47129 000080D4 E9A185                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR

 47131                                  std_chmod:
 47132                                  	;;;
 47133

 47217                                  ;	BREAK <$UNLINK - delete a file entry>
 47218                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47219                                  ;
 47220                                  ;**	$UNLINK - Delete a File
 47221                                  ;
 47222                                  ;
 47223                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 47224                                  ;	    LDS     DX, name
 47225                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 47226                                  ;	     MOV     CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 47227                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Unlink
 47228                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47229                                  ;
 47230                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = path name
 47231                                  ;		(cx) = search_attribute, if via server_dos
 47232                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 47233                                  ;		'C' set if error
 47234                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 47235                                  ;			= error_file_not_found
 47236                                  ;			= error_access_denied
 47237                                  ;
 47238                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47239                                  
 47240                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47241                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C2E4h
 47242                                  
 47243                                  _$UNLINK:
 47244 00008118 51                      	push	cx			; Save possible CX input parm
 47245 00008119 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; Point at input string
 47246 0000811B BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; temp spot for path
 47247 0000811E E846FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; go get normalized path
 47248 00008121 59                      	pop	cx
 47249 00008122 7216                    	JC	short ChModErr		; badly formed path
 47250 00008124 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	; meta chars?	;smr;SS Override
 47251 0000812A 750E                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 47252 0000812C 16                      	push	ss
 47253 0000812D 1F                      	pop	ds
 47254                                  	;mov	ch,6
 47255 0000812E B506                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system ; unlink appropriate files
 47256 00008130 E82E01                  	call	SetAttrib
 47257 00008133 E82EAA                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; remove that file
 47258                                  	;JC	short UnlinkE 		; error is there
 47259                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47260 00008136 729C                    	jc	short NORERR
 47261                                  
 47262                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47263                                  UnlinkOk:
 47264                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; okey doksy
 47265 00008138 EBDB                    	jmp	short OpenOkj3
 47266                                  
 47267                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47268                                  ChModErr:	; 17/12/2022
 47269                                  NotFound:
 47270                                  	;mov	al,3
 47271 0000813A B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 47272                                  ChModE:		; 17/12/2022
 47273                                  UnlinkE:
 47274                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47275                                  	;;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR		; bye
 47276                                  	;jmp	short ChModE
 47277                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47278 0000813C EB96                    	jmp	short NORERR

 47280                                  ;BREAK <$RENAME - move directory entries around>
 47281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47282                                  ;
 47283                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47284                                  ;	    LDS     DX, source
 47285                                  ;	    LES     DI, dest
 47286                                  ;	    IF VIA SERVER DOS CALL
 47287                                  ;	      MOV   CX,SEARCH_ATTRIB
 47288                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Rename
 47289                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47290                                  ;
 47291                                  ;   Error returns:
 47292                                  ;	    AX = error_file_not_found
 47293                                  ;	       = error_not_same_device
 47294                                  ;	       = error_access_denied
 47295                                  ;
 47296                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47297                                  
 47298                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47299                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47300                                  
 47301                                  _$RENAME:
 47302                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47303                                  	;;;
 47304                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67
 47305                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 47306 0000813E 36C606[5411]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 47307                                  rename_x:
 47308                                  	;;;
 47309                                  
 47310                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 47311 00008144 51                      	push	cx
 47312 00008145 1E                      	push	ds
 47313 00008146 52                      	push	dx			; save source and possible CX arg
 47314 00008147 06                      	PUSH	ES
 47315 00008148 1F                      	POP	DS			; move dest to source
 47316 00008149 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI			; save for offsets
 47317 0000814B BF[3E04]                	MOV	DI,RENBUF
 47318 0000814E E816FB                  	call	TransPathSet		; munge the paths
 47319 00008151 36FF36[B205]            	PUSH	word [ss:WFP_START]	; get pointer	;smr;SS Override
 47320 00008156 368F06[B405]            	POP	word [ss:REN_WFP]	; stash it	;smr;SS Override
 47321 0000815B 5E                      	pop	si
 47322 0000815C 1F                      	pop	ds
 47323 0000815D 59                      	pop	cx			; get back source and possible CX arg
 47324                                  epjc2:	
 47325 0000815E 72DA                    	JC	short ChModErr		; get old error
 47326 00008160 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1			;smr;SS Override
 47327 00008166 75D2                    	JNZ	short NotFound
 47328 00008168 51                      	push	cx			; Save possible CX arg
 47329 00008169 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 47330 0000816C E8F8FA                  	call	TransPathSet		; wham
 47331 0000816F 59                      	pop	cx
 47332                                  	;JC	short epjc2

 47334 00008170 72C8                    	jc	short ChModErr
 47335

 47337 00008173 1F                      	pop	ds
 47338 00008174 803E[7A05]FF            	CMP	byte [CMETA],-1
 47339 00008179 72BF                    	JB	short NotFound
 47340                                  
 47341                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 47342                                  	;PUSH	WORD [THISCDS]		   ;AN000;;MS.save thiscds
 47343                                  	;PUSH	WORD [THISCDS+2]	   ;AN000;;MS.
 47344                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 47355                                  rnloop: 				   ;AN000;
 47356 00008188 E856FA                  	call	GetCDSFromDrv		   ;AN000;;MS.
 47357 0000818B 720F                    	JC	short dorn		   ;AN000;;MS.	end of CDS

 47361 00008194 EBF2                    	JMP	short rnloop		   ;AN000;;MS.
 47362                                  rnerr:					   ;AN000;
 47363                                  	;ADD	SP,4			   ;AN000;;MS. pop thiscds
 47364                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47365 00008196 58                      	pop	ax
 47366 00008197 58                      	pop	ax

 47378                                  	POP	WORD [SS:THISCDS]	   ;AN000;;MS.;PBUGBUG;SS REQD??
 47379                                  %endif
