 47405                                  ;Break <$CreateNewFile - Create a new directory entry>
 47406                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47407                                  ;   CreateNew - Create a new directory entry. Return a file handle if there
 47408                                  ;	was no previous directory entry, and fail if a directory entry with
 47409                                  ;	the same name existed previously.
 47410                                  ;
 47411                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an ASCIZ file name
 47412                                  ;		CX contains default file attributes
 47413                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Clear:
 47414                                  ;		    AX has file handle opened for read/write
 47415                                  ;		Carry Set:
 47416                                  ;		    AX has error code
 47417                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 47418                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47419                                  
 47420                                  _$CreateNewFile:
 47421 000081B2 51                      	push	cx			; Save attributes on stack
 47422 000081B3 B9[9131]                	MOV	CX,DOS_Create_New	; routine to call
 47423 000081B6 E9F1FE                  	JMP	AccessSet		; use good ol' open
 47424                                  
 47425                                  ;**	BinToAscii - convert a number to a string.
 47426                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47427                                  ;	BinToAscii converts a 16 bit number into a 4 ascii characters.
 47428                                  ;	This routine is used to generate temp file names so we don't spend
 47429                                  ;	the time and code needed for a true hex number, we just use
 47430                                  ;	A thorugh O.
 47431                                  ;
 47432                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = value
 47433                                  ;		(es:di) = destination
 47434                                  ;	EXIT	(es:di) updated by 4
 47435                                  ;	USES	cx, di, flags
 47436                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47437                                  
 47438                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 47439                                  ;BinToAscii:
 47440                                  ;	mov     cx,4
 47441                                  ;bta5:
 47442                                  ;	push    cx
 47443                                  ;	mov     cl,4
 47444                                  ;	rol     ax,cl
 47445                                  ;	push    ax
 47446                                  ;	and     al,0Fh
 47447                                  ;	add     al,'0'
 47448                                  ;	cmp     al,'9'
 47449                                  ;	jbe     short bta6
 47450                                  ;	add     al,7
 47451                                  ;bta6: 
 47452                                  ;	stosb
 47453                                  ;	pop     ax
 47454                                  ;	pop     cx
 47455                                  ;	loop    bta5
 47456                                  ;	retn
 47457                                  
 47458                                  ; 15/03/2024
 47459                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 & Windows ME
 47460                                  ; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0B0D9h)
 47461                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0ABA4h)
 47462                                  %if 0
 47463                                  
 47464                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 47465                                  BinToAscii:
 47466                                  	mov	cx,404h			; (ch) = digit counter, (cl) = shift cnt
 47467                                  bta5:	
 47468                                  	ROL	AX,CL			; move leftmost nibble into rightmost
 47469                                  	push	ax			; preserve remainder of digits
 47470                                  	AND	AL,0Fh			; grab low nibble
 47471                                  	ADD	AL,'A'			; turn into ascii
 47472                                  	STOSB				; drop in the character
 47473                                  	pop	ax			; (ax) = shifted number
 47474                                  	dec	ch
 47475                                  	jnz	short bta5		; process 4 digits
 47476                                  	retn
 47477                                  %else
 47478                                  ; 15/03/2024
 47479                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0C385h
 47480                                  
 47481                                  BinToAscii:
 47482 000081B9 50                      	push	ax		; convert a number to a string ; ax = value
 47483 000081BA 86E0                    	xchg	ah,al
 47484                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 47485 000081BC D410                    	aam	10h		; AH = AL / 16 and AL = remainder
 47486 000081BE 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; 'AA'
 47487 000081C1 AB                      	stosw
 47488 000081C2 58                      	pop	ax
 47489                                  	;db	0D4h,10h
 47490 000081C3 D410                    	aam	10h
 47491 000081C5 054141                  	add	ax,4141h	; add ax,'AA'
 47492 000081C8 AB                      	stosw
 47493 000081C9 C3                      	retn	
 47494                                  %endif
 47495                                  
 47496                                  ;Break	<$CreateTempFile - create a unique name>
 47497                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47498                                  ;   $CreateTemp - given a directory, create a unique name in that directory.
 47499                                  ;	Method used is to get the current time, convert to a name and attempt
 47500                                  ;	a create new. Repeat until create new succeeds.
 47501                                  ;
 47502                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a null terminated directory name.
 47503                                  ;		CX  contains default attributes
 47504                                  ;   Outputs:	Unique name is appended to DS:DX directory.
 47505                                  ;		AX has handle
 47506                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 47507                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47508                                  
 47509                                  	; 10/07/2024
 47510                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47511                                  	; 15/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47512                                  
 47513                                  _$CreateTempFile:
 47514                                  	;Enter
 47515 000081CA 55                      	push	bp
 47516 000081CB 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 47517                                  
 47518                                  	;LocalVar  EndPtr,DWORD
 47519                                  	;LocalVar  FilPtr,DWORD
 47520                                  	;LocalVar  Attr,WORD
 47521                                  
 47522 000081CD 83EC0A                  	sub	sp,10
 47523                                  
 47524                                  	;test	cx,0FFD8h
 47525 000081D0 F7C1D8FF                	test	CX,~attr_changeable
 47526 000081D4 7405                    	JZ	short OKatts		; Ok if no non-changeable bits set
 47527                                  
 47528                                  ; We need this "hook" here to detect these cases (like user sets one both of
 47529                                  ; vol_id and dir bits) because of the structure of the or $CreateNewFile loop
 47530                                  ; below. The code loops on error_access_denied, but if one of the non
 47531                                  ; changeable attributes is specified, the loop COULD be infinite or WILL be
 47532                                  ; infinite because CreateNewFile will fail with access_denied always. Thus we
 47533                                  ; need to detect these cases before getting to the loop.
 47534                                  
 47535                                  	;mov	ax, 5
 47536 000081D6 B80500                  	MOV	AX,error_access_denied
 47537 000081D9 EB7A                    	JMP	SHORT SETTMPERR
 47538                                  
 47539                                  OKatts:
 47540                                  	;MOV	attr,CX 		; save attribute
 47541 000081DB 894EF6                  	mov     [bp-10],cx
 47542                                  	;MOV	FilPtrL,DX		; pointer to file
 47543 000081DE 8956F8                  	mov	[bp-8],dx
 47544                                  	;MOV	FilPtrH,DS
 47545 000081E1 8C5EFA                  	mov	[bp-6],ds
 47546                                  	;MOV	EndPtrH,DS		; seg pointer to end of dir
 47547 000081E4 8C5EFE                  	mov	[bp-2],ds
 47548 000081E7 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 47549 000081E8 07                      	POP	ES			; destination for nul search
 47550 000081E9 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 47551 000081EB 89F9                    	MOV	CX,DI
 47552 000081ED F7D9                    	NEG	CX			; number of bytes remaining in segment
 47553                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 47554 000081EF 09C9                    	OR	CX,CX			;AN000;MS. cx=0 ? ds:dx on segment boundary
 47555 000081F1 7501                    	JNZ	short okok		;AN000;MS. no
 47556                                  	;MOV	CX,-1			;AN000;MS.
 47557                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47558                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47559 000081F3 49                      	dec	cx  ; mov cx,-1
 47560                                  	;mov	cx,-1 ; 0FFFh
 47561                                  okok:					;AN000;
 47562 000081F4 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			;AN000;
 47563 000081F6 F2AE                    	REPNZ	SCASB			;AN000;
 47564                                  					;AN000;
 47565 000081F8 4F                      	DEC	DI			; point back to the null
 47566 000081F9 268A45FF                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI-1]		; Get char before the NUL
 47567 000081FD E8EFDB                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; Is it a path separator?
 47568 00008200 7403                    	JZ	short SETENDPTR		; Yes
 47569                                  STOREPTH:
 47570 00008202 B05C                    	MOV	AL,'\'
 47571 00008204 AA                      	STOSB				; Add a path separator (and INC DI)
 47572                                  SETENDPTR:
 47573                                  	; 10/07/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 47574                                  	;MOV	EndPtrL,DI		; pointer to the tail
 47575                                  	; 09/07/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix - Erdogan Tan - Istanbul)
 47576                                  	; (Note: I find this Retro DOS v4 Kernel bug while searching the reason
 47577                                  	;  of the AutoCAD R12 running/startup problem. Now it is solved here.)
 47578                                  	;mov	[bp-4],dl ; (Retro DOS v4 !Bug!)
 47579 00008205 897EFC                  	mov	[bp-4],di ; !Fix!
 47580                                  CreateLoop:
 47581 00008208 16                      	push	ss			; let ReadTime see variables
 47582 00008209 1F                      	pop	ds
 47583 0000820A 55                      	push	bp
 47584 0000820B E87C89                  	call	READTIME		; go get time
 47585 0000820E 5D                      	pop	bp
 47586                                  ;
 47587                                  ; Time is in CX:DX. Go drop it into the string.
 47588                                  ;
 47589                                  	;les	di,EndPtr		; point to the string
 47590 0000820F C47EFC                  	les	di,[BP-4]
 47591 00008212 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 47592 00008214 E8A2FF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store upper word
 47593 00008217 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx
 47594 00008219 E89DFF                  	call	BinToAscii		; store lower word
 47595 0000821C 30C0                    	xor	al,al
 47596 0000821E AA                      	STOSB				; nul terminate
 47597                                  	;LDS	DX,FilPtr		; get name
 47598 0000821F C556F8                  	lds	dx,[bp-8]
 47599                                  	;MOV	CX,Attr 		; get attr
 47600 00008222 8B4EF6                  	mov	cx,[bp-10]
 47601 00008225 55                      	push	bp
 47602 00008226 E889FF                  	CALL	_$CreateNewFile		; try to create a new file
 47603 00008229 5D                      	pop	bp
 47604 0000822A 732A                    	JNC	short CreateDone	; failed, go try again
 47605                                  
 47606                                  ; The operation failed and the error has been mapped in AX. Grab the extended
 47607                                  ; error and figure out what to do.
 47608                                  
 47609                                  	;; MSDOS 3.3			; M049 - start
 47610                                  ;;	mov	ax,[ss:EXTERR]				;smr;SS Override
 47611                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_file_exists
 47612                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; file existed => try with new name
 47613                                  ;;	cmp	al,error_access_denied
 47614                                  ;;	jz	short CreateLoop	; access denied (attr mismatch)
 47615                                  
 47616                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 47617                                  	;cmp	al,50h
 47618 0000822C 3C50                    	CMP	AL,error_file_exists	; Q: did file already exist
 47619 0000822E 74D8                    	JZ	short CreateLoop	; Y: try again
 47620                                  	;cmp	al,5
 47621 00008230 3C05                    	CMP	AL,error_access_denied	; Q: was it access denied
 47622 00008232 7521                    	JNZ	short SETTMPERR		; N: Error out
 47623                                  					; Y: Check to see if we got this due
 47624                                  					;    to the network drive. Note that
 47625                                  					;    the redir will set the exterr
 47626                                  					;    to error_cannot_make if this is 
 47627                                  					;    so.
 47628                                  ; 15/03/2024
 47629                                  %if 0
 47630                                  	CMP	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_net_access_denied ; M069
 47631                                  					; See if it's REALLY an att mismatch
 47632                                  	je	short SETTMPERR		; no, network error, stop
 47633                                  ;M070
 47634                                  ; If the user failed on an I24, we do not want to try again
 47635                                  ;
 47636                                  	cmp	byte [SS:EXTERR],error_FAIL_I24 ;User failed on I24? ;M070
 47637                                  	;je	short SETTMPERR		;yes, do not try again ;M070
 47638                                  
 47639                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop	;attr mismatch, try again ;M070
 47640                                  	; 17/12/2022
 47641                                  	jne	short CreateLoop ; 10/06/2019 
 47642                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 47643                                  	;jz	short SETTMPERR
 47644                                  	;jmp	short CreateLoop
 47645                                  %else
 47646                                  	; 15/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 47647                                  	;;;
 47648 00008234 36A0[2403]              	mov	al,[ss:EXTERR]
 47649 00008238 3C41                    	cmp	al,41h			; error_net_access_denied
 47650 0000823A 7419                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 47651 0000823C 3C53                    	cmp	al,53h			; error_FAIL_I24
 47652 0000823E 7415                    	je	short SETTMPERR
 47653 00008240 3C50                    	cmp	al,50h			; error_file_exists
 47654 00008242 74C4                    	je	short CreateLoop
 47655 00008244 36C43E[A205]            	les	di,[ss:THISCDS]
 47656 00008249 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh ; -1
 47657 0000824C 74BA                    	je	short CreateLoop	; No CDS
 47658                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 47659                                  	;test	word [es:di+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 47660 0000824E 26F6454480              	test	byte [es:di+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 47661 00008253 75B3                    	jnz	short CreateLoop
 47662                                  	;;;
 47663                                  %endif
 47664                                  
 47665                                  ;;	MOV	AL,error_access_denied	; Return this "extended" error
 47666                                  					; M049 - end
 47667                                  SETTMPERR:
 47668 00008255 F9                      	STC
 47669                                  CreateDone:
 47670                                  	;Leave
 47671 00008256 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 47672 00008258 5D                      	pop	bp
 47673 00008259 7203                    	JC	short CreateFail
 47674 0000825B E91084                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK		; success!
 47675                                  CreateFail:
 47676 0000825E E91784                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 47677                                  
 47678                                  ;   SetAttrib will set the search attribute (SAttrib) either to the normal
 47679                                  ;   (CH) or to the value in CL if the current system call is through
 47680                                  ;   serverdoscall.
 47681                                  ;
 47682                                  ;   Inputs:	fSharing == FALSE => set sattrib to CH
 47683                                  ;		fSharing == TRUE => set sattrib to CL
 47684                                  ;   Outputs:	none
 47685                                  ;   Registers changed:	CX

 47713                                  ;Break	<Extended_Open- Extended open the file>
 47714                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47715                                  ; Input: AL= 0 reserved  AH=6CH
 47716                                  ;	 BX= mode
 47717                                  ;	 CL= create attribute  CH=search attribute (from server)
 47718                                  ;	 DX= flag
 47719                                  ;	 DS:SI = file name
 47720                                  ;	 ES:DI = parm list
 47721                                  ;			   DD  SET EA list (-1) null
 47722                                  ;			   DW  n  parameters
 47723                                  ;			   DB  type (TTTTTTLL)
 47724                                  ;			   DW  IOMODE
 47725                                  ; Function: Extended Open
 47726                                  ; Output: carry clear
 47727                                  ;		     AX= handle
 47728                                  ;		     CX=1 file opened
 47729                                  ;			2 file created/opened
 47730                                  ;			3 file replaced/opened
 47731                                  ;	  carry set: AX has error code
 47732                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47733

 47956                                  ;BREAK <$LockOper - Lock Calls>
 47957                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47958                                  ;
 47959                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47960                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle	       (DOS 3.3)
 47961                                  ;	    MOV     CX, OffsetHigh
 47962                                  ;	    MOV     DX, OffsetLow
 47963                                  ;	    MOV     SI, LengthHigh
 47964                                  ;	    MOV     DI, LengthLow
 47965                                  ;	    MOV     AH, LockOper
 47966                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 47967                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47968                                  ;
 47969                                  ;   Error returns:
 47970                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47971                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47972                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47973                                  ;
 47974                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 47975                                  ;	    MOV     AX, 5C??	       (DOS 4.00)
 47976                                  ;
 47977                                  ;				    0? lock all
 47978                                  ;				    8? lock write
 47979                                  ;				    ?2 lock multiple
 47980                                  ;				    ?3 unlock multiple
 47981                                  ;				    ?4 lock/read
 47982                                  ;				    ?5 write/unlock
 47983                                  ;				    ?6 add (lseek EOF/lock/write/unlock)
 47984                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 47985                                  ;	    MOV     CX, count or size
 47986                                  ;	    LDS     DX, buffer
 47987                                  ;	    INT     21h
 47988                                  ;
 47989                                  ;   Error returns:
 47990                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 47991                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 47992                                  ;	       = error_lock_violation
 47993                                  ;
 47994                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 47995                                  
 47996                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 47997                                  
 47998                                  	; 17/03/2024
 47999                                  	; 16/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 48237                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 48240                                  ;	[USER_ID] Set

 48242                                  ; Function:
 48243                                  ;	Check for lock violations on local I/O
 48244                                  ;	Retries are attempted with sleeps in between
 48245                                  ; Outputs:
 48246                                  ;    Carry clear
 48247                                  ;	Operation is OK
 48248                                  ;    Carry set
 48249                                  ;	A lock violation detected
 48250                                  ; Outputs of SETUP preserved
 48251                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48252

 48257                                  LockRetry:

 48259 000083EE 50                      	push	ax ; MSDOS 6.0
 48260                                  
 48261                                  	;MSDOS 3.3
 48262                                  	;Call	far [ss:JShare+(8*4)]	; 8 = chk_block
 48263                                  	;MSDOS 6.0

 48265

 48267 000083F4 5B                      	pop	bx		; restrore regs
 48268 000083F5 7307                    	jnc	short lc_ret_label ; There are no locks (retnc)
 48269                                  LockN:

 48271 000083FA 4B                      	DEC	BX		; remember a retry

 48463                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48464                                  ;   ShareEnd - terminate sharing info on a particular SFT/UID/PID. This does
 48465                                  ;       NOT perform a close, it merely asserts that the sharing information
 48466                                  ;       for the SFT/UID/PID may be safely released.
 48467                                  ;
 48468                                  ;   Inputs:     ES:DI points to an SFT
 48469                                  ;   Outputs:    None
 48470                                  ;   Registers modified: all except DS,ES,DI
 48471                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48472                                  
 48473                                  ShareEnd:
 48474                                  	; 26/07/2019
 48475 00008489 FF1E[9800]              	call	far [JShare+(2*4)]	; 2 = MFTClose
 48476 0000848D C3                      	retn
 48477                                  
 48478                                  ;Break <ShareEnter - attempt to enter a node into the sharing set>
 48479                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48480                                  ;   ShareEnter - perform a retried entry of a nodde into the sharing set. If
 48481                                  ;   the max number of retries is exceeded, we notify the user via int 24.
 48482                                  ;
 48483                                  ;   Inputs:     ThisSFT points to the SFT
 48484                                  ;               WFP_Start points to the WFP
 48485                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry clear => successful entry
 48486                                  ;               Carry set => failed system call
 48487                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 48488                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48489                                  
 48490                                  ShareEnter:
 48491 0000848E 51                      	push	cx
 48492                                  retry:
 48493 0000848F 8B0E[1A00]              	mov     cx,[RetryCount]
 48494                                  attempt:
 48495 00008493 C43E[9E05]              	les     di,[THISSFT]		; grab sft
 48496 00008497 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 48497                                   	;mov	[es:di+51],ax
 48498 00008499 26894533                	MOV     [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_MFT],AX ; indicate free SFT
 48499 0000849D 51                      	push	cx
 48500 0000849E E8ABFF                  	call    SHARE_CHECK             ; attempt to enter into the sharing set
 48501 000084A1 59                      	pop	cx
 48502 000084A2 730A                    	jnc	short done		; success, let the user see this
 48503 000084A4 E83D93                  	call	Idle                    ; wait a while
 48504 000084A7 E2EA                    	loop    attempt                 ; go back for another attempt
 48505 000084A9 E8A5FF                  	call    SHARE_VIOLATION         ; signal the problem to the user
 48506 000084AC 73E1                    	jnc	short retry		; user said to retry, go do it
 48507                                  done:
 48508 000084AE 59                      	pop	cx
 48509 000084AF C3                      	retn

 48512                                  ; EXEPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 48513                                  ;============================================================================
 48514                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 48515                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 48516                                  
 48517                                  ;** EXEPATCH.ASM 
 48518                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48519                                  ;	Contains the foll:
 48520                                  ;
 48521                                  ;		- code to find and overlay buggy unpack code
 48522                                  ;		- new code to be overlayed on buggy unpack code 
 48523                                  ;		- old code sequence to identify buggy unpack code
 48524                                  ;
 48525                                  ;	Revision history:
 48526                                  ;
 48527                                  ;		Created: 5/14/90
 48528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48529                                  
 48530                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48531                                  ;
 48532                                  ; M020 : Fix for rational bug - for details see routine header
 48533                                  ; M028 : 4b04 implementation
 48534                                  ; M030 : Fixing bug in EXEPACKPATCH (EXEC_CS is an un-relocated value)
 48535                                  ; M032 : set turnoff bit only if DOS in HMA.
 48536                                  ; M033 : if IP < 2 then not exepacked.
 48537                                  ; M046 : support for a 4th version of exepacked files.
 48538                                  ; M068 : support for copy protected apps.
 48539                                  ; M071 : use A20OFF_COUNT of 10.
 48540                                  ;
 48541                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48542                                  
 48543                                  PATCH1_COM_OFFSET	EQU	06CH
 48544                                  PATCH1_OFFSET		EQU	028H
 48545                                  PATCH1_CHKSUM		EQU	0EF4EH
 48546                                  CHKSUM1_LEN		EQU	11CH/2 ; 142
 48547                                  
 48548                                  PATCH2_COM_OFFSET	EQU	076H
 48549                                  PATCH2_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 48550                                  
 48551                                  	; The strings that start at offset 076h have two possible 
 48552                                  	; check sums that are defined as PATCH2_CHKSUM PATCH2A_CHKSUM
 48553                                  
 48554                                  PATCH2_CHKSUM		EQU	78B2H
 48555                                  CHKSUM2_LEN		EQU	119H/2
 48556                                  PATCH2A_CHKSUM		EQU	1C47H		; M046
 48557                                  CHKSUM2A_LEN		EQU	103H/2		; M046
 48558                                  
 48559                                  PATCH3_COM_OFFSET	EQU	074H
 48560                                  PATCH3_OFFSET		EQU	032H
 48561                                  PATCH3_CHKSUM		EQU	4EDEH
 48562                                  CHKSUM3_LEN		EQU	117H/2
 48563                                  
 48564                                  ;**	Data structure passed for ExecReady call
 48565                                  ;
 48566                                  ;struc ERStruc
 48567                                  ; .ER_Reserved:	resw	1	; reserved, should be zero
 48568                                  ; .ER_Flags:	resw	1
 48569                                  ; .ER_ProgName:	resd	1	; ptr to ASCIIZ str of prog name
 48570                                  ; .ER_PSP:	resw	1	; PSP of the program
 48571                                  ; .ER_StartAddr: resd	1	; Start CS:IP of the program
 48572                                  ; .ER_ProgSize:	resd	1	; Program size including PSP
 48573                                  ; .size:
 48574                                  ;endstruc
 48575                                  
 48576                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 48577                                  
 48578                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48579                                  	; DOSCODE:B3DDh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 48580                                  
 48581                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48582                                  	; DOSCODE:B37Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 48583                                  
 48584                                  	; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48585                                  	; DOSCODE:C697h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 48586                                  
 48587                                  ; M028 - BEGIN
 48588                                  
 48589                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48590                                  ;
 48591                                  ;	Procedure Name		: ExecReady
 48592                                  ;
 48593                                  ;	Input			: DS:DX -> ERStruc (see exe.inc)
 48594                                  ;
 48595                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48596                                  
 48597                                  ExecReady:
 48598 000084B0 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; move the pointer into a friendly one
 48599                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 48600                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48601 000084B2 F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 48602                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; COM or EXE ?
 48603 000084B6 7418                    	jz	short er_setver		; only setver for .COM files
 48604                                  
 48605                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 48606 000084B8 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 48607 000084BB 83C010                  	add	ax,10h
 48608 000084BE 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 48609                                  
 48610                                  	;mov	cx,[si+10]
 48611 000084C0 8B4C0A                  	mov	cx,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr]   ; M030
 48612                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12]	; 11/04/2024
 48613 000084C3 8B440C                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_StartAddr+2] ; M030
 48614                                  
 48615                                  	;call	[ss:FixExePatch]
 48616 000084C6 36FF16[670D]            	call	word [ss:FixExePatch] ; 28/12/2022
 48617                                  	
 48618                                  	; 20/03/2024
 48619                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 48620 000084CB 36FF16[3E13]            	call	word [ss:Rational386PatchPtr]
 48621                                  
 48622                                  er_setver:
 48623                                  	;;test	word [si+2],2		; Q: is this an overlay
 48624                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48625 000084D0 F6440202                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY ; 2
 48626                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_OVERLAY
 48627 000084D4 7518                    	jnz	short er_chkdoshi	; Y: set A20OFF_COUNT if DOS high
 48628                                  					; N: set up lie version first
 48629 000084D6 1E                      	push	ds
 48630 000084D7 56                      	push	si
 48631                                  	;lds	si,[si+4]
 48632 000084D8 C57404                  	lds	si,[si+ERStruc.ER_ProgName]
 48633 000084DB E8DCEC                  	call	Scan_Execname1
 48634 000084DE E8EDEC                  	call	Scan_Special_Entries
 48635 000084E1 5E                      	pop	si
 48636 000084E2 1F                      	pop	ds
 48637                                  	;mov	es,[si+8]
 48638 000084E3 8E4408                  	mov	es,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]
 48639 000084E6 36A1[BB0E]              	mov	ax,[ss:SPECIAL_VERSION]
 48640                                  	;mov	[es:40h],ax ; 11/04/2024
 48641 000084EA 26A34000                	mov	[es:PDB.Version],ax
 48642                                  
 48643                                  er_chkdoshi:
 48644 000084EE 36803E[660D]00          	cmp	byte [ss:DosHasHMA],0	; M032: Q: is dos in HMA (M021)
 48645 000084F4 741F                    	je	short er_done		; M032: N: done
 48646                                  
 48647                                  					; M068 - Start
 48648                                  	;mov	ax,[si+8]
 48649 000084F6 8B4408                  	mov	ax,[si+ERStruc.ER_PSP]	; ax = PSP
 48650                                  
 48651                                  	;or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],4
 48652 000084F9 36800E[8600]04          	or	byte [ss:DOS_FLAG],EXECA20OFF ; Set bit to signal int 21
 48653                                  					; ah = 25 & ah= 49. See dossym.inc 
 48654                                  					; under TAG M003 & M009 for 
 48655                                  					; explanation
 48656                                  	;;test	word [si+2],1
 48657                                  	; 17/12/2022
 48658 000084FF F6440201                	test	byte [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; 1
 48659                                  	;test	word [si+ERStruc.ER_Flags],ER_EXE ; Q: COM file
 48660 00008503 7507                    	jnz	short er_setA20		; N: inc a20off_count, set 
 48661                                  					;    a20off_psp and ret
 48662 00008505 1E                         	push	ds
 48663 00008506 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; DS = load segment of com file.
 48664 00008508 E8AC05                  	call	IsCopyProt		; check if copy protected
 48665 0000850B 1F                      	pop	ds
 48666                                  
 48667                                  er_setA20:
 48668                                  	; We need to inc the A20OFF_COUNT here. Note that if the count
 48669                                  	; is non-zero at this point it indicates that the A20 is to be 
 48670                                  	; turned off for that many int 21 calls made by the app. In 
 48671                                  	; addition the A20 has to be turned off when we exit from this 
 48672                                  	; call. Hence the inc.
 48673                                  
 48674 0000850C 36FE06[8500]            	inc	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT]		
 48675 00008511 36A3[6300]              	mov	[ss:A20OFF_PSP],ax	; set the PSP for which A20 is to be
 48676                                  					; turned OFF.
 48677                                  er_done:				; M068 - End
 48678 00008515 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 48679 00008517 C3                      	retn
 48680                                  
 48681                                  ; M028 - END
 48682                                  
 48683                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 48684                                  ;%if 1
 48685                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 48686                                  ;%if 0
 48687                                  
 48688                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48689                                  ;
 48690                                  ; procedure : Rational386Patch
 48691                                  ;
 48692                                  ; Older versions of the Rational DOS Extender have several bugs which trash
 48693                                  ; 386 registers (usually just the high word of 32 bit registers) during
 48694                                  ; interrupt processing. Lotus 123 3.1+ is a popular application that uses a
 48695                                  ; version of the Rational extender with the 32 bit register trashing bugs.
 48696                                  ;
 48697                                  ; This routine applies patches to the Rational DOS Extender to work around
 48698                                  ; most of the register trashing bugs.
 48699                                  ;
 48700                                  ; Note that there are additional register trashing bugs not fixed by these
 48701                                  ; patches. In particular, the high word of ESP and the FS and GS registers
 48702                                  ; may be modified on interrupts.
 48703                                  ;
 48704                                  ; There are two different Rational DOS Extender patchs in this module.
 48705                                  ; Rational386Patch is to correct 386 register trashing bugs on 386 or later
 48706                                  ; processors. This patch code is executed when MS-DOS is running on a 386
 48707                                  ; or later processor, regardless of whether MS-DOS is running in the HMA
 48708                                  ; or not.
 48709                                  ;
 48710                                  ; The other Rational patch routine (RationalPatch, below) fixes a register
 48711                                  ; trashing problem on 286 processors, and is only executed if MS-DOS is
 48712                                  ; running in the HMA.
 48713                                  ;
 48714                                  ; This patch detection and replacement is based on an example supplied by
 48715                                  ; Ben Williams at Rational.
 48716                                  ;
 48717                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48718                                  
 48719                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 48720                                  ; DOSCODE:B448h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 48721                                  
 48722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48723                                  ;
 48724                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 48725                                  ;
 48726                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48727                                  
 48728                                  rpFind1:
 48729 00008518 FAE4216033C0E6438B-     	db	0FAh, 0E4h, 21h, 60h, 33h, 0C0h, 0E6h, 43h, 8Bh, 16h
 48729 00008521 16                 
 48730                                  
 48731                                  rpFind1Len equ	$ - rpFind1
 48732                                  
 48733                                  ;	cli
 48734                                  ;	in	al, 21h
 48735                                  ;	pusha
 48736                                  ;	xor	ax, ax
 48737                                  ;	out	43h, al
 48738                                  ;	mov	dx, ...
 48739                                  
 48740                                  rpFind1a:
 48741 00008522 B00EE63733C0E6F2        	db	0B0h, 0Eh, 0E6h, 37h, 33h, 0C0h, 0E6h, 0F2h
 48742                                  
 48743                                  rpFind1aLen equ	$ - rpFind1a
 48744                                  
 48745                                  ;	mov	al, 0Eh
 48746                                  ;	out	37h, al
 48747                                  ;	xor	ax, ax
 48748                                  ;	out	0F2h, al
 48749                                  
 48750                                  ; bug # 1 -- loss of high EAX on 386+ if not VCPI or DPMI
 48751                                  
 48752                                  rpFind2:
 48753 0000852A 0F20C0                  	db	0Fh, 20h, 0C0h
 48754                                  
 48755                                  rpFind2Len equ	$ - rpFind2
 48756                                  
 48757                                  ;	mov	eax, cr0	;may be preceeded by PUSH CX (51h)
 48758                                  
 48759                                  rpFind3:
 48760 0000852D 0F22C0EA                	db	0Fh, 22h, 0C0h, 0EAh
 48761                                  
 48762                                  rpFind3Len equ	$ - rpFind3
 48763                                  
 48764                                  ;	mov	cr0, eax	;may be preceeded by POP CX (59h)
 48765                                  ;	jmp	far ptr xxx	;change far ptr to go to replace3
 48766                                  ;	mov	ss, bx		;8E D3 ... and come back at or after this
 48767                                  
 48768                                  ; note, there is no rpRepl1 string
 48769                                  
 48770                                  rpRepl2:
 48771 00008531 6650510F20C0             	db	66h, 50h, 51h, 0Fh, 20h, 0C0h
 48772                                  
 48773                                  rpRepl2Len equ	$ - rpRepl2
 48774                                  
 48775                                  ;	push	eax
 48776                                  ;	push	cx
 48777                                  ;	mov	eax, cr0
 48778                                  
 48779                                  rpRepl3:
 48780 00008537 8ED3596658              	db	8Eh, 0D3h, 59h, 66h, 58h
 48781                                  
 48782                                  rpRepl3Len equ	$ - rpRepl3
 48783                                  
 48784                                  ;	mov	ss, bx
 48785                                  ;	pop	cx
 48786                                  ;	pop	eax
 48787                                  
 48788                                  ; bug # 2 -- loss of high EAX and ESI on 386+ only if VCPI
 48789                                  
 48790                                  rpFind4:
 48791 0000853C 93588BCC                	db	93h, 58h, 8Bh, 0CCh
 48792                                  
 48793                                  rpFind4Len equ	$ - rpFind4
 48794                                  
 48795                                  ;	xchg	bx, ax
 48796                                  ;	pop	ax
 48797                                  ;	mov	cx, sp
 48798                                  
 48799                                  rpFind5:
 48800 00008540 B80CDECD678BE1FFE3      	db	0B8h, 0Ch, 0DEh, 0CDh, 67h, 8Bh, 0E1h, 0FFh, 0E3h
 48801                                  
 48802                                  rpFind5Len equ	$ - rpFind5
 48803                                  
 48804                                  ;	mov	ax, DE0Ch
 48805                                  ;	int	67h
 48806                                  ;	mov	sp, cx
 48807                                  ;	jmp	bx
 48808                                  
 48809                                  rpRepl4:
 48810 00008549 93588BCC                	db	93h, 58h, 8Bh, 0CCh
 48811 0000854D 2E66A3                  	db	02Eh, 066h, 0A3h
 48812                                  
 48813                                  rpRepl4o1Len equ $ - rpRepl4
 48814                                  
 48815 00008550 0000                    	db	00h, 00h
 48816 00008552 2E668936                	db	02Eh, 066h, 89h, 36h
 48817                                  
 48818                                  rpRepl4o2Len equ $ - rpRepl4
 48819                                  
 48820 00008556 0000                    	db	00h, 00h
 48821                                  
 48822                                  rpRepl4Len equ	$ - rpRepl4
 48823                                  
 48824                                  ;	xchg	bx, ax
 48825                                  ;	pop	ax
 48826                                  ;	mov	cx, sp
 48827                                  ;	mov	dword ptr cs:[xxxx], eax
 48828                                  ;	mov	dword ptr cs:[xxxx], esi
 48829                                  
 48830                                  rpRepl5:
 48831 00008558 8BE1                    	db	8Bh, 0E1h
 48832 0000855A 2E66A1                  	db	2Eh, 66h, 0A1h
 48833                                  
 48834                                  rpRepl5o1Len equ $ - rpRepl5
 48835

 48838

 48840

 48842 00008565 FFE3                    	db	0FFh, 0E3h
 48843

 48845

 48847                                  ;	mov	eax, dword ptr cs:[xxxx]

 48849                                  ;	jmp	bx
 48850

 48852

 48855

 48857

 48859                                  ;	push	dx
 48860                                  ;	push	cx
 48861

 48864

 48866

 48868                                  ;	call	fword ptr es:[xxxx]
 48869

 48871 00008571 595A5B                  	db	59h, 5Ah, 5Bh
 48872

 48874

 48877                                  ;	pop	bx
 48878

 48883

 48885                                  ;	push	eax
 48886                                  ;	push	ebx
 48887                                  ;	push	ecx

 48889

 48892

 48894                                  
 48895                                  ;	pop	edx
 48896                                  ;	pop	ecx
 48897                                  ;	pop	ebx

 48899                                  ;	pop	bx
 48900

 48902                                  
 48903                                  rpFind8:

 48905

 48907                                  
 48908                                  ;	pusha
 48909                                  ;	push	es
 48910                                  ;	push	ds
 48911                                  ;	mov	ax, dgroup	;jump back to here from replace8
 48912                                  ;	mov	ds, ax
 48913

 48915 0000858E 1F0761                  	db	1Fh, 07h, 61h
 48916                                  
 48917                                  rpFind9Len equ	$ - rpFind9
 48918                                  
 48919                                  ;	pop	ds
 48920                                  ;	pop	es
 48921                                  ;	popa
 48922

 48924 00008591 6660061E                 	db	66h, 60h, 06h, 1Eh
 48925                                  
 48926                                  rpRepl8Len equ	$ - rpRepl8
 48927                                  
 48928                                  ;	pushad
 48929                                  ;	push	es
 48930                                  ;	push	ds
 48931

 48934

 48936                                  
 48937                                  ;	pop	ds
 48938                                  ;	pop	es
 48939                                  ;	popad
 48940                                  ;	retn			;no need to jmp back to main-line
 48941

 48943                                  
 48944                                  struc SearchPair
 48945 00000000 ????                     .sp_off1: resw 1	; offset of 1st search string
 48946 00000002 ????                     .sp_len1: resw 1	; length of 1st search string
 48947 00000004 ????                     .sp_off2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 48948 00000006 ????                     .sp_len2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 48949 00000008 ????                     .sp_diff: resw 1	; max difference between offsets
 48950                                   .size:
 48951                                  endstruc

 48954

 48959 000085A0 0400                    	dw	rpFind3Len ; 4
 48960 000085A2 2000                    	dw	20h

 48987 000085C0 8000                    	dw	80h

 48990                                  
 48991                                  struc StackVars
 48992 00000000 ????                     .sv_wVersion:	resw 1		; Rational extender version #
 48993 00000002 ????                     .sv_cbCodeSeg: resw 1		; code seg size to scan
 48994 00000004 ????                     .sv_pPatch:	resw 1		; offset of next avail patch byte
 48995                                   .size:
 48996                                  endstruc
 48997                                  
 48998                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 48999                                  
 49000                                  ; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 49001                                  
 49002                                  Rational386Patch:
 49003                                  	; Do a few quick checks to see if this looks like a Rational
 49004                                  	; Extended application. Hopefully this will quickly weed out
 49005                                  	; most non Rational apps.
 49006                                  
 49007 000085C2 26813E00008B01          	cmp	word [es:0],395		; version number goes here - versions
 49008 000085C9 7322                    	jae	short rp3QuickOut	;   3.95+ don't need patching
 49009                                  
 49010 000085CB 26833E0C0020            	cmp	word [es:0Ch],20h	; always has this value here
 49011 000085D1 751A                    	jne	short rp3QuickOut
 49012                                  
 49013 000085D3 50                      	push	ax ; *
 49014                                  
 49015 000085D4 B81800                  	mov	ax,18h 			; extender has 18h at
 49016 000085D7 2639061800              	cmp	[es:24],ax		;   offsets 24, 28, & 36
 49017 000085DC 750E                    	jne	short rp3QO_ax
 49018 000085DE 2639061C00              	cmp	[es:28],ax
 49019 000085E3 7507                    	jne	short rp3QO_ax
 49020 000085E5 2639062400              	cmp	[es:36],ax
 49021 000085EA 7402                    	je	short rp3Maybe
 49022                                  rp3QO_ax:
 49023 000085EC 58                      	pop	ax
 49024                                  rp3QuickOut:
 49025 000085ED C3                      	retn
 49026                                  
 49027                                  ; It might be the rational extender, do more extensive checking
 49028                                  
 49029                                  rp3Maybe:
 49030 000085EE FC                      	cld
 49031                                  
 49032                                  ; 20/03/2024
 49033                                  %if 0
 49034                                  	push	bx			; note ax pushed above
 49035                                  	push	cx
 49036                                  	push	dx
 49037                                  	push	si
 49038                                  	push	di
 49039                                  	push	es
 49040                                  	push	ds			; we use all of them
 49041                                  	push	bp
 49042                                  %else
 49043                                  	; 20/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 49044                                  	;;;
 49045 000085EF 60                      	pusha
 49046 000085F0 06                      	push	es
 49047 000085F1 1E                      	push	ds
 49048                                  	;;;	
 49049                                  %endif
 49050 000085F2 83EC06                  	sub	sp,StackVars.size  ; 6	; make space for stack variables
 49051 000085F5 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 49052                                  
 49053 000085F7 0E                      	push	cs
 49054 000085F8 1F                      	pop	ds
 49055                                  
 49056 000085F9 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]		; save version #
 49057                                  	;mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_wVersion],ax
 49058 000085FD 894600                  	mov	[bp],ax	
 49059                                  					; check that binary version # matches
 49060 00008600 E89901                  	call	VerifyVersion		;   ascii string
 49061 00008603 7521                    	jne	short rp3Exit_j
 49062                                  
 49063                                  ; Looks like this is it, find where to put the patch code.  The
 49064                                  ; patch will be located on top of Rational code specific to 80286
 49065                                  ; processors, so these patchs MUST NOT be applied if running on
 49066                                  ; an 80286 system.
 49067                                  
 49068                                  	; Rational says the code to patch will never be beyond offset 46xxh
 49069                                  
 49070 00008605 B90045                  	mov	cx,4500h		; force search len to 4700h (searches
 49071                                  	;mov	[bp+2],cx
 49072 00008608 894E02                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_cbCodeSeg],cx	; start at offset 200h)
 49073                                  
 49074 0000860B 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=code segment
 49075                                  
 49076 00008610 BE[1885]                	mov	si,rpFind1		; string to find
 49077 00008613 BA0A00                  	mov	dx,rpFind1Len ; 10	; length to match
 49078 00008616 E86B01                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq
 49079 00008619 740E                    	jz	short rpGotPatch
 49080                                  
 49081                                  ; According to Rational, some very old versions of the extender may not
 49082                                  ; have the find1 code sequence. If the find1 code wasn't found above,
 49083                                  ; try an alternative patch area which is on top of NEC 98xx switching code.
 49084                                  
 49085 0000861B BE[2285]                	mov	si,rpFind1a
 49086 0000861E BA0800                  	mov	dx,rpFind1aLen  ;8
 49087 00008621 E86001                  	call	ScanCodeSeq
 49088 00008624 7403                    	jz	short rpGotPatch
 49089                                  
 49090                                  rp3Exit_j:
 49091 00008626 E9FE00                  	jmp	rp3Exit
 49092                                  
 49093                                  ; Found the location to write patch code! DI = offset in code seg.

 49291                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49292                                  ;
 49293                                  ; FindBadCode
 49294                                  ;
 49295                                  ; Searches Rational code segment looking for a pair of find strings (all
 49296                                  ; patches have at least two find strings).
 49297                                  ;
 49298                                  ; Entry:
 49299                                  ;	ES    = code segment to search
 49300                                  ;	DS:BX = search pair structure for this search
 49301                                  ;	[bp].sv_cbCodeSeg = length of code seg to search
 49302                                  ;
 49303                                  ; Exit:
 49304                                  ;	CY flag clear if both strings found, and
 49305                                  ;	SI    = offset in ES of 1st string
 49306                                  ;	DI    = offset in ES of 2nd string
 49307                                  ;	CY set if either string not found, or strings too far apart
 49308                                  ;
 49309                                  ; Used:
 49310                                  ;	CX
 49311                                  ;
 49312                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49313                                  
 49314                                  ;struc SearchPair
 49315                                  ; .sp_off1: resw 1	; offset of 1st search string
 49316                                  ; .sp_len1: resw 1	; length of 1st search string
 49317                                  ; .sp_off2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 49318                                  ; .sp_len2: resw 1	; 2nd string
 49319                                  ; .sp_diff: resw 1	; max difference between offsets
 49320                                  ; .size:
 49321                                  ;endstruc
 49322                                  
 49323                                  FindBadCode:
 49324                                  	;mov	cx,[bp+2]
 49325 0000872F 8B4E02                  	mov	cx,[bp+StackVars.sv_cbCodeSeg]	; search length
 49326                                  
 49327 00008732 8B37                    	mov	si,[bx]	; mov si,[bx+0]
 49328                                  	;mov	si,[bx+Searchpair.sp_off1] ; ds:si -> search string
 49329                                  	
 49330                                  	;mov	dx,[bx+2]
 49331 00008734 8B5702                  	mov	dx,[bx+SearchPair.sp_len1] ; dx = search len
 49332 00008737 E84A00                  	call	ScanCodeSeq
 49333 0000873A 751A                    	jnz	short fbc_error		; done if 1st not found
 49334                                  
 49335 0000873C 57                      	push	di			; save 1st string offset
 49336                                  
 49337                                  	;mov	si,[bx+4]
 49338 0000873D 8B7704                  	mov	si,[bx+SearchPair.sp_off2]
 49339                                  	;mov	dx,[bx+6]
 49340 00008740 8B5706                  	mov	dx,[bx+SearchPair.sp_len2]
 49341 00008743 E84100                  	call	ScanCodeSeq_di		; don't change flags after this!
 49342                                  
 49343 00008746 5E                      	pop	si			; restore 1st string offset
 49344 00008747 750D                    	jnz	short fbc_error
 49345                                  
 49346 00008749 89F8                    	mov	ax,di			; sanity check that
 49347 0000874B 29F0                    	sub	ax,si			;   si < di && di - si <= allowed diff
 49348 0000874D 7207                    	jc	short fbc_error
 49349                                  	;cmp	ax,[bx+8]
 49350 0000874F 3B4708                  	cmp	ax,[bx+SearchPair.sp_diff]
 49351 00008752 7702                    	ja	short fbc_error
 49352                                  
 49353 00008754 F8                      	clc
 49354 00008755 C3                      	retn
 49355                                  
 49356                                  fbc_error:
 49357 00008756 F9                      	stc
 49358 00008757 C3                      	retn
 49359                                  
 49360                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49361                                  ;
 49362                                  ; GenPatch
 49363                                  ;
 49364                                  ; Generate a patch sequence. 1) insert a jump at the buggy code location
 49365                                  ; (jumps to the patch code area), 2) copy the selected patch code to the
 49366                                  ; patch area, 3) insert a jump from the patch area back to the main-line
 49367                                  ; code.
 49368                                  ;
 49369                                  ; Entry:
 49370                                  ;	ES:DI = start of buggy code to be patched
 49371                                  ;	DX    = length of buggy code to be patched
 49372                                  ;	DS:SI = replacement patch code
 49373                                  ;	CX    = length of replacement patch code
 49374                                  ;	[bp].sv_pPatch = offset in ES of where to copy patch code
 49375                                  ;
 49376                                  ; Exit:
 49377                                  ;	DI, [bp].sv_pPatch = byte after generated patch code
 49378                                  ;
 49379                                  ; Used:
 49380                                  ;	AX, BX, SI, Flags
 49381                                  ;
 49382                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49383                                  
 49384                                  GenPatch:
 49385 00008758 57                      	push	di			;save offset of buggy code
 49386                                  
 49387                                  	;mov	bx,[bp+4]
 49388 00008759 8B5E04                  	mov	bx,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch]
 49389                                  					;jump from buggy code to patch area
 49390 0000875C E81900                  	call	GenJump
 49391                                  
 49392 0000875F E80A00                  	call	CopyPatch		;copy replacement code to patch area
 49393                                  
 49394 00008762 5B                      	pop	bx			;offset of buggy code + buggy code
 49395 00008763 01D3                    	add	bx,dx			;  length = return from patch offset
 49396                                  
 49397 00008765 E81000                  	call	GenJump 		;jump from patch area back to main-
 49398                                  	;mov	[bp+4],di
 49399 00008768 897E04                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch],di
 49400                                  					;  line code, update patch pointer
 49401 0000876B C3                      	retn
 49402                                  
 49403                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49404                                  ;
 49405                                  ; CopyPatch
 49406                                  ;
 49407                                  ; Copies patch code to patch location.
 49408                                  ;
 49409                                  ; Entry:
 49410                                  ;	DS:SI = patch code to be copied
 49411                                  ;	ES    = segment of code to patch
 49412                                  ;	CX    = length of code to copy
 49413                                  ;	[bp].sv_pPatch = offset in ES of where to copy patch code
 49414                                  ;
 49415                                  ; Exit:
 49416                                  ;	DI, [bp].sv_pPatch = byte after copied patch code
 49417                                  ;
 49418                                  ; Used:
 49419                                  ;	SI, Flags
 49420                                  ;
 49421                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49422                                  
 49423                                  CopyPatch:
 49424 0000876C 51                      	push	cx
 49425                                  	;mov	di,[bp+4]
 49426 0000876D 8B7E04                  	mov	di,[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch] ;patch pointer is the dest offset
 49427 00008770 FC                      	cld
 49428 00008771 F3A4                    	rep movsb
 49429 00008773 59                      	pop	cx
 49430                                  	;mov	[bp+4],di
 49431 00008774 897E04                  	mov	[bp+StackVars.sv_pPatch],di ;update net pointer location
 49432 00008777 C3                      	retn
 49433                                  
 49434                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49435                                  ;
 49436                                  ; GenJump
 49437                                  ;
 49438                                  ; Generates a rel16 JMP instruction at location 'from' to location 'to'.
 49439                                  ;
 49440                                  ; Entry:
 49441                                  ;	ES:DI = from location (where to put jmp instruction)
 49442                                  ;	BX    = to location (where to jump to)
 49443                                  ;
 49444                                  ; Exit:
 49445                                  ;	DI = byte after generated jump
 49446                                  ;
 49447                                  ; Used:
 49448                                  ;	AX
 49449                                  ;
 49450                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49451                                  
 49452                                  GenJump:
 49453 00008778 B0E9                    	mov	al,0E9h		; jmp rel16 opcode
 49454 0000877A AA                      	stosb
 49455                                  
 49456 0000877B 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx		; calc offset to 'to' location
 49457 0000877D 29F8                    	sub	ax,di
 49458 0000877F 83E802                  	sub	ax,2
 49459                                  
 49460 00008782 AB                      	stosw			; output offset
 49461                                  
 49462 00008783 C3                      	retn
 49463                                  
 49464                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49465                                  ;
 49466                                  ; ScanCodeSeq
 49467                                  ;
 49468                                  ; Looks for a pattern pointed to by DS:SI & len DX in ES:200 to ES:200+CX-1
 49469                                  ;
 49470                                  ; returns in ES:DI the start of the pattern if Zero flag is set
 49471                                  ;
 49472                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49473                                  
 49474                                  ScanCodeSeq:
 49475 00008784 BF0002                  	mov	di,200h
 49476                                  ScanCodeSeq_di:
 49477 00008787 51                      	push	cx
 49478 00008788 29D1                    	sub	cx,dx
 49479 0000878A 41                      	inc	cx
 49480                                  scsagain:
 49481 0000878B 56                      	push	si
 49482 0000878C 57                      	push	di
 49483 0000878D 51                      	push	cx
 49484 0000878E 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 49485 00008790 F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 49486 00008792 59                      	pop	cx
 49487 00008793 5F                      	pop	di
 49488 00008794 5E                      	pop	si
 49489 00008795 7403                    	je	short scsfound
 49490 00008797 47                      	inc	di
 49491 00008798 E2F1                    	loop	scsagain
 49492                                  scsfound:
 49493 0000879A 59                      	pop	cx
 49494                                  vvexit:		; 18/12/2022
 49495 0000879B C3                      	retn
 49496                                  	
 49497                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49498                                  ;
 49499                                  ; VerifyVersion
 49500                                  ;
 49501                                  ; Checks whether the binary version from ES:0 matches the ASCII version
 49502                                  ; from ES:2A.
 49503                                  ;
 49504                                  ;       Entry: AX = binary version number 
 49505                                  ;       Exit : Z flag set if version numbers match
 49506                                  ;
 49507                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49508                                  
 49509                                  VerifyVersion:
 49510 0000879C 268B362A00              	mov	si,[es:2Ah]		; offset of version number
 49511                                  					;  in ascii
 49512 000087A1 B30A                    	mov	bl,10
 49513 000087A3 83C603                  	add	si,3			; point to last digit
 49514                                  
 49515 000087A6 E80E00                  	call	VVDigit
 49516 000087A9 75F0                    	jne	short vvexit
 49517 000087AB E80900                  	call	VVDigit
 49518 000087AE 75EB                    	jne	short vvexit
 49519 000087B0 26803C2E                	cmp	byte [es:si],'.'
 49520 000087B4 75E5                    	jne	short vvexit
 49521 000087B6 4E                      	dec	si
 49522                                  	;call	VVDigit
 49523                                  	; 18/12/2022
 49524                                  	;jmp	short VVDigit
 49525                                  ;vvexit:
 49526                                  	;retn
 49527                                  VVDigit:
 49528 000087B7 F6F3                    	div	bl
 49529 000087B9 80C430                  	add	ah,'0'
 49530 000087BC 4E                      	dec	si
 49531 000087BD 26386401                	cmp	[es:si+1],ah
 49532 000087C1 B400                    	mov	ah,0			; do not xor or sub we need Z
 49533 000087C3 C3                      	retn
 49534                                  
 49535                                  ; 20/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 49536                                  ;%endif
