 49804                                  	; 28/12/2022
 49805                                  	;jmp	short ExePackPatch
 49806                                  
 49807                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 49808                                  ;
 49809                                  ; Procedure Name 	: ExePackPatch
 49810                                  ;
 49811                                  ; Inputs	 	: DS 			-> DOSDATA
 49812                                  ;			  ES:0 			-> read in image
 49813                                  ;			  ax:cx = start cs:ip of program
 49814                                  ; Output		:		
 49815                                  ;
 49816                                  ;	1. If ES <= 0fffh
 49817                                  ;	   2. if exepack signature ('RB') found
 49818                                  ;	      3. if common code to patch compares (for 3 diff. versions)
 49819                                  ;	       	 4. if rest of the code & checksum compares
 49820                                  ;	  	    5. overlay buggy code with code in 
 49821                                  ;		       doscode:str1.
 49822                                  ;		 6. endif
 49823                                  ;	      7. endif
 49824                                  ;	   8. endif
 49825                                  ;	9. endif
 49826                                  ;
 49827                                  ;
 49828                                  ; Uses			: NONE
 49829                                  ;
 49830                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 49831                                  	
 49832                                  	; 21/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 49833                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 49834                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 49835                                  ExePackPatch:
 49836 0000891D 53                      	push	bx
 49837 0000891E 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; bx has load segment
 49838 00008920 81FBFF0F                	cmp	bx,0FFFh		; Q: is the load segment > 64K
 49839 00008924 7602                    	jbe	short ep_cont		; N: 
 49840 00008926 5B                      	pop	bx			; Y: no need to patch
 49841 00008927 C3                      	retn
 49842                                  ep_cont:
 49843 00008928 1E                      	push	ds
 49844 00008929 06                      	push	es
 49845 0000892A 50                      	push	ax
 49846 0000892B 51                      	push	cx
 49847 0000892C 56                      	push	si
 49848 0000892D 57                      	push	di
 49849                                  	
 49850                                  		; M033 - start
 49851                                  		; exepacked programs have an IP of 12h (>=2)
 49852                                  
 49853 0000892E 83E902                  	sub	cx,2			; Q: is IP >=2
 49854 00008931 7303                    	jnb	short epp_1		; N: exit
 49855 00008933 E9B500                  	jmp	ep_notpacked
 49856                                  					; ax:cx now points to location of
 49857                                  					; 'RB' if this is an exepacked file.
 49858                                  		; M033 - end
 49859                                  epp_1:
 49860 00008936 89CF                    	mov	di,cx
 49861 00008938 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 49862 0000893A 36893E[8700]            	mov	[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET],di	; save pointer to 'RB' in
 49863                                  					; unpack_offset
 49864                                  
 49865 0000893F 26813D5242              	cmp	word [es:di],'RB' ; 4252h
 49866                                  	;ljne	ep_notpacked
 49867 00008944 7403                    	je	short epp_2
 49868 00008946 E9A200                  	jmp	ep_notpacked
 49869                                  epp_2:

 49871 0000894A 1F                      	pop	ds			; set ds to cs
 49872                                  
 49873                                  	;add	di,6Ch

 49875                                  					;          file where we hope to find
 49876                                  					;	   scan string. 
 49877                                  
 49878 0000894E E8A200                  	call	chk_common_str		; check for match
 49879                                  
 49880 00008951 7521                    	jnz	short ep_chkpatch2	; Q: does the patch match
 49881                                  					; N: check at patch2_offset
 49882                                  					; Y: check for rest of patch string
 49883 00008953 BE[2A88]                	mov	si,scan_patch1
 49884                                  					; ds:si -> scan string 
 49885 00008956 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; restore di to point to 'RB'
 49886                                  
 49887                                  	;add	di,28h
 49888                                  	; 07/12/2022
 49889 0000895B 83C728                  	add	di,PATCH1_OFFSET	; es:di -> points to place in packed
 49890                                  					;          file where we hope to find
 49891                                  					;	   scan string. 
 49892                                  	;;mov	cx,68
 49893                                  	;mov	cx,size_scan_patch1
 49894                                  	; 21/03/2024
 49895 0000895E B144                    	mov	cl,size_scan_patch1 ; 68
 49896                                  
 49897                                  	;mov	bx,142
 49898 00008960 BB8E00                  	mov	bx,CHKSUM1_LEN
 49899                                  	;mov	ax,0EF4Eh
 49900 00008963 B84EEF                  	mov	ax,PATCH1_CHKSUM
 49901 00008966 E89E00                  	call	chk_patchsum		; check if patch and chk sum compare
 49902 00008969 7207                    	jc	short ep_done1		; Q: did we pass the test
 49903                                  					; N: exit
 49904                                  					; Y: overlay code with new 
 49905 0000896B BE[C487]                	mov	si,str1

 49916                                  	;mov	di,76h

 49920

 49958                                  					; Y: overlay code with new
 49959                                  						
 49960                                  ep_patchcode2:			       	; M046 - End

 50059                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: chk_common_str
 50060                                  ;
 50061                                  ;	Input		: DS = DOSCODE
 50062                                  ;			; ES:DI points to string in packed file
 50063                                  ;
 50064                                  ;	Output		; Z if match else NZ
 50065                                  ;

 50068                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50069                                  chk_common_str:
 50070 000089F3 BE[F488]                	mov	si,scan_com
 50071                                  					; ds:si -> scan string 
 50072                                  	;mov	cx,32
 50073 000089F6 B92000                  	mov	cx,size_scan_com
 50074                                  
 50075 000089F9 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 50076                                  					; M046 - start
 50077                                  	; a fourth possible version of these exepacked programs have a
 50078                                  	; 056h instead of 06Bh. See scan_com above
 50079                                  	;
 50080                                  	; 	db  75h, 6Bh		;jne CorruptExe
 50081                                  	;
 50082                                  	; If the mismatch at this point is due to a 56h instead of 6Bh
 50083                                  	; we shall try to match the rest of the string
 50084                                  	;
 50085                                  
 50086 000089FB 7409                    	jz	short ccs_done
 50087 000089FD 26807DFF56              	cmp	byte [es:di-1],56h
 50088 00008A02 7502                    	jnz	short ccs_done

 50094                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50095                                  ;
 50096                                  ;	Procedure Name	: chk_patchsum
 50097                                  ;
 50098                                  ;	Input		: DS:SI -> string we're looking for
 50099                                  ;			: ES:DI -> offset in packed file
 50100                                  ;			: CX 	= scan length
 50101                                  ;			: BX	= length of check sum
 50102                                  ;			: AX 	= value of check sum
 50103                                  ;
 50104                                  ;	Output		: if patch & check sum compare
 50105                                  ;				NC
 50106                                  ;			  else
 50107                                  ;				CY
 50108                                  ;
 50109                                  ;	Uses		: AX, BX, CX, SI
 50110                                  ;
 50111                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50112                                  
 50113                                  	; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50114                                  chk_patchsum:
 50115 00008A07 57                      	push	di
 50116                                  
 50117 00008A08 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 50118                                  
 50119 00008A0A 7517                    	jnz	short cp_fail		; Q: does the patch match
 50120                                  					; N: exit
 50121                                  					; Y:
 50122                                  
 50123                                  		; we do a check sum starting from the location of the
 50124                                  		; exepack signature 'RB' up to 11c/2 bytes, the end of the
 50125                                  		; unpacking code.
 50126                                  
 50127 00008A0C 368B3E[8700]            	mov	di,[ss:UNPACK_OFFSET]	; di -> start of unpack code
 50128 00008A11 89D9                    	mov	cx,bx			; cx = length of check sum
 50129                                  
 50130 00008A13 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax			; save check sum passed to us in bx
 50131 00008A15 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 50132                                  ep_chksum:
 50133 00008A17 260305                  	add	ax,[es:di]
 50134                                  	;add	di,2
 50135                                  	; 01/07/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50136 00008A1A 47                      	inc	di
 50137 00008A1B 47                      	inc	di
 50138 00008A1C E2F9                    	loop	ep_chksum
 50139                                  
 50140 00008A1E 5F                      	pop	di			; restore di
 50141                                  
 50142 00008A1F 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx		 	; Q: does the check sum match
 50143                                  	;jne	short cp_fail		; N: exit
 50144                                  					; Y:
 50145                                  	; 25/09/2023
 50146                                  	;clc	
 50147                                  	;retn
 50148 00008A21 74E3                    	je	short ccs_done ; cf=0
 50149                                  	
 50150                                  cp_fail:
 50151 00008A23 F9                      	stc
 50152 00008A24 C3                      	retn

 50161                                  ; M020 : BEGIN
 50162                                  ;
 50163                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50164                                  ;
 50165                                  ; procedure : RationalPatch
 50166                                  ;
 50167                                  ; A routine (in Ration DOS extender) which is invoked at hardware interrupts
 50168                                  ; clobbers CX register on 286 machines. (123 release 3 uses Rational DOS
 50169                                  ; extender). This routine identifies Buggy Rational EXEs and fixes the bug.
 50170                                  ;
 50171                                  ; THE BUG is in the following code sequence:
 50172                                  ;
 50173                                  ;8b 0e 10 00	mov	cx, ds:[10h]		; delay count
 50174                                  ;90		even				; word align
 50175                                  ;e2 fe		loop	$			; wait		CLOBBERS CX
 50176                                  ;e8 xx xx	call	set_A20			; enable A20
 50177                                  ;
 50178                                  ; This patch routine replaces the mov & the loop with a far call into a
 50179                                  ; routine in DOS data segment which is in low memory (because A20 line
 50180                                  ; is off). The routine (RatBugCode) in DOS data saves & restores CX around
 50181                                  ; a mov & loop.
 50182                                  ;
 50183                                  ; Identification of Buggy Rational EXE
 50184                                  ; ====================================
 50185                                  ;
 50186                                  ; (ALL OFFSETS ARE IN THE PROGRAM SECTION - EXCLUDING THE EXE HEADER)
 50187                                  ;
 50188                                  ; OFFSET				Contains
 50189                                  ; ------				--------
 50190                                  ; 0000h			100 times Version number in binary
 50191                                  ;			bug exists in version 3.48 thru 3.83 (both inclusive)
 50192                                  ;
 50193                                  ; 000ah			the WORDS : 0000h, 0020h, 0000h, 0040h, 0001h
 50194                                  ;
 50195                                  ; 002ah			offset where version number is stored in ASCII
 50196                                  ;				e.g. '3.48A'
 50197                                  ;
 50198                                  ; 0030h			offset of copyright string. Copyright strings either
 50199                                  ;			start with "DOS/16M Copyright...." or
 50200                                  ;			"Copyright.....". The string contains
 50201                                  ;			"Rational Systems, Inc."
 50202                                  ;
 50203                                  ; 0020h			word : Paragraph offset of the buggy code segment
 50204                                  ;				from the program image
 50205                                  ; 0016h			word : size of buggy code segment
 50206                                  ;
 50207                                  ;	Buggy code is definite to start after offset 200h in its segment
 50208                                  ;
 50209                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50210                                  
 50211                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50212                                  ; DOSCODE:B976h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50213                                  
 50214                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50215                                  ; DOSCODE:B654h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50216                                  
 50217                                  RScanPattern1:
 50218 00008A25 000020000000400001-     	db	0, 0, 20h, 0, 0, 0, 40h, 0, 1, 0
 50218 00008A2E 00                 
 50219                                  
 50220                                  RLen1 equ $ - RScanPattern1
 50221                                  
 50222                                  RScanPattern2:
 50223 00008A2F 8B0E100090E2FEE8        	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 90h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 50224                                  
 50225                                  RLen2 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 50226                                  
 50227                                  RScanPattern3:
 50228 00008A37 8B0E1000E2FEE8          	db	8Bh, 0Eh, 10h, 00h, 0E2h, 0FEh, 0E8h
 50229                                  
 50230                                  RLen3 equ $ - RScanPattern2
 50231                                  
 50232                                  ; DOSCODE:B98Fh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50233                                  ; DOSCODE:B66Dh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50234                                  
 50235                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50236                                  ;
 50237                                  ; INPUT : ES = segment where program got loaded
 50238                                  ;
 50239                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50240                                  
 50241                                  	; 21/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50242                                  	; DOSCODE:CC2Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50243                                  
 50244                                  RationalPatch:
 50245 00008A3E FC                      	cld
 50246                                  
 50247                                  ; 21/03/2024
 50248                                  %if 0
 50249                                  	push	ax
 50250                                  	push	bx
 50251                                  	push	cx
 50252                                  	push	dx
 50253                                  	push	si
 50254                                  	push	di
 50255                                  %else
 50256                                  	; 21/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50257                                  	;;;
 50258 00008A3F 60                      	pusha
 50259                                  	;;;
 50260                                  %endif
 50261 00008A40 06                      	push	es
 50262 00008A41 1E                      	push	ds			; we use all of them
 50263 00008A42 BF0A00                  	mov	di,0Ah			; look for pat1 at offset 0Ah
 50264 00008A45 0E                      	push	cs
 50265 00008A46 1F                      	pop	ds
 50266                                  	
 50267 00008A47 BE[258A]                	mov	si,RScanPattern1
 50268                                  	;mov	cx,10
 50269 00008A4A B90A00                  	mov	cx,RLen1
 50270 00008A4D F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb			; do we have the pattern ?
 50271 00008A4F 754A                    	jne	short rpexit
 50272 00008A51 26A10000                	mov	ax,[es:0]
 50273 00008A55 3D5C01                  	cmp	ax,348			; is it a buggy version ?
 50274 00008A58 7241                    	jb	short rpexit
 50275 00008A5A 3D7F01                  	cmp	ax,383			; is it a buggy version ?
 50276 00008A5D 773C                    	ja	short rpexit
 50277                                  
 50278 00008A5F E83AFD                  	call	VerifyVersion
 50279 00008A62 7537                    	jne	short rpexit
 50280                                  
 50281 00008A64 268B0E1600              	mov	cx,[es:16h]		; Length of buggy code seg
 50282 00008A69 81E90002                	sub	cx,200h			; Length we search (we start
 50283                                  					;  at offset 200h)
 50284 00008A6D 268E062000              	mov	es,[es:20h]		; es=buggy code segment
 50285 00008A72 BE[2F8A]                	mov	si,RScanPattern2
 50286                                  	;mov	dx,8	
 50287 00008A75 BA0800                  	mov	dx,RLen2
 50288 00008A78 E809FD                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq with nop
 50289 00008A7B 740B                    	jz	short rpfound
 50290                                  
 50291 00008A7D BE[378A]                	mov	si,RScanPattern3
 50292                                  	;mov	dx,15
 50293 00008A80 BA0F00                  	mov	dx,RLen3
 50294 00008A83 E8FEFC                  	call	ScanCodeSeq		; look for code seq w/o nop
 50295 00008A86 7513                    	jnz	short rpexit
 50296                                  
 50297                                  rpfound:
 50298                                  	
 50299                                  ;	we set up a far call into DOS data
 50300                                  ;	dx has the length of the code seq we were searching for
 50301                                  
 50302 00008A88 B09A                    	mov	al,9Ah			; far call opcode
 50303 00008A8A AA                      	stosb
 50304 00008A8B B8[2611]                	mov	ax,RatBugCode
 50305 00008A8E AB                      	stosw
 50306 00008A8F 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss
 50307 00008A91 AB                      	stosw
 50308 00008A92 89D1                    	mov	cx,dx
 50309 00008A94 83E906                  	sub	cx,6			; filler (with NOPs)
 50310 00008A97 B090                    	mov	al,90h
 50311 00008A99 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 50312                                  rpexit:
 50313 00008A9B 1F                      	pop	ds
 50314 00008A9C 07                      	pop	es
 50315                                  
 50316                                  ; 21/03/2024
 50317                                  %if 0
 50318                                  	pop	di
 50319                                  	pop	si
 50320                                  	pop	dx
 50321                                  	pop	cx
 50322                                  	pop	bx
 50323                                  	pop	ax
 50324                                  %else
 50325                                  	; 21/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50326                                  	;;;
 50327 00008A9D 61                      	popa
 50328                                  	;;;
 50329                                  %endif
 50330 00008A9E C3                      	retn
 50331                                  
 50332                                  ; M020 END
 50333

 50335                                  ; 21/03/2024
 50336                                  ;%endif	; 28/12/2022

 50339                                  ;
 50340                                  ;	M068
 50341                                  ;
 50342                                  ; 	Procedure Name	: IsCopyProt
 50343                                  ;
 50344                                  ;	Inputs		: DS:100 -> start of com file just read in
 50345                                  ;
 50346                                  ;	Outputs		: sets the A20OFF_COUNT variable to 10 if 
 50347                                  ;			  the program loaded in DS:100 uses a MICROSOFT
 50348                                  ;			  copy protect scheme that relies on the A20 line
 50349                                  ;			  being turned off for it's scheme to work.
 50350                                  ;
 50351                                  ;			  Note: The int 21 function dispatcher will turn 
 50352                                  ;				a20 off, if the A20OFF_COUNT is non-zero 
 50353                                  ;				and dec the A20OFF_COUNT before	iretting 
 50354                                  ;				to the user. 
 50355                                  ;
 50356                                  ;	Uses		: ES, DI, SI, CX
 50357                                  ;
 50358                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50359                                  
 50360                                  ; 23/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50361                                  
 50362                                  CPStartOffset	EQU	0175h
 50363                                  CPID1Offset	EQU	011Bh
 50364                                  CPID2Offset	EQU	0173h
 50365                                  CPID3Offset	EQU	0146h
 50366                                  CPID4Offset	EQU	0124h
 50367                                  ID1		EQU	05343h
 50368                                  ID2		EQU	05044h
 50369                                  ID3		EQU	0F413h
 50370                                  ID4		EQU	08000h
 50371                                  
 50372                                  ; DOSCODE:B9FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50373                                  
 50374                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50375                                  ; DOSCODE:B71Ch (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50376                                  
 50377                                  ; 21/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50378                                  ; DOSCODE:CC90h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50379                                  
 50380                                  CPScanPattern:
 50381 00008A9F 89264801                	db	89h,26h,48h,01h		 ; mov [148],sp
 50382 00008AA3 8C0E4C01                	db	8Ch,0Eh,4Ch,01h		 ; mov [14C],cs
 50383 00008AA7 C7064A010001            	db	0C7h,06h,4Ah,01h,00h,01h ; mov [14A],100h 
 50384 00008AAD 8C0E1301                	db 	8Ch,0Eh,13h,01h		 ; mov [113],cs
 50385 00008AB1 B82001                  	db	0B8h,20h,01h		 ; mov ax,120h
 50386 00008AB4 BE0001                  	db	0BEh,00h,01h		 ; mov si,100h
 50387                                  
 50388                                  CPSPlen	EQU $ - CPScanPattern
 50389                                  
 50390                                  ; DOSCODE:BA12h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 50391                                  ; DOSCODE:B734h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 50392                                  ; 21/03/2024
 50393                                  ; DOSCODE:CCA8h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 50394                                  
 50395                                  IsCopyProt:
 50396 00008AB7 813E1B014353            	cmp	word [CPID1Offset],ID1
 50397 00008ABD 752D                    	jne	short CP_done
 50398                                  
 50399 00008ABF 813E73014450            	cmp	word [CPID2Offset],ID2
 50400 00008AC5 7525                    	jne	short CP_done
 50401                                  
 50402 00008AC7 813E460113F4            	cmp	word [CPID3Offset],ID3
 50403 00008ACD 751D                    	jne	short CP_done
 50404                                  
 50405 00008ACF 813E24010080            	cmp	word [CPID4Offset],ID4
 50406 00008AD5 7515                    	jne	short CP_done
 50407                                  
 50408 00008AD7 0E                      	push	cs
 50409 00008AD8 07                      	pop	es
 50410 00008AD9 BF[9F8A]                	mov	di,CPScanPattern	; es:di -> Pattern to find
 50411                                  
 50412 00008ADC BE7501                  	mov	si,CPStartOffset	; ds:si -> possible location 
 50413                                  					; of pattern
 50414                                  
 50415 00008ADF B91800                  	mov	cx,CPSPlen ; 24		; cx = length of pattern
 50416 00008AE2 F3A6                    	repe	cmpsb
 50417 00008AE4 7506                    	jnz	short CP_done
 50418                                  
 50419 00008AE6 36C606[8500]0A          	mov	byte [ss:A20OFF_COUNT],0Ah ; M071
 50420                                  CP_done:
 50421 00008AEC C3                      	retn
 50422                                  	
 50423                                  ;DOSCODE ENDS

 50425                                  	;END

 50471                                  ParaRound:

 50486                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50487                                  ;
 50488                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 50489                                  ;
 50490                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 50491                                  ;
 50492                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 50493                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 50494                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 50495                                  ;
 50496                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 50497                                  ;
 50498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50499                                  
 50500                                  WhatCPUType:
 50501                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 50502                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 50503                                  
 50504                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50505                                  
 50506                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 50507                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 50508                                  ;
 50509                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 50510                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 50511                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 50512                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 50513                                  
 50514                                  	; 04/11/2022
 50515                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 50516                                  
 50517                                  	; 22/03/2024
 50518                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0CCEDh
 50519                                  
 50520                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 50521 00008AFD 9C                      	pushf
 50522 00008AFE 53                      	push	bx			; preserve bx
 50523 00008AFF 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 50524                                  
 50525 00008B01 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 50526 00008B03 50                      	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 50527 00008B04 9D                      	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 50528 00008B05 9C                      	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 50529 00008B06 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 50530 00008B07 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 50531 00008B0A 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 50532 00008B0D 740E                    	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 50533                                  
 50534 00008B0F B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 50535 00008B12 50                      	push	ax
 50536 00008B13 9D                      	popf
 50537 00008B14 9C                      	pushf
 50538 00008B15 58                      	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 50539 00008B16 2500F0                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 50540 00008B19 7401                    	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 50541                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 50542 00008B1B 43                      	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 50543                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 50544 00008B1C 43                      	inc	bx
 50545                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 50546 00008B1D 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 50547 00008B1F 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 50548 00008B20 9D                      	popf
 50549                                  	
 50550                                  	;endm
 50551                                  
 50552                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50553 00008B21 C3                      	retn	; 19/09/2023
 50554                                  
 50555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50556                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022

 51493                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51494                                  ;
 51495                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 51496                                  ;
 51497                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 51498                                  ;
 51499                                  ;	USED:	none
 51500                                  ;
 51501                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51502                                  
 51503                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 51504                                  ;
 51505                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 51506                                  ;
 51507 00008E43 50                      	push	ax
 51508                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 51509 00008E44 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 51510 00008E47 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 51511                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 51512                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 51513                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 51514 00008E49 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 51515 00008E4B 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 51516                                  ;
 51517                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 51518                                  ; need to call it later.
 51519                                  ;
 51520 00008E4D 53                      	push	bx
 51521 00008E4E 52                      	push	dx
 51522 00008E4F 1E                      	push	ds
 51523 00008E50 06                      	push	es
 51524                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 51525 00008E51 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 51526 00008E54 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 51527                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 51528                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 51529                                  
 51530 00008E56 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 51531                                  
 51532 00008E5B 891E[7B10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 51533 00008E5F 8C06[7D10]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 51534                                  cXMMexit:
 51535 00008E63 F8                      	clc
 51536 00008E64 07                      	pop	es
 51537 00008E65 1F                      	pop	ds
 51538 00008E66 5A                      	pop	dx
 51539 00008E67 5B                      	pop	bx
 51540 00008E68 58                      	pop	ax
 51541 00008E69 C3                      	retn				; done
 51542                                  ;
 51543                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 51544                                  ;
 51545                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 51546 00008E6A F9                      	stc
 51547 00008E6B 58                      	pop	ax
 51548 00008E6C C3                      	retn

 51550                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51551                                  ;
 51552                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 51553                                  ;
 51554                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 51555                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 51556                                  ;
 51557                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 51558                                  ;		   if AX =0
 51559                                  ;		      if first entry
 51560                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 51561                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 51562                                  ;		      else
 51563                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 51564                                  ;
 51565                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 51566                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 51567                                  ;
 51568                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 51569                                  ;
 51570                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 51571                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51572                                  
 51573 00008E6D 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 51574                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 51575                                  
 51576                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 51577                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 51578                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 51579                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 51580                                  
 51581                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (ref: PCDOS 7.1)
 51582                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D07Eh
 51583                                  
 51584                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 51585 00008E6E 1E                      	push	ds
 51586                                  
 51587 00008E6F 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 51588                                  
 51589 00008E74 E89300                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 51590                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 51591                                  	
 51592                                  	; 17/12/2022
 51593                                  	; cx = 0
 51594 00008E77 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 51595                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 51596 00008E79 754A                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 51597                                  	; 23/03/2024
 51598                                  	;or	ax, ax
 51599                                  	;jnz	short patch_vec_seg
 51600                                  
 51601                                  	; 23/03/2024
 51602                                  	;cmp	[cs:num_entry],al ; 0
 51603                                  	; 17/12/2022
 51604 00008E7B 2E380E[6D8E]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 51605                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this
 51606 00008E80 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 51607                                  					;    segment in ES
 51608                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub
 51609 00008E82 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 51610 00008E84 E84B00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 51611 00008E87 E8CA00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors
 51612                                  					; with those in the stub.
 51613                                  	; 17/12/2022
 51614                                  	; cx = 0
 51615                                  second_entry:

 51617

 51622                                  	
 51623                                  	; 17/12/2022
 51624                                  	; cx = 0
 51625                                  	;;mov	cx,9
 51626                                  	;mov	cl,9

 51628                                  	;;;
 51629                                  	;mov	cx,8
 51630 00008E8F B108                    	mov	cl,8
 51631                                  	;;;

 51633 00008E92 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 51634                                  
 51635                                  dosinttabloop:

 52044                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52045                                  ;
 52046                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 52047                                  ;
 52048                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 52049                                  ;
 52050                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 52051                                  ;
 52052                                  ;	Description:
 52053                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 52054                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 52055                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 52056                                  ;
 52057                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52058                                  
 52059                                  	; 04/11/2022
 52060                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BC50h
 52061                                  
 52062                                  	; 23/03/2024
 52063                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BF42h
 52064                                  	; 23/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 52065                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0D1E9h
 52066                                  
 52067                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 52068                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 52069                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 52070                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 52071                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 52072                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 52073                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 52074                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 52075                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 52076 00008FBF [9E0F]                  	dw	i0patch
 52077 00008FC1 [A80F]                  	dw	i20patch
 52078 00008FC3 [B20F]                  	dw	i21patch
 52079 00008FC5 [BC0F]                  	dw	i25patch
 52080 00008FC7 [C60F]                  	dw	i26patch
 52081 00008FC9 [D00F]                  	dw	i27patch
 52082 00008FCB [DA0F]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 52083 00008FCD [E40F]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 52084                                  
 52085                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 52086                                  
 52087                                  patch_in_nops:
 52088 00008FCF 50                      	push	ax
 52089 00008FD0 56                      	push	si
 52090 00008FD1 BE[BF8F]                	mov	si,patch_table
 52091 00008FD4 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 52092                                  	; 17/12/2022
 52093                                  	; cx = 0
 52094                                  	;mov	cx,8
 52095                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 52096 00008FD7 B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8

 52100                                  	;add	si,2

 52103 00008FDE 46                      	inc	si

 52105 00008FE1 5E                      	pop	si
 52106 00008FE2 58                      	pop	ax
 52107 00008FE3 C3                      	retn

 52200                                  ;============================================================================
 52201                                  ; MSCONST.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52202                                  ;============================================================================
 52203                                  ; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52204                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
 52205                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 52206                                  
 52207                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 52208                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52209                                  
 52210                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 52211                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 52212                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 52213                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 52214                                  ;
 52215                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 52216                                  ; describing that data item.
 52217                                  
 52218                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT
 52219                                  
 52220                                  ; 04/11/2022
 52221                                  ;[ORG 0]
 52222                                  
 52223                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52224                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52225                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52226                                  ; DOSDATA segment start offset from beginning of MSDOS.SYS file: 32432 (7EB0h)
 52227                                  ; (3DD0h+7EB0h = 0BC80h) - for MSDOS 5.0 kernel file -
 52228                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52229                                  
 52230                                  ; 04/11/2022
 52231

 52262

 52310                                  
 52311                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 52312                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52313                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 52314                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52315                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 52316                                  ;;
 52317                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 52318                                  ;;
 52319                                  ;;	on return:
 52320                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 52321                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 52322                                  ;;
 52323                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 52324                                  ;;
 52325                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 52326                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 52327                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 52328                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 52329                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 52330                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 52331                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 52332                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 52333                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 52334                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 52335                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 52336                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 52337                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 52338                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 52339                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 52340                                  ;;
 52341                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 52342                                  
 52343                                  ; The following block of data is used by SYSINIT. 
 52344                                  ; Do not change the order or size of this block
 52345                                  
 52346                                  ;SYSINITVAR:
 52347                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52348                                  SYSINITVARS:
 52349                                  DPBHEAD:
 52350 00000026 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of DPB-FAT list
 52351                                  SFT_ADDR:
 52352 0000002A [CC000000]              	dd	SFTABL	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to first SFT table
 52353                                  BCLOCK:
 52354 0000002E 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] The CLOCK device
 52355                                  BCON:
 52356 00000032 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Console device entry points
 52357                                  MAXSEC:
 52358 00000036 8000                    	dw	128	; [SYSTEM] Maximum allowed sector size
 52359                                  BUFFHEAD:
 52360 00000038 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of buffer queue
 52361                                  CDSADDR:
 52362 0000003C 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to curdir structure table
 52363                                  SFTFCB:
 52364 00000040 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] pointer to FCB cache table
 52365                                  KEEPCOUNT:
 52366 00000044 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] count of FCB opens to keep
 52367                                  NUMIO:
 52368 00000046 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] Number of disk tables
 52369                                  CDSCOUNT:
 52370 00000047 00                      	db	0	; [SYSTEM] Number of CDS structures in above
 52371                                  
 52372                                  ; A fake header for the NUL device

 52549                                  ;============================================================================
 52550                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52551                                  ;============================================================================
 52552                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 52553                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 52554                                  
 52555                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 52556                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52557                                  
 52558                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 52559                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 52560                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 52561                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 52562                                  ;
 52563                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 52564                                  ; describing that data item.
 52565                                  
 52566                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52567                                  
 52568                                  ;
 52569                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 52570                                  ;
 52571                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 52572                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 52573                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 52574                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 52575                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 52576                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 52577                                  ;
 52578                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 52579                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 52580                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 52581                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 52582                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 52583                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 52584                                  ;   as EOF).
 52585                                  
 52586                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 52587                                  
 52588                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 52589                                  
 52590                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 52591 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 52592 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 52593                                  		;dw 5 ; 24/03/2024
 52594 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 52595                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0 ; PCDOS 7.1  ; 24/03/2024
 52596 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 52597                                  
 52598                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 52599                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 52600                                  ; console.
 52601                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 24/03/2024
 52602 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 52603 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 52604                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 52605 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 52606 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 52607                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21) ; PCDOS 7.1
 52608 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 52609 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 52610 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b ; 3	; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 52611                                  switch_character:
 52612 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 52613 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 52614 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 52615 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 52616 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name

 52813 000003B2 0000                     		dw 0		; 24 bit user number
 52814 000003B4 00                      		db 0
 52815                                  ;IF IBM
 52816                                  ;IF IBMCOPYRIGHT
 52817                                  ; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS v7.1 IBMDOS.COM)	
 52818 000003B5 00                      OEMNUM:		DB 0		; 8 bit OEM number
 52819                                  ;ELSE
 52820                                  ;OEMNUM:	DB 0FFh		; 8 bit OEM number
 52821                                  ;ENDIF
 52822                                  ;ELSE
 52823                                  ;OEMNUM:	DB 0FFh		; (MSDOS 6.22) ; 24/03/2024

 52826                                  ;============================================================================
 52827                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 52828                                  ;============================================================================
 52829                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 52830                                  
 52831                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 52832                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 52833                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 52834                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 52835                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 52836                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 52837                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 52838                                  ; **********************************************************
 52839                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 52840                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 52841                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 52842                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 52843                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 52844                                  ; **********************************************************	
 52845                                  
 52846                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 52847                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52848                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 52849                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 52850                                  
 52851                                  ; 	ORG     0
 52852                                  
 52853                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 52854                                  
 52855                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 52856                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 52857 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 52858 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 52859                                  
 52860                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 52861                                  
 52862                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 52863                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 52864 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 52865                                  RENBUF:	
 52866 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 52867                                  
 52868                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 52869                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 52870 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 52871                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 52872 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 52873                                  
 52874                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 52875                                   
 52876                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 52877                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 52878                                  
 52879                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 52880                                  
 52881                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 52882                                  
 52883                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 52884                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 52885                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 52886                                  
 52887                                  NAME1:	
 52888 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 52889                                  NAME2:
 52890 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 52891                                  DESTSTART:
 52892 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 52893                                          ;DB	((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 52894                                  	;times	5  db	0
 52895 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 52896                                  
 52897                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 52898                                  
 52899 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 52900                                  EXTFCB:	
 52901 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 52902                                  SATTRIB:
 52903 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 52904                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 52905 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 52906                                  FOUNDDEL:
 52907 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 52908                                  FOUND_DEV:
 52909 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 52910                                  FSPLICE:
 52911 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 52912                                  FSHARING:
 52913 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 52914                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 52915 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 52916 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 52917 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 52918                                  THISDRV:
 52919 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 52920                                  CLUSFAC:
 52921 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 52922                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 52923 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 52924                                  INSMODE:
 52925 00000579 00                      	db	0		; true => insert mode in buffered read
 52926 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 52927 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;
 52928                                  EXIT_TYPE:
 52929 0000057C 00                      	db	0		; type of exit...
 52930                                  	; 24/03/2024	 
 52931 0000057D 00                      	db	0   ; PCDOS 7.1 - DOSDATA:057Dh

 53439                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:0CF5h
 53440                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53441                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0D6Bh
 53442                                  
 53443                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53444                                  ;
 53445                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 53446                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 53447                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 53448                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 53449                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 53450                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53451                                  ; Example:
 53452                                  
 53453                                  MAP_CASE:
 53454                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 53455                                  
 53456 00000D6B 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 53457                                  	;JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53458                                  	;RETF
 53459                                  	; 24/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 53460                                  	;;;
 53461 00000D6D 720C                    	jb	short L_RET     ;Map no chars below 80H ever
 53462                                  	;;;
 53463                                  Map1:
 53464 00000D6F 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 53465 00000D71 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 53466 00000D72 53                      	PUSH	BX
 53467 00000D73 BB[FC0A]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 53468                                  FINISH:
 53469 00000D76 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 53470 00000D77 1F                      	POP	DS
 53471 00000D78 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 53472 00000D79 5B                      	POP	BX
 53473 00000D7A 1F                      	POP	DS
 53474                                  L_RET:	
 53475 00000D7B CB                      	RETF
 53476                                  
 53477                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 53478                                  
 53479                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 53808                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 53809                                  ;
 53810                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 53811                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 53812                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 53813                                  ;
 53814                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 53815                                  ;
 53816                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 53817                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 53818                                  ;
 53819                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 53820                                  ;
 53821                                  ;############################################################################
 53822                                  
 53823                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 53824                                  
 53825                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53826                                  ; 24/03/2024
 53827                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0DDBh
 53828                                  
 53829                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53830                                  ;
 53831                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 53832                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 53833                                  ;
 53834                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 53835                                  ;
 53836                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 53837                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 53838                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 53839                                  ;
 53840                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53841                                  
 53842                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 53843                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 53844                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 53845                                  ;ELSE
 53846                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 53847                                  ;ENDIF
 53848                                  ;ENDM
 53849

 54202                                  
 54203                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54204                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 54205                                  ;
 54206                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 54207                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 54208                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 54209                                  ;
 54210                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 54211                                  ;
 54212                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 54213                                  ;
 54214                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54215                                  
 54216 00000F5D 36F6062003FF            	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 54217 00000F63 750C                    	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 54218 00000F65 36FF365803              	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 54219 00000F6A CD28                    	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 54220                                  
 54221                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54222                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 54223                                  ;
 54224                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 54225                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 54226                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 54227                                  ;
 54228                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54229                                  
 54230 00000F6C 803E200300              	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 54231 00000F71 7537                    	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 54232 00000F73 BCA00A                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
