 54301                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54302                                  ;
 54303                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 54304                                  ;
 54305                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 54306                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 54307                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 54308                                  ;
 54309                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 54310                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 54311                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 54312                                  ;	   4. else 
 54313                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 54314                                  ;	   6. endif
 54315                                  ;	7. else
 54316                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 54317                                  ;	9. endif
 54318                                  ;
 54319                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54320                                  
 54321                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 54322                                  
 54323                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54324                                  
 54325                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54326                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0F9Eh
 54327                                  
 54328                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54329                                  ;
 54330                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 54331                                  ;
 54332                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54333                                  
 54334                                  ldivov:
 54335                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54336                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54337                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54338                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54339                                  i0patch:
 54340 00000F9E EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 54341                                  
 54342 00000FA0 E8E200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54343                                  divov_cont:
 54344 00000FA3 2EFF2E[7A0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 54345                                  
 54346                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54347                                  ;
 54348                                  ; INT 20h Handler
 54349                                  ;
 54350                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 54351                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 54352                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 54353                                  ; will be restored then.
 54354                                  ;
 54355                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54356                                  
 54357                                  lquit:
 54358                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54359                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54360                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54361                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54362                                  i20patch:
 54363 00000FA8 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 54364                                  
 54365 00000FAA E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54366                                  quit_cont:
 54367 00000FAD 2EFF2E[7E0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 54368                                  
 54369                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54370                                  ;
 54371                                  ; INT 21h Handler
 54372                                  ;
 54373                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54374                                  
 54375                                  lcommand:
 54376                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54377                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54378                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54379                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54380                                  i21patch:
 54381 00000FB2 EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 54382                                  
 54383 00000FB4 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54384                                  command_cont:
 54385 00000FB7 2EFF2E[820F]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 54386

 54388                                  ;
 54389                                  ; INT 25h
 54390                                  ;
 54391                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54392                                  
 54393                                  labsdrd:
 54394                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 54395                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 54396                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 54397                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 54398                                  i25patch:
 54399 00000FBC EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 54400

 54402                                  absdrd_cont:

 54476                                  
 54477                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54478                                  
 54479                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54480                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54481                                  %if 0
 54482                                  
 54483                                  lirett:
 54484                                  	iret
 54485                                  
 54486                                  %endif
 54487                                  
 54488                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54489                                  ;
 54490                                  ; LowIntXX:
 54491                                  ;
 54492                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 54493                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 54494                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 54495                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 54496                                  ;
 54497                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 54498                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 54499                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 54500                                  ;
 54501                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 54502                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 54503                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 54504                                  ;
 54505                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54506                                  
 54507                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54508                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:0FEEh
 54509                                  ; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:10DBh)
 54510                                  
 54511 00000FEE 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 54512 00000FF2 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 54513                                  
 54514                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54515                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54516                                  %if 0
 54517                                  DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 54518                                  %endif
 54519                                  
 54520                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 54521                                  LowInt23:
 54522                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54523                                  					; the stack
 54524 00000FF6 2E8F06[EE0F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 54525 00000FFB 2E8F06[F00F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 54526                                  
 54527 00001000 CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 54528                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54529                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54530                                  
 54531 00001002 E88000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54532                                  
 54533 00001005 2EFF2E[EE0F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 54534                                  
 54535                                  
 54536                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 54537                                  LowInt24:
 54538                                  					; save the return address that is on
 54539                                  					; the stack
 54540 0000100A 2E8F06[F20F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 54541 0000100F 2E8F06[F40F]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 54542                                  
 54543 00001014 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 54544                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54545                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54546                                  
 54547 00001016 E86C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54548                                  
 54549 00001019 2EFF2E[F20F]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 54550                                  
 54551                                  
 54552                                   
 54553                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 54554                                  LowInt28:
 54555 0000101E CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 54556                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 54557                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 54558                                  
 54559 00001020 E86200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 54560                                  
 54561 00001023 CB                      	retf
 54562                                  
 54563                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 54564                                  
 54565                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54566                                  ;
 54567                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 54568                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 54569                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 54570                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 54571                                  ;
 54572                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 54573                                  
 54574                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54575                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1024h
 54576                                  
 54577                                  disa20_xfer:
 54578 00001024 E84800                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 54579                                  
 54580                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 54581                                  
 54582                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 54583                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 54584                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 54585                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 54586                                  
 54587 00001027 FA                      	cli
 54588 00001028 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 54589                                  
 54590                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54591                                  	;;;
 54592 0000102E 36C606[B812]00          	mov     byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG],0
 54593                                  	;;;
 54594                                  
 54595 00001034 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 54596 00001036 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 54597 00001038 FB                      	sti
 54598                                  
 54599 00001039 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 54600 0000103A 56                      	push	SI
 54601 0000103B 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 54602 0000103D 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 54603 0000103F 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 54604 00001041 CB                      	retf
 54605                                  
 54606                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54607                                  ;
 54608                                  ; M003:
 54609                                  ;
 54610                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 54611                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 54612                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 54613                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 54614                                  ; more info.
 54615                                  ;
 54616                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 54617                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 54618                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 54619                                  ;
 54620                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54621                                  
 54622                                  disa20_iret:
 54623 00001042 E82A00                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 54624 00001045 FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 54625                                  
 54626                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54627                                  	;;;
 54628 00001049 FE0E[B812]              	dec	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
 54629                                  	;;;
 54630                                  
 54631 0000104D 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 54632 00001051 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 54633 00001055 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 54634                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 54635 00001057 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 54636                                  	
 54637                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54638                                  %if 0
 54639                                  	mov	AX,[NSP]
 54640                                  	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 54641                                  	mov	AX,[NSS]
 54642                                  	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 54643                                  %else
 54644                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54645                                  	;;;
 54646                                  	;les	ax, dword ptr ds:NSS
 54647 0000105A C406[F005]              	les	ax,[NSS]
 54648 0000105E 8C06[8405]              	mov	[USER_SP],es
 54649 00001062 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],ax
 54650                                  	;;;
 54651                                  %endif
 54652 00001065 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 54653 00001066 5B                      	pop	BX
 54654 00001067 59                      	pop	CX
 54655 00001068 5A                      	pop	DX
 54656 00001069 5E                      	pop	SI
 54657 0000106A 5F                      	pop	DI
 54658 0000106B 5D                      	pop	BP
 54659 0000106C 1F                      	pop	DS
 54660 0000106D 07                      	pop	ES
 54661                                  lirett:		; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54662 0000106E CF                      	iret
 54663                                  
 54664                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54665                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 54666                                  ;
 54667                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 54668                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54669                                  ;
 54670                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 54671                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 54672                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 54673                                  ;
 54674                                  ;**************************************************************************
 54675                                  
 54676                                  XMMDisableA20:
 54677 0000106F 53                      	push	bx
 54678 00001070 50                      	push	ax
 54679                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 54680 00001071 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 54681 00001073 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54682 00001078 58                      	pop	ax
 54683 00001079 5B                      	pop	bx
 54684 0000107A C3                      	retn
 54685                                  
 54686                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 54687                                  
 54688                                  XMMcontrol:
 54689 0000107B 00000000                	dd	0

 54700                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54701                                  ;
 54702                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 54703                                  ;
 54704                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 54705                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 54706                                  ;
 54707                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 54708                                  ;
 54709                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 54710                                  ;		
 54711                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 54712                                  ;
 54713                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 54714                                  
 54715                                  ; 19/09/2023
 54716                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 54717                                  ;	dw	00080h
 54718                                  ;	dw	00000h
 54719                                  ;
 54720                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 54721                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 54722                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 54723                                  
 54724                                  	; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 54725                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1085h
 54726                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:116Fh)
 54727                                  
 54728                                  EnsureA20ON:
 54729 00001085 9C                      	pushf
 54730 00001086 1E                      	push    ds
 54731 00001087 06                      	push	es
 54732 00001088 51                      	push	cx
 54733 00001089 56                      	push	si
 54734 0000108A 57                      	push	di
 54735                                  
 54736                                  	; 19/09/2023
 54737                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 54738                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 54739                                  
 54740                                  	; 25/03/2024 
 54741                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 54742                                  	;;;
 54743 0000108B 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 54744 0000108D 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 54745 0000108F 4E                      	dec	si
 54746 00001090 BF9000                  	mov	di,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 54747 00001093 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
 54748 00001095 BE8000                  	mov	si,80h	; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 54749                                  	;;;	
 54750                                  
 54751 00001098 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 54752 0000109B FC                      	cld
 54753 0000109C F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 54754                                  
 54755 0000109E 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 54756                                  EA20_RET:
 54757 000010A0 5F                      	pop	di
 54758 000010A1 5E                      	pop	si
 54759 000010A2 59                      	pop	cx
 54760 000010A3 07                      	pop	es
 54761 000010A4 1F                      	pop	ds
 54762 000010A5 9D                      	popf
 54763 000010A6 C3                      	retn
 54764                                  
 54765                                  EA20_OFF:
 54766                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 54767                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 54768                                  
 54769 000010A7 53                      	push	bx
 54770 000010A8 50                      	push	ax
 54771                                  
 54772                                  ; 25/03/2024
 54773                                  %if 0
 54774                                  	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 54775                                  	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 54776                                  	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54777                                  	mov	ax,cs
 54778                                  	mov	ss,ax
 54779                                  %else
 54780                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54781                                  	;;;
 54782 000010A9 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 54783 000010AB 2E8C16[9A0F]            	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ss
 54784 000010B0 2E8926[9C0F]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 54785 000010B5 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 54786                                  	;;;
 54787                                  %endif
 54788 000010B7 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 54789                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 54790                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 54791 000010BA B405                    	mov	ah,5
 54792 000010BC 2EFF1E[7B10]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 54793 000010C1 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 54794 000010C3 740E                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 54795                                  
 54796                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 54797                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 54798                                  	;  25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54799                                  	;;;
 54800 000010C5 2E8E16[9A0F]            	mov	ss,[cs:SS_Save]
 54801                                  	;;;
 54802 000010CA 2E8B26[9C0F]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 54803                                  
 54804 000010CF 58                      	pop	ax
 54805 000010D0 5B                      	pop	bx
 54806                                  
 54807 000010D1 EBCD                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 54808                                  
 54809                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 54810 000010D3 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 54811 000010D5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54812 000010D7 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 54813 000010D9 7405                    	je	short XMMcont		; Y: do not change mode
 54814                                  	;xor	ah,ah ; 0		; set video mode
 54815                                  	;mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 54816                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54817                                  	;;;
 54818 000010DB B80200                  	mov     ax,2
 54819                                  	;;;
 54820 000010DE CD10                    	int	10h
 54821                                  XMMcont:
 54822                                  	;mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 54823                                  	;xor	al,al			; page 0
 54824                                  	; 25/03/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 54825                                  	;;;
 54826 000010E0 B80005                  	mov     ax,500h
 54827                                  	;;;
 54828 000010E3 CD10                    	int	10h
 54829                                  	
 54830 000010E5 BE[1312]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 54831 000010E8 0E                      	push	cs
 54832 000010E9 1F                      	pop	ds
 54833 000010EA FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 54834                                  XMMprnt:
 54835 000010EB AC                      	lodsb
 54836 000010EC 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 54837 000010EE 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh
 54838 000010F0 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 54839 000010F2 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 54840 000010F5 CD10                    	int	10h
 54841 000010F7 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 54842

 55263                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 55264                                  ;
 55265                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 55266                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 55267                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can.

 55277                                  ; DOSDATA:122Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 55278                                  
 55279                                  ; 09/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55280                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55281                                  
 55282                                  ; 17/01/2024
 55283                                  ; MSDOS 5.0  MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55284                                  ; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55285                                  ; 09/03/2024
 55286                                  ; Windows ME    IO.SYS - DOSDATA:122Ah
 55287                                  
 55288                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 55289                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 55290                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 55291                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.
 55292                                  
 55293                                  ; country and code page information
 55294                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55295                                  COUNTRY_CDPG:	; label  byte
 55296 0000122A 0000000000000000        	db   0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0		; reserved words
 55297 00001232 5C434F554E5452592E-     	db   '\COUNTRY.SYS',0		; path name of country.sys
 55297 0000123B 53595300           
 55298                                  	;db   51 dup (?)
 55299 0000123F 00<rep 33h>             	times 51 db 0
 55300                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55301                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 55302                                  ;  ifdef JAPAN
 55303                                  ;	dw   932			; system code page id (JAPAN)
 55304                                  ;  endif
 55305                                  ;  ifdef TAIWAN
 55306                                  ;	dw   938			; system code page id (TAIWAN)
 55307                                  ;  endif
 55308                                  ;  ifdef KOREA
 55309                                  ;	dw   934			; system code page id (KOREA IBM)
 55310                                  ;  endif
 55311                                  ;else
 55312 00001272 B501                    	dw   437			; system code page id
 55313                                  ;endif
 55314                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55315 00001274 0600                    	dw   6				; number of entries
 55316                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_76: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 76 
 55317 00001276 02                      	db   SetUcase  ; 2		; Ucase type
 55318 00001277 [FA0A]                  	dw   UCASE_TAB			;pointer to upper case table
 55319 00001279 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55320 0000127B 04                      	db   SetUcaseFile  ; 4		; Ucase file char type
 55321 0000127C [7C0B]                  	dw   FILE_UCASE_TAB 		;pointer to file upper case table
 55322 0000127E 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55323 00001280 05                      	db   SetFileList ; 5		; valid file chars type
 55324 00001281 [280D]                  	dw   FILE_CHAR_TAB 		;pointer to valid file char tab
 55325 00001283 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55326 00001285 06                      	db   SetCollate	; 6		; collate type
 55327 00001286 [FE0B]                  	dw   COLLATE_TAB		;pointer to collate table
 55328 00001288 0000                    	dw   0				; segment of poiter
 55329 0000128A 07                      	db   SetDBCS	; 7		;AN000; DBCS Ev			2/12/KK
 55330 0000128B [000D]                  	dw   DBCS_TAB			;AN000;pointer to DBCS Ev table	2/12/KK
 55331 0000128D 0000                    	dw   0				;AN000; segment of pointer	2/12/KK
 55332 0000128F 01                      	db   SetCountryInfo  ; 1	; country info type
 55333 00001290 2600                    	dw   NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE		; extended country info size
 55334                                  ; ------------------------------------------------<MSKK01>-------------------
 55335                                  ;ifdef	DBCS
 55336                                  ;	......
 55337                                  ;else

 55341 00001292 0100                    	dw   1				; USA country id
 55342 00001294 B501                    	dw   437			; USA system code page id
 55343                                  COUNTRY_CDPG_108: ; COUNTRY_CDPG + 108	
 55344 00001296 0000                    	dw   0 				; date format
 55345 00001298 2400000000              	db   '$',0,0,0,0		; currency symbol
 55346 0000129D 2C00                    	db   ',',0			; thousand separator
 55347 0000129F 2E00                    	db   '.',0			; decimal separator
 55348 000012A1 2D00                    	db   '-',0			; date separator

 55666                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 55667                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 55668                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 55669                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 55670                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 55671                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 55672                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 55673                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 55674                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 55675                                  
 55676                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55677                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55678                                  
 55679                                  ; 06/12/2022
 55680                                  ;DOSDATASIZE	equ  $ - DOSDATASTART ; 4962 bytes (1362h)
 55681                                  
 55682                                  ; DOSDATA ends
 55683                                  
 55684                                  ; 05/01/2024
 55685                                  %endif	; 05/11/2022
 55686                                  
 55687                                  ;============================================================================
 55688                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 55689                                  ;============================================================================
 55690                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 55691                                  
 55692                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 55693                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 55694                                  ;
 55695                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 55696                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 55697                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 55698                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 55699                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 55700                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 55701                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 55702                                  ; to call out here.
 55703                                  ;
 55704                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 55705                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 55706                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 55707                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 55708                                  ;
 55709                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 55710                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 55711                                  ;
 55712                                  ;Exported Functions
 55713                                  ;==================
 55714                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 55715                                  
 55716                                  ; DosData Segment
 55717                                  
 55718                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 55719                                  
 55720                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55721                                  
 55722                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 55723                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 55724                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 55725                                  ; 'patch' related.
 55726                                  
 55727                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 55728 0000133E 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 55729                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55730                                  
 55731                                  ; 25/03/2024
 55732                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1340h
 55733                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:133Eh)
 55734                                  
 55735                                  MagicPatch:
 55736                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 55737 00001340 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 55738 00001341 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 55739 00001342 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 55740 00001343 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 55741 00001344 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 55742 00001345 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 55743                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 55744                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 55745                                  
 55746                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55747                                  
 55748                                  ;DosData Ends
 55749                                  
 55750                                  ; MSDOS 5.0-6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSDATA:136Ah
 55751                                  ;
 55752                                  ; 25/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 55753                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSDATA:1346h
 55754                                  
 55755                                  ;; Windows ME IO.SYS
 55756                                  ;; db 12 dup(0)
 55757                                  
 55758                                  ; (Windows ME IO.SYS - DOSDATA:1344h)
 55759                                  
 55760                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55761                                  
 55762                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 55763                                  
 55764                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 55765                                  
 55766                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55767                                  ; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 Modification (paragraph alignment)
 55768                                  
 55769                                  ;db 0,1,12,64,19,0 ; ! Magic numbers !
 55770                                  
 55771                                  ;align 16
 55772                                  
 55773                                  ; !!! DOSDATA:1370h ; Retro DOS v4.0 only!
 55774                                  
 55775                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 55776                                  
 55777                                  ; 05/01/2024
 55778                                  ;%endif	; 05/11/2022
 55779                                  
 55780                                  ; 05/12/2022
 55781                                  ;MSDAT001E:	; label byte
 55782                                  
 55783                                  ; 22/03/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 55784                                  ; 05/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 55785                                  DOSDATAEND equ $
 55786                                  DOSDATASIZE equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4962 for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 55787                                  					; = 4970 for MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS
 55788                                  MSDAT001E equ DOSDATAEND - DOSDATASTART ; = 4934 for PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 55789                                  					; (= 4944 for Windows ME IO.SYS)
 55790                                  ;DOSDATALAST ENDS
